科號  Course Number ： 11010AES 450600學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 22
中文名稱  Course Title ：應⽤⽣態學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Applied Ecology
任課教師  Instructor ：楊樹森
上課時間  Time ： W2W3W4 上課教室  Room ：醫環 401 ／ 47
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程說明  應⽤⽣態學講述三⼤部份，前 1/3 講述基礎⽣態學理論之內容，讓未曾修習⽣態之學⽣先
有基本⽣態學概念，培養學⽣使其具備基本的知識，激發學⽣環保意識及⿎勵學⽣展現負責任的環
境⾏為。  第⼆部份則將⽣態學之基本知識應⽤於受傷害環境的⽣物復育、環境監測、⽣態監測及
環境影響評估，更進⼀步應⽤於環境棲地之經營管裡。第三部份則是⽣態學分⽀中的保育⽣物學應
⽤，分別敘述現地保育與移地復育的差別及經營⽅法。
指定⽤書  Ecology: Concepts and Applications (Botany, Zoology, Ecology and
Evolution) 7th Edition/Manuel Molles McGraw-Hill Education
參考書籍  Anne Goodenough and Adam Hart, 2017. Applied Ecology-Monitoring,
managing, and conserving, Oxford University press.
教學⽅式  Lecture and discussion
教學進度：
Part 1 Overview
1: Introducing Applied Ecology (1 hr)
2: Fundamentals of Ecology (14 hr)
Abiotic and biotic environmental factors
Untangling and tangling bank of ecology
Feeding relationships
Beneficial relationships between organism
Concept of niche
Competition
Life history
Population dynamics
Community structure
Biogeochemical cycle
Ecological service
Population genetics
Ecological succession
Global ecology and climate change
Part 2 Monitoring
3: Ecological Surveying and Monitoring (3hr)
Purpose of monitoring
Methods of monitoring
Monitoring of habitat
Monitoring species
Monitoring of population
From monitoring to managements
4: Ecological Indicators (3hr)
Type of indicators
Environmental indicators
Biological indicators
Biodiversity indicator
Part 3 Managing
5: Ecological Impact Assessment (6hr)
What is environmental impact assessment (ENIA)
What is ecological impact assessment (ECIA)
Assessing ecological value
Assessing the likely impacts
Mitigation and compensation strategies
Limitation and challenge
6: Remediation Ecology (6hr)
Pollution effects in ecosystem
General of bioremediation
Bioremediation: microorganism
Bioremediation: phytoremediation using plants
7: Managing Species over Space (3hr)
Landscape ecology elements and landscape ecology
Soundscape and soundscape ecology
Habitat loss and habitat fragmentation
Climate change effects
Landscape managements
8: Non-native Species (3hr)
Native species and invasive species
Translocation of a species
Impacts of invasive species
Global invasive species
Current invasive species in Taiwan
Importance of invasive species monitoring
Management issue
9: Managing pests and pest control (3hr)
What is pest
The theory of pest management
Management practice
Biological control
Integrated management
Part 4 Conserving
10: Principles of Conservation (3hr)
Conservation and risk of extinction
Strategies and decision making
11: In-situ conservation (3hr)
Definition of in-suit conservation
Protection area
Habitat managements
Public and policy
12: Ex-situ conservation (3hr)
Definition of ex-suit conservation
Ex-situ conservation procedure
Biotechnology application
Gene bank
13: Reintroduction/rewilding (3hr)
Basic principles of species reintroduce
Public and policy
Continuous monitoring of species
Future evaluation
成績考核  Mid-term : 35%
Final-term : 35%
Assignment : 20%
Others : 10%

中文名稱  Course Title ：專題演講
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Colloquium
任課教師  Instructor ：周⼦勤
上課時間  Time ： W7W8 上課教室  Room ：醫環 301 ／ 92
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
The departmental colloquium is a research talk that is supposed to be accessible
to everyone who does research in BMES department, i.e. it will assume that you
have familiarity with all the basic ideas of the field that everyone in the
department ought to know, but not a specialized knowledge of the subfield that
the talk is about. It ought to be pitched at the level of a beginning graduate
student.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
No textbook assigned.
三、參考書籍 (References)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Listening and Discussion
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
1.不分領域，本學期每⼈⾄少參加 10 次演講。
2.每學期每⼈⾄少發問 1 次  ( 全勤者可抵免；演講後附上問題交回助教登記 )
3.演講前、後均需簽到  ( 只簽到沒簽退者，倒扣⼀次 ) ，代簽者以不及格論處。

This course is designed for those students who have interest in environemntal
science and technology. Several fundamental courses including physical
chemistry, analytical chemistry and/or organic chemistry are needed.

Francis Group.

and Company.

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程名稱：環境微⽣物檢驗分析技術 Inspection and examination technology of
environmental microorganisms
⼆、學期 / 學分數： 3 學分
三、必選修：選修
四、課程說明：針對已具備微⽣物基礎之學⽣，提供現有微⽣物分離、鑑定及檢驗之概念與技術，
學
習有關環境中與環境、農業和醫學有關之各種微⽣物學的應⽤與鑑定檢驗技術，包括傳統及現代⽣
物
科技之鑑定檢驗技術，以作為往後環境領域中該類微⽣物學術研究與應⽤之必要基礎。

1.傳統鑑定法概論
2.形態鑑定法

7.食品微⽣物快速及⾃動化鑑定法
8.快速鑑定法與鑑定原理
9.食物中毒菌分離與鑑定技術
10.食物腐敗菌分離與鑑定技術
11.應⽤微⽣物之篩選與鑑定
12.微⽣物檢驗技術鑑定實習

科號  Course Number ： 11010AES 560400學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 15
中文名稱  Course Title ：環境品質與⽣物指標
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Envitronmental Quality and Bioindicator
任課教師  Instructor ：楊樹森
上課時間  Time ： R2R3R4 上課教室  Room ：醫環 717 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
This course begin with discussion about the implication between environmental
quality and bioindicator theoretically, and after with practical activities to
study the critical techniques of biological indication. The contemporary
requirement of good environmental quality for living in developed and
developing countries is higher than ever before. The physical and chemical
monitoring and evaluation of environmental quality by effective indication
depend on varies techniques to collect different parameters and reasonable
transformation to indicator. The effective physical and chemical indicator
could represent instant environmental quality in real condition precisely. In
point of fact, organism need time to respond to the environmental change,
instant indication by physical and chemical parameters still have to verify by
authentic condition of biological response for longer term. Development of
Bioindicators for environmental quality were according to different factors
(air, water and soil etc.) to select a group of organism with appropriate
pollution sensitivity and close ecological connection as a target group to
qualify or quantify environment factors by indexation. Environmental
monitoring or related research could evaluate the environmental quality
according to biological indexation base on investigation result.
Text book :
Reading material : Selected journal articles and scientific report.
Teaching Method
1. lecture
2. Autonomous study, assigned paper reading and discussion in class
3. Field work training and authentication
4. Lab. study and data collection procedure authentication
Syllabus
Week 1.Introduction to course content, and keyword for references searching
Week 2.The definition of environmental quality, the contemporary regulation
standards related to water, air, soil, noise and toxicants in Taiwan EPA. The
web information for regulation standards relate to water, air, soil, noise and
toxicants link to USEPA and EEA. New concept of human environmental
quality,the landscape and sondscape, and the criteria for inspection.
Week 3.Definition of ecological indicator, bioindicator. Why we need
bioindicator? The historical prospective of bioindicators. Indicator category:
Single indicator, composite indicator, specific indicator and general
indicator.
Week 4.Air quality index (AQI). The application of lichen and moss as air
quality bioindicators. The habitat characteristic of lichen and moss, their
response to air pollution and tolerance to pollutants.
Week 5.Field work, investigation of lichen and moss in urban area. Moss bag
setup training, basic lichen taxonomy and lab. Inspection.
Week 6.River pollution index (RPI); Water quality index (WQI); water quality
bioindicator: planktonic algae, benthic algae, microbiota
Week 7.Freshwater algae taxonomy in general: cynobacteria, golden alga,
Dinoflagellates, diatom, green alga, toxic algae
Week 8.The application of fish and invertebrate as bioindicator for water
quality.
Week 9.Midterm test
Week 10.Freshwater invertebrate taxonomy in general: mollusks, annelid,
arthropod (crustacean, aquatic insects)
Week 11.Field work, stream bioindicator study, algae and invertebrate
sampling, upstream low level pollution
Week 12.Field work, stream bioindicator study, algae and invertebrate
sampling, downstream high level pollution
Week 13.Lab. Workshop, algae and invertebrate study (Nada campus Room 4209)
Week 14.Lab. Workshop, algae and invertebrate study (Nada campus Room 4209)
Week 15.Soil quality and bioindicator
Week 16.Principles of statistic, development of specific indication
Week 17.Application of bioindicator for environmental assessment and
environmental monitoring
Week 18.Final term
Evaluation standard
1. Midterm test 30%
2. Final term test : 30%
3. Term paper and oral report ： 30%
4. General concern ： 10%

科號  Course Number ：
11010ANTH653500學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：中國少數⺠族
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Ethnic Minorities in China
任課教師  Instructor ：黃樹⺠
劉紹華
上課時間  Time ： M6M7M8 上課教室  Room ：⼈社 C303 ／ 10
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程簡介：
⺠族是什麼？種族⼜是什麼？從⼈類學的觀點來看，⺠族與種族的分類基礎是什麼？有無⽣物科學
的根據？什麼是「⺠族國家」？此外，不同的族群為何被稱為「少數⺠族」？這是因為「⾃我」與
「他者」的對照，由⾃詡為主流的「⾃我」所提出的詞彙，有何意義？本課程以此基本概念為出發
點，釐清⼈類學如何分類⼈群，以及在此脈絡下「少數⺠族」的境遇。本課程將「少數⺠族」的文
化特徵，放入⺠族國家、⾃我 - 他者對照、社會變遷、⽣存與發展的脈絡中來理解，⽽不以細究
「少數⺠族」的文化表徵為主要課程⽬標。有興趣修習本課程的同學，宜注意三個關鍵字，以理解
本課程的架構與⽬標：「中國」（作為⺠族國家與治理治權）、「⺠族」（在中國歷史⾄當代轉型
中的發展與變化）、「少數」（在⼀個多元族群社會中的意義與位置）。閱讀材料包括⼈類學、歷
史學、社會學、政治學、文學、醫療與科學⽅⾯的研究。

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Austronesian Taiwan
Instructor: Ku, Kun-hui
Time: Wed. 9am-12; Location: C304
office hours: by appointment
This seminar provides an overview of the studies on the Austronesian-
speaking peoples in Taiwan, whose linguistic diversity has been described as
“Taiwan’s Gift to the World”. It will start briefly with the archaeological
and linguistic importance of Taiwan in the theories of Austronesian
Expansion and then explore themes that are common to indigenous peoples of
Taiwan and the greater Austronesian world (e.g. house ideology, emplacement,
status competition and precedence, origin and ancestry etc.). Students will
be exposed to the Formosan cultural diversity and research potentials that
are crucial and current to the life of indigenous peoples on the island.
Attendance and discussion: 10%
Leading three sessions and bi-weekly reflection: 30%
Mid-term paper 30%
Final paper 30%

11010ASTR591000學分  Credit ： 1 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：專題演講⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Colloquium (I)
任課教師  Instructor ：何英宏
上課時間  Time ： F6F7 上課教室  Room ：物  124 ／ 137
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
Giving and listening to presentations, doing literature search, asking
constructive questions, and interacting with colleagues who work on different
topics and in different institutes are all essential professional skills not
only for doing astronomical research but also for careers in many other
disciplines. The weekly colloquia are excellent opportunities for practicing
these skills. For example, thinking about how others give presentations will
help you improve your own. Previewing relevant publications, even just
briefly, will improve understanding of the presentation and inspire deeper
questions. Interacting with visiting speakers will help you learn not only
about science, but also about different perspectives on life and work in the
world of professional astronomy.
● 成績考核 (Evaluation)
Grades of this course will be evaluated based on:
1. Attendance (80%): Please sign in using the sign-up sheet provided by the TA
for each colloquium. Students who attend all regular colloquia on Fridays will
receive full credits in this category. Attendance of the special seminars will
not be counted.
2. Participation (20%): Students are encouraged to interact with the speakers
and reflect on the colloquium. To receive the participation points, please
submit a short report to the TA within one week after the colloquium. Reports
on special seminars will be counted too.
● 可連結之網⾴位址  相關網⾴ (Website)
1. The colloquium schedule can be found on the IoA website:
http://astr.web.nthu.edu.tw
2. Course-related materials (e.g., report template) can be found on the google
classroom that will be sent out.
科號  Course Number ：
11010ASTR600700學分  Credit ： 1 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：天文物理的前沿⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Frontier of Astrophysics Seminars (I)
任課教師  Instructor ：後藤友嗣
上課時間  Time ： TnWnRn 上課教室  Room ：綜⼆ 501 ／ 25
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
-課程說明  (Course Description)
It is an important task for all researches to keep up with the latest
publications in the field. However, just in astronomy, nearly 40 new
papers are published every day. It is significant amount of work to
keep up with a flood of papers. The purpose of this course is to train
students how to read and understand the essence of new research papers
in a limited amount of time. Students will take no more than one hour
to read a paper of their choice, and take turn to present a short
summary in 10min. A focus is to understand the essence, and not to
understand details. It is not required to read all the details of
paper. At the same time, other students in the class have a good
chance to learn about latest papers, while listening to the speaker.
The instructor will teach a relevant physics/concept to the reviewed
paper after the presentation.
The course is on every Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday from 12:20pm to 13:10pm.
In one session, two papers will be reviewed. Therefore, in one
semester, we will review almost 100 papers.
By the end of the semester, students will be familiar with the latest
progress in astronomy.
Previous knowledge is not required. We would rather learn key concepts
of astronomy, as we come across in research papers. This is a more
practical and realistic way happening in every day research life.
This course will be offered in English.
-參考書籍  (References)
Papers to be presented are selected from the following archive servers.
http://nthu.voxcharta.org/
http://arxiv.org/list/astro-ph/new
-教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Presentations by students followed by a review by the instructor.
-成績考核 (Evaluation)
Attendance, questions, and presentations.
科號  Course Number ：
11010ASTR610000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 15
中文名稱  Course Title ：天文觀測
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Observational Astronomy
任課教師  Instructor ：江國興
上課時間  Time ： W6W7W8 上課教室  Room ：綜⼆ 521 ／ 45
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Course Description:
Please note that this course is a graduate course and you are expected to have basic skills of astronomical
observations with research grade telescopes. If you did not attend "Fundamentals of Observational
Astronomy ( 基礎天文觀測 )" (PHYS391 or PHYS392) before, you may be required to have an interview
before
admitting to this course.
The course will be conducted in English.
Overview:
An introduction to modern observational techniques of astronomy. The course will cover astronomical
observations across the electromagnetic spectrum, an introduction to gravitational wave and neutrino
observatories, and statistical analysis of astronomical data.
A visit (2 nights) to the Lulin Observatory will be arranged on Oct 29-31, and all the students are expected
to use the 1m telescope to carry out a small research project.
Teaching Method:
1. Lectures and tutorials
2. Demonstrations
3. Lab exercises
Syllabus:
Telescopes, CCD detectors, photometry, spectroscopy, interferometry, observational techniques of X-ray
astronomy, observation planning and review, data analysis, and model fitting
Evaluation:
Homeworks, observation exercises, projects, mid-term, and final examination
References:
1. Astronomy Methods by H. Bradt
2. Practical Statistics for Astronomers by J.V. Wall & C.R. Jenkins
3. Data Reduction and Error Analysis for the Physical Sciences by P.R. Bevington & D.K. Robinson
科號  Course Number ：
11010ASTR635000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：⾼能天文物理
英文名稱  Course English Title ： High Energy Astrophysics
任課教師  Instructor ：楊湘怡
上課時間  Time ： R6R7R8 上課教室  Room ：綜⼆ 501 ／ 25
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Syllabus -- High Energy Astrophysics (ASTR635)
High energy astrophysics is one of the core disciplines in modern Astronomy. It studies objects that are
relativistic in nature (such as neutron stars and black holes) and emit in the X-ray and gamma-ray bands,
though high energy processes can manifest themselves throughout the entire electromagnetic spectrum. The
course will present an integrated, in-depth description of modern high energy astrophysics.
This course is designed to provide graduate students background knowledge as well as trainings of research
skills that are essential for future research, including self-motivated learning, literature review, and
presentation skills. Specifically, in addition to lectures and homework assignments, there will be two oral
presentations: one on a recent news, one on a review paper; the topic can be any subject of your choice
related to high energy astrophysics. This course will be offered in English.
Topics that will be covered in this course:
-- Brief overview of high energy astrophysics and underlying physics
-- Radiative processes: synchrotron radiation, Comptonization, Bremsstrahlung, Cherenkov radiation
-- High energy particle astrophysics: particle acceleration, pair creation, hadronic processes, neutrino
production, cosmic rays
-- Compact objects: formation and properties of white dwarfs, neutron stars, and black holes
-- Accretion onto compact objects: dynamics, angular momentum transport, thermal and radiative properties
of different accretion flows
-- Astrophysical high energy objects: supernovae, pulsars, galaxy clusters, active galactic nuclei, X-ray
binaries, gamma-ray bursts
-- Observational high energy astrophysics: instrumentation, detectors, observational techniques
References: 
"High Energy Astrophysics", by M. S. Longair (2011) 
"High Energy Astrophysics", by F. Melia (2009) 
"Radiative Processes in Astrophysics", by G. B. Rybicki and A. P. Lightman 
Instructor:
Prof. Hsiang-Yi Karen Yang
Institute of Astronomy and Department of Physics
National Tsing Hua University
R504, General Building II
Email: hyang@phys.nthu.edu.tw
Evaluation:
Homework assignments (40%)
Midterm oral presentation (30%)
Final oral presentation (40%)
科號  Course Number ：
11010ASTR640000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：宇宙論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Cosmology
任課教師  Instructor ：安德魯 ˙ 古柏
上課時間  Time ： T6T7T8 上課教室  Room ：綜⼆ 521 ／ 45
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程說明  (Course Description)
This course is a graduate-level introduction to important topics of current
interest in cosmology, from an astronomer's perspective. The course will
concentrate on 'observational cosmology': parameterized models of the expansion
history of the Universe, the cosmological context of galaxy formation in the
concordance Dark Energy and Cold Dark Matter (LambdaCDM) model, and ways to
describe and measure the large-scale structure of the Universe.
We will aim to cover a broad range of topics at the expense of a rigorous
mathematical treatment. We will focus on connections between different topics in
cosmology and how cosmology informs current research in other areas of astronomy
and astrophysics, in particular galaxy formation.
PLEASE NOTE: the primary audience for this course are graduate students at the
Institute of Astronomy and senior undergraduates whose major is astrophysics.
A separate 'Introduction to Cosmology' course is offered at undergraduate level
and is strongly recommended for junior undergraduates or students with no prior
astronomy experience. This graduate course (ASTR640) will recap introductory
cosmology in the first few weeks and then go into greater depth, concentrating on
the evolution of large-scale structure. The course will also give a cosmology-
focused introduction to the some of the galaxy formation topics covered in
ASTR530.
Some familiarity with the basic concepts of general relativity will be helpful,
but not required. This course is intended for astronomers, will not cover details
of inflationary models, or the quantum mechanics, relativistic dynamics, and
radiative processes that are vital for understanding the Universe up to the epoch
of nucleosynthesis. Students interested in those topics are encouraged to seek out
more advanced courses in mathematics and particle physics.
The course will also introduce some common tools to perform cosmological
calculations. Some familiarity with basic python programming will be extremely
useful, but not essential and not assessed.
教學進度  (Syllabus)
* Overview of concepts, the history of the subject, and connections to other
fields;
* The consequences of curved and expanding spacetime, measures of distance, size
and time in cosmological models;
* Simple cosmological models, overview of the concordance Lambda-CDM model;
* The early universe in LambdaCDM (from inflation to the cosmic microwave
background);
* Evidence for Dark Matter and Dark Energy and alternatives to LCDM;
* The growth of structure in LambdaCDM (linear theory of gravitational clustering,
dark matter halo formation, nonlinear structure);
* Statistical measures of structure (correlation functions, power spectra, baryon
acoustic oscillations, redshift-space distortions);
* Observational probes of cosmic structure (focused on the galaxy-halo connection
in LCDM);
* Galaxy clusters and voids (including qualitative discussion of lensing and CMB
foreground effects);
The lectures will not follow the order of topics above exactly.
教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
Lectures, guided study.
成績考核  (Evaluation)
- Homework problems: these will be set approximately every two weeks throughout
the course.
- Final essay and presentation: time will be made available at the end of the
course for self-guided study of a chosen topic, to be written up as a short essay
and presented to the class.
Regular attendance and constructive contribution to class discussions will form
part of the grade.
This course will be offered and assessed in English.
指定⽤書  (Text Books)
Different sections of the course will be drawn from different textbooks. A plan
will be presented in class.
These two introductory textbooks are recommended because they cover more-or-less
the same topics of the first 2/3rds of the course in a similar order:
* "Introduction to Cosmology" by Barbara Ryden (2nd Ed., Cambridge University
Press, 2016)
* "An Introduction to Modern Cosmology" by Andrew Liddle (3rd Ed., Wiley, 2015).
The following graduate textbooks may also be helpful, particularly for the final
1/3 of the course:
* "Observational Cosmology" by S. Serjeant (Cambridge University Press, 2010).
* "Galaxy Formation" by M. Longair (2nd Ed., Springer, 2007)
* "Large-Scale Structure of the Universe" by P.J.E. Peebles (Princeton University
Press, 1980)
Advanced reference books:
* "Galaxy Formation and Evolution” by H. Mo, S. White & F. van den Bosch
(Cambridge University Press, 2010).
* "Cosmological Physics" by J.A. Peacock (Cambridge University Press, 1999).
Textbooks and other references will be discussed in the first class.
參考書籍  (References)
The following tools may prove useful. A more comprehensive list and explanations
will be given in class.
* Ned Wright's Cosmology Calculator:
http://www.astro.ucla.edu/~wright/CosmoCalc.html (useful for quick calculations)
* ICosmos Cosmology Calculator: http://www.icosmos.co.uk (makes plots)
* Astropy Cosmology package: http://docs.astropy.org/en/stable/cosmology/
* NASA LAMBDA: https://lambda.gsfc.nasa.gov/ (archive of CMB data and tools)

科號  Course Number ： 11010BAI 700100學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 20
中文名稱  Course Title ：統計與機器學習概論⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction of Statistics and Machine Learning (I)
任課教師  Instructor ：張筱涵
楊立威
洪樂文
李祈均
上課時間  Time ： T2T3T4 上課教室  Room ：綜⼆ 103 ／ 47
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
統計與機器學習概論⼀ (Introduction of Statistics and Machine Learning (I)) is designed
for machine learning beginners where many examples (but not all) are
made for students with biomedical background. The class lays mathematical
foundations for its sequel class 統計與機器學習概論⼆ (Introduction of Statistics and
Machine Learning (II)) that we recommend against students to take if (I) or
similar has never been taken. These relevant mathematical concept and details
include but not limited to relation between statistics and probability, concept of
and inference from sampling, distributions, linear algebra, linear transformation,
regression and correlation, Goodness-of-fit test, Discriminant analysis, Training
Methods, Maximum Likelihood and Bayesian Parameter Estimation
and ODEs applied for biomedical research, Decision Trees, Estimators, Decisions
and Machine Learning Basics. Python workshop is provided along with the class
where the successful completion of two homework in the class requires programming
skills.
Teachers: 楊立威、張筱涵、洪樂文、李祈均老師  (Profs LW Yang, HH Chang, YW Hong, CC Lee)
Textbooks:
1. https://www.amazon.com/Analysis-Biological-Data-Michael-
Whitlock/dp/0981519407 (@NTHU library)
2. Biological Sequence Analysis Probabilistic Models of Proteins and Nucleic
Acids (@NTHU library)
3.
Weeks:
1. 9/14. From the things you already knew (to some extent) – mean, SD,
variance, how is statistics related to probability? Comparing two means (doing it
with your MS Excel sheet). Why does statistics/probability constitute the basics
of machine learning (examples on drug development and exercise prescription)?
(LW Yang)
9/21, 9/28 holidays – Self-study on math chapters
2. 10/5. Read the math formula – index, difference between probability
(discrete function) and probability density (continuous function), learning
summation/multiplication signs in the games to align two protein sequences (LW
Yang).
3. 10/12 Distributions Rules Probability addition/multiplication, dependency,
conditional probability, marginal probability and Bayes' theorem (LW Yang)
4. 10/19. definition of important names, sampling biases and rules, Inference
from samples A (w1, HH Chang)
5. 10/26 Inference from samples B (w4, HH Chang)
6. 11/2 Goodness-of-fit test, contingency analysis and one sample inference
(w6/7, HH Chang)
7. 11/9 Comparing of two means (continued), (Relative) Entropy, Information
Content, “Distance” between Distributions, Boltzmann Relation and Normalization –
frequency vs proportion, normalization by controls, by ranking, by probability (LW
Yang)
8. 11/16 Correlation and Regression (HH Chang)
9. 11/23 ODE & Chain Rule & Back-propagation of layers of Perceptrons (by YW
Liu)
10. 11/30 Detection Theory (YW Hong)
11. 12/7 Estimation Theory (YW Hong)
12. 12/14 Moving Towards Data-Driven Techniques (YW Hong)
13. 12/21 Introduction to Machine Learning (CC Lee)
14. 12/17 Manners of Learning (Supervised, Unsupervised, Semisupervised)(CC Lee)
15. 1/4 ML Experiment Setup (Training, Testing, Cross validation)(CC Lee)
16. 1/11 Final Exam
Grading:
Two math exams (10% each), two statistics/probability homework (10% each), two
computational homework (15% each – Protein Sequence Aligner & CpG island predictor
using log-odds) due on 1/16, 2022.
Final(30%)
With programming workshop:
Python programming taught in 10+ weeks + one session of basic Linux

科號  Course Number ： 11010BME
500700學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：⽣醫材料特性分析
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Analytical and Sensing Technologies in Biomedical Sciences
任課教師  Instructor ：萬德輝
上課時間  Time ： R9RaRb 上課教室  Room ：清實 826 ／ 24
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course is divided into 2 semesters, including basic analytical theory (I) and instrumental sensing methods
(II). Semester One introduces fundamental concepts of analytical chemistry with an emphasis on the
approaches relevant to measurements in biochemistry. Topics include error analysis, statistical treatment of
data, acid-base chemistry, titrations, spectroscopy, and chromatography.
本⾨課將分為上下學期教授，涵蓋基礎分析化學理論 ( 上學期 ) 以及儀器感測⽅法 ( 下學期 ) ，並著重分析
化學在⽣物醫學⼯程之應⽤實例。在上學期的課程中，將以建立良好化學基礎為主軸，引導學⽣從邏
輯思考進⽽瞭解⽣物分析化學原理，同時增強學⽣應有的實驗理論，包含統計學、資料處理分析、酸
鹼滴定、錯合物滴定、氧化還原滴定、光譜學、層析法及電化學，並針對⽣物分⼦進⾏其分析技術之
介紹。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Lecture notes
三、參考書籍 (References)
1.D. A. Skoog, D. M. West, F. J. Holler, and S. R. Crouch, "Fundamentals of Analytical Chemistry", 9th Ed.,
Mary Finch.
2.A. Manz, N. Pamme, and D. Iossifidis, "Bioanalytical Chemistry", 2004, Wiley.

五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1.Introduction to Analytical Chemistry
2.Tools of Analytical Chemistry:
Errors in Chemical Analyses and Chemical Equilibria
3.Classical Methods of Analysis:
Gravimetric Methods, Titrations, and Complex Acid/base System
4.Spectrochemical Analysis:
Instruments, Absorption, Fluorescence, Atomic, and Mass Spectrometry
6.Kinetics and Separations:
Gas Chromatography and High Performance Liquid Chromatography
7.Molecular Recognition:
Bioassays, Biosensors, DNA-Arrays and Pyrosequencing

科號  Course Number ： 11010BME
500800學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 24
中文名稱  Course Title ：癌症⽣物學與治療
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Cancer Biology and Therapy
任課教師  Instructor ：陳韻晶
上課時間  Time ： M5M6M7 上課教室  Room ：清實 826 ／ 24
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀. 課程⽬標 (Course objective)
1. Develop basic concepts of Cancer Biology
2. Learn to integrate and apply various concepts to Cancer Therapy
⼆. 課程說明 (Course Description)
The impact of cancer on human health is immense, driving force to accelerate research effort
on
understanding of the basic biology of cancer, leading to more effective treatment strategies
and more
sensitive and accurate diagnosis tools. This course will provide a comprehensive coverage of
virtually all
areas of cancer research, emphasizing the cellular and molecular basis of cancer and
development of
therapeutic strategy. The first half of the course will discuss the genetic and molecular basis
of cancer. We
will explore the regulation of cell cycle, cell death, cell signaling and metabolism in cancer.
The second
half
of the course will focus on the tumor microenvironment and therapy strategy. We will shift our
attention to
the surrounding stromal cells instead of cancer cells. Every lecture will include a discussion of
the rational
treatment of cancer. In the final section, we will explore the development of novel therapeutic
strategies for
cancer.
⼆、指定⽤書或參考書籍 (Text Books and References)
The Biology of Cancer, 2nd edition, 2013; Garland Science; Robert A. Weinberg.
三、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Exam (mid-term and final) 60%
Writing assignment 20%
Group performance 10%
Attendance 10%
四、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction of Cancer Biology and Therapy
2. Cell cycle and Cancer
3. Senescence and Cancer
4. Cell death and Cancer
5. Apoptosis, Autophagy and Cancer
6. Cell signaling and Cancer
7. Midterm
8. metabolism and Cancer
9. Angiogenesis and Cancer
10. metastasis I
11. metastasis II
13. Cancer immunity
14. Cancer Diagnosis and Treatment
15. Cancer Nanotech
16. Final Exam
五. 講師  (Instructor)
Dr. Yunching Chen

This course provides an introduction for students to understand Advanced
Bioelectronics Materials with a broad range of backgrounds from Science to
Engineering. It will cover the recent advances in the development of
bioelectronics systems and their potential application in future biomedical
applications starting from system design to signal processing for
physiological monitoring, to in-situ biosensing.

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程簡述  (Brief course description)
This course aims that the students obtain basic knowledge about the synthetic biotechnology and its
application for regenerative medicine. The objectives are given that students will learn about advanced
molecular biology tools for specific applications. Emphasis is on exploring the potential of synthetic biology
as an approach in regenerative medicine and stem cell engineering.
指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Huimin Zhao et al. Synthetic Biology: Tools and Applications. Academic Press, 2013.
教學進度 (Syllabus)
Week 1. What is synthetic biology?
Week 2. Introduction to molecular biology
Week 3. Biotechnology
Week 4. Principles of synthetic biology
Week 5. Fundamental engineering concepts in application to synthetic biology
Week 6. Synthetic biology toolkit
Week 7. Protein engineering
Week 8. Pathway engineering
Week 9. From biological parts to circuit design
Week 10. Biosynthesis and controlled release of therapeutic molecules
Week 11. Production of improved scaffolds for tissue engineering
Week 12. Regulation of stem cells
Week 13. Programming cells to construct designer tissues
Week 14. Synthetic biology and biomaterials
成績考核 (Evaluation)
Class Participation: 10%
Term report: 30%
Midterm exam: 30%
Final exam: 30%

任課教師  Instructor ：陳之碩

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Course Description:
This is one-semester based introduction to probability and statistics for
undergraduate students in engineering. The course aims to provide elementary
topics needed for an understanding of basic statistics and its applications.
Topics cover probability, random variables, sampling, point estimation,
statistical intervals, test of statistical hypotheses, and linear regression.
Statistics program R will be introduced in class.
1.Text Book:
R26;Applied Statistics and Probability for Engineers,
Douglas C. Montgomery, 6th Edition, 2014. John Wiley & Sons
2.References:
R26;Essentials of Probability and Statistics for Engineers & Scientists Ronald
E.
Walpole, 2013. Pearson
R26;Statistics for Engineers and Scientists,
William Navidi, 4th Edition, 2014. McGraw-Hill
3.Teaching Methods:
Lectures
4.Syllabus:
1.Introduction to Statistics and Probability
2.Random variables
3.Probability distributions
4.Sampling distributions
5.Point estimation of parameters
6.Statistical intervals
7.Test of statistical hypotheses
8.Simple linear regression and correlation
5.Evaluation:
Midterm I (25%)
Midterm II (25%)
Final Exam (30%)
Homework/quiz (20%)

3. 評分⽅式：各實驗負責老師針對所負責的實驗評分。期末成績以各老師之授課時間權重
後
相加平均。
4. 出席：遲到 10 分鐘內扣該實驗成績的 20% ，超過 10 分鐘該實驗成績零分。未到者該實驗
零
分。若有由正當程序請假，實驗負責老師認可後，可找各實驗助教補做實驗。
5. 報告繳交：統⼀於實驗下⼀次上課時繳交，課堂開始時收⿑，遲交以零分計算。若上課
老
師不同，請各老師協助移交報告。

課程簡述  (Brief course description)
This course provides students with basic mathematics knowledge and computational tools for solving science
and engineering problems. Topics that will be covered include modeling, computers and error analysis, roots
and optimization, linear systems, curve fitting.
課程⼤綱  (Syllabus)
Course keywords: Numerical methods, modeling, roots and optimization, linear systems, curve fitting,
integration and differentiation.
Course description:
PART ONE Modeling, Computers, and Error Analysis
Chapter 1 Mathematical Modeling, Numerical Methods, and Problem
Solving
Chapter 4 Roundoff and Truncation
Errors
PART TWO Roots and Optimization
Chapter 5 Roots: Bracketing Methods
Chapter 6 Roots: Open Methods
Chapter 7 Optimization
PART FOUR Curve Fitting
Chapter 14 Linear Regression
Chapter 15 General Linear Least-Squares and Nonlinear Regression
Chapter 17 Polynomial Interpolation
Chapter 18 Splines and Piecewise Interpolation
PART FIVE Integration and Differentiation
Chapter 19 Numerical Integration Formulas
Chapter 20 Numerical Integration of Functions
Chapter 21 Numerical Differentiation
PART SIX Ordinary Differential Equations
Chapter 22 Initial-Value Problems
Textbook:
Steven C. Chapra, Applied Numerical Methods with MATLAB for Engineers and Scientists, 4th., McGraw-
Hill, (2018)
References:
1.Abdelwahab Kharab and Ronald B. Guenther, An Introduction to Numerical Methods - A MATLAB
Approach, 3rd Ed., CRCPress, (2012).

University Press, (2011)
3. J. Douglas Faires and Richard L. Burden, Numerical Methods, 4th Ed.,Cengage, (2013)

11010BMES327200學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 30
中文名稱  Course Title ：⽣醫材料
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Biomedical Materials
任課教師  Instructor ：胡尚秀
上課時間  Time ： W3W4F3 上課教室  Room ：醫環 717 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
This course is to provide the students who lack basic training in materials
science an introduction to the fundamental concepts of biomaterials, including
three types of biomaterials (metals, ceramics and synthetic and natural
macromolecules) and their chemical structure, physical properties, processing
and
applications. Biocompatibility of materials pertinent to their applications in
biomedical engineering is the other important issue to be given in this course.
This includes the interactions of biomaterials with proteins and cells and
biomaterial-elicited specific immune responses.
⼆、指定⽤書  (Text Books)
1. W. D. Challister, Materials Science and Engineering, 8th Ed..
2. B. D. Ratner, Biomaterials Science, 3rd Ed., 2013.
3. S. V. Bhat, Biomaterials, Alpha Science, 2nd Ed., 2005.
4. W. Smith, Foundations of Materials Science and Engineering, McGraw-Hill, 2nd
Ed., 1993.
四、教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
Lectures
五、教學進度  (Syllabus)
Contents
1. Introduction
2. Atomic structure and Bonding
3. Crystalline Solids
4. Imperfection in Solid
5. Strengthening Mechanism
6. Mechanical Properties of Materials
7. Phase Diagrams
8. Biomaterial Applications
9. Functional Biomaterials

30% The 2nd Midterm Exam

11010BMES337100學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：物理化學⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Physical Chemistry (I)
任課教師  Instructor ：吳劍侯
上課時間  Time ： M3M4W1W2 上課教室  Room ：醫環 717 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
開課對象 : 醫環系⼆年級以上
課程內容 :
Physical chemistry is the branch of chemistry that establishes and develops the
principles of the subjects. Its concepts are used to explain and interpret
observations on the physical and chemical properties of matter. Physical
chemistry is also essential for developing and interpreting the modern
techniques used to determine the structure and properties of matter. The
course will focus on the topic of equilibrium.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Engel, T.; Reid, P. Physical Chemistry, 3rd ed., Pearson New International
Edition, Pearson Education Limited, Harlow, Essex, England, 2014.
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. Atkins, P. W.; de Paula, J. C. Physical Chemistry, 10th ed., Freeman, New
York, NY, 2014.
2. Ball, D. W. Essentials of Physical Chemistry, Cengage Learning, Taipei,
Taiwan, ROC, 2014.
3. Silbey, R. J.; Alberty, R. A.; Bawendi, M. G. Physical Chemistry, 4th ed.,
John Wiley & Sons, New York, NY, 2005.
4. Mortimer, R. G. Physical Chemistry, 3rd ed., Harcourt/Academic Press, San
Diego, CA, 2008.
5. Laidler, K. J.; Meiser, J. H.; Sanctuary, B. C. Physical Chemistry, Houghton
Mifflin, Boston, MA, 2003.
6. McQuarrie, D. A.; Simon, J. D. Physical Chemistry: A Molecular Approach,
University Science Books, Sausalito, CA, 1997.
7. Levine, I. N. Physical Chemistry, 6th ed., McGraw-Hill, New York, NY, 2009.
8. Castellan, G. W. Physical Chemistry, Addison-Wesley, Reading, MA, 1983.
9. Klotz, I. M.; Rosenberg, R. M. Chemical Thermodynamics: Basic Theory and
Methods, 6th ed., John Wiley, New York, NY, 2000.

11010BMES433100學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 170
中文名稱  Course Title ：全球能源短缺衝擊
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Impact of Global Energy Shortage
任課教師  Instructor ：鍾堅  Chung Chien
上課時間  Time ： R7R8 上課教室  Room ：醫環 120 ／ 150
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
D 課程說明 (Course Description)
熱⾨發燒話題  : 油價⽔價電價漲不停！百物跟著驚驚漲！資源會不會在有⽣之年，終有⽤罄的⼀天
呀？
再過⼆⼗年，中壯年的你，屆時將⾯對全球暖化、無油可購、掠奪資源導致戰火四起的困局！你是否
想知
道：
-- 清華⼤學光復校區， 78 年前是⼤⽇本帝國海軍第六燃料廠所屬燃料合成分部的新⽵⽀廠軍事營區；
-- 成功湖曾被⼤⽇本帝國海軍作為消防池與提供⽣產流程的飼⽔池；
-- 新⽵都⼼的巨城購物中⼼，曾是⽣產酒精代⽤航空燃料的⼤⽇本製糖株式會社之製糖所與酒精⼯
場；
-- 我國天然氣的安全存量不到⼀週，若進⼝運輸不穩，極易造成全島 “ 斷氣 ” ；
-- 東協各國正在開挖我國固有海疆南沙群島曾⺟暗沙海床下的油氣蘊藏；
-- 按照全球原油的年耗量前推預估，具可採經濟價值的油⽥僅能再供應 49 年；
-- 按照全球核能電廠核燃料的年耗量，前推預估鈾礦亦僅能再供應 112 年；
⾯對嚴峻的能源短缺挑戰，只有常識與知識充⾜的青年朋友，將來才能肆應激
烈的變局；想要充實全球暖化與能源短缺⽅⾯的常識與知識，須選修本學期的
“全球能源短缺衝擊 ” (Impact of Global Energy Shortage)

因應新冠疫情，暫⾏改為遠距教學，透過校園資訊平台 https://eeclass.nthu.edu.tw 學習；疫情解除
後始恢復課堂講授、專題講座、影⾳教學與堂課考試
K 教學進度 (Syllabus) ：
(1) 能源類型  ：  化⽯能源不潔淨，綠⾊能源不經濟
使⽤能源最終以熱能、動能或電能輸出；理想能源四要素為潔淨、永續、可靠與經濟。能源可分為再
⽣能
源如⽔⼒能與非再⽣能源如原油，亦可分為含碳能源如煤炭與無碳能源如風⼒能，也可分為低碳能源
如天
然氣與⾼碳能源如薪柴
(2) 能源轉電能  ：  沒電不好活，斷電不能活
沒⽔怎能活？沒電如何活？全球能源消耗的五成四，係以電能輸出，各類能源均可⽤來發電如核能，
⽤⼾
與電廠間全靠輸配電系統聯接，可千萬不能斷；善意提醒⽤⼾內的家電如吹風機及⼾外的⾼壓電塔，
都會
釋出影響健康的電磁波
(3) 全球非再⽣能源供需  ：  供不應求，遲早耗盡
⼯業⾰命以來的這百多年，⼈類耗能⼤增，非再⽣能源的油、氣、煤礦等化⽯燃料，需億年以上由地
底古
⽣物殘骸烘焙、擠壓⽽成，鈾礦⾃地球⽣成後就不再增⽣。以上含碳的油、氣、煤礦化⽯燃料與無碳
的鈾
礦製成之核燃料，愈挖愈少，遲早耗盡
(4) 能源供需群雄  ：  臺灣沒能源，就得學節能
消耗吞噬能源的五⼤巨龍依序為⼤陸、美國、印度、俄羅斯與⽇本，主要能源供應國的天然氣為美國
(佔全
球氣供應的 22%) ，原油亦為美國 ( 佔全球油供應的 17%) ，煤炭為⼤陸 ( 佔全球煤供應的 51%) ，耗盡後全
球暖
化增溫⾄少攝⽒ 6.4 度！
(5) 臺灣能源供需  ：  能源進⼝靠海運，寶島南電要北送
曾經富甲⼀⽅的寶島，有苗栗錦⽔油⽥、基隆瑞芳煤⽥、新⽵寶⼭天然氣⽥。⽇本取臺時期，有臺灣
糖業
各株式會社的⽣質燃料，與臺電株式會社⽔⼒、火⼒發電廠。如今，臺灣能源 96.2% 靠進⼝，其中近
六成
耗能⽤來發電；供需失衡故南電要北送，且輸配電系統年年要翻修
(6) 我國非核家園  ：  ⽇本海嘯震駭，減核與廢核
發電成本看似低廉的無碳核能，為何成為激情議題？核廢棄物要何去何從？放你家⾨⼝你願意嗎？核
電廠
的核災或恐怖攻擊核設施會發⽣在我國嗎？為何年年都得舉辦核災演習？萬⼀有恐怖集團從耗乏核燃
料中
提煉鈽製造核武 ... 核電能源，無可迴避有核廢、核災、核武擴散、輻射謀害與核恐攻之 " 五核⼀夢
魘"！
(7) ⼤陸能源供需  ：  經濟不斷翻⼜翻，供能永遠不夠⽤
改⾰開放後的⼤陸，供能與耗能都是全球第⼀ ( 美國均居次 ) ，雖然⽔⼒、煤炭、再⽣能源與鈾礦勉強
⾃給
⾃⾜，但⾃有原油供應不及耗量三成，需⾃中東與中亞⼤量進⼝，南海油氣⽥⼜遭鄰國竊佔，⼤陸要
躋⾝
為世界強國，勢必⽤⼀帶⼀路出境購油取氣！
(8) 能源戰爭臺灣版  ：  話說⽇本取臺末期，美軍封鎖臺灣能源
⼯業⾰命以來就為資源⽽發動戰爭，戰耗也需要能源；臺灣能源第⼀戰就是公元 1932~45 年間的⼤東
亞戰
爭，⽇軍把臺灣建設為侵略南洋的 “ 圖南⾶⽯ ” 出境奪油，  終戰前臺灣能源建設，全毀於美軍轟炸
(9) 能源戰爭未來版  ：  我國斷油就癱瘓，世界奪油就⼤戰
下⼀場奪油戰爭將在亞⻄的伊朗與南美的委內瑞拉開打，接著就是南海⼤戰列強奪取南沙油⽥。我國
買不
起甚⾄買不到油品，政府怎麼辦？永久缺電甚⾄停電，⺠眾該怎麼辦？為什麼缺電隨後就缺⽔？沒
油、沒
電、沒⽔的⽇⼦，政府與⺠眾要怎麼過⽇⼦呀？
(10) 耗能與環境衝擊  ：  耗能過度則暖化浩劫，耗能不當則⽣態遭劫
綠⾊無碳能源的風能有葉片旋轉噪⾳、太陽能會破壞景觀、海洋能擾亂海域⽣態、⽣質能打亂農作物
供需
平衡、⽔⼒能阻斷河川⽣態。含碳化⽯燃料產⽣巨量⼆氧化碳，核能⼜有 “ 五核⼀夢魘問題 ” 。還有什
麼的
能源不惹⼈嫌 …. 古早的再⽣⼈⼒能？獸⼒能？

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程說明
介紹臨床醫學的基本觀念，討論和其相關的議題，瞭解各科疾病，諸如 : 內科、外科、婦產
科、⼩兒科、急救等之臨
床表徵及其治療上的重點，當今治療⾯臨的問題，並學習與⽇常⽣活習習相關的醫療知識，最後
展望未來醫學發展，
推展⽣醫科技領域當中基礎與臨床之結合。
將專業艱澀的醫學知識，由受過醫環系教育的醫師整理介紹給醫環系或相關科系學⽣，藉以了
解醫環系的研究如何
在臨床醫學中找到相對應的研究題⽬。或是藉由課程的修習，能增加醫學常識，促進⾃⼰及周遭
親朋好友的健康。

教學進度

中文名稱  Course Title ：專題演講
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Colloquium
任課教師  Instructor ：邱信程
林曉均
上課時間  Time ： W7W8 上課教室  Room ：醫環 120 ／ 150
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
The departmental colloquium is a research talk that is supposed to be
accessible to everyone who does research in BMES department, i.e. it will
assume that you have familiarity with all the basic ideas of the field that
everyone in the department ought to know, but not a specialized knowledge of
the subfield that the talk is about. It ought to be pitched at the level of a
beginning graduate student.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
No textbook assigned.
三、參考書籍 (References)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Listen and Discussion

11010BMES520200學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：⽣醫感測器
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Biomedical Sensors
任課教師  Instructor ：劉耕⾕
上課時間  Time ： M5M6M7 上課教室  Room ：醫環 101 ／ 56
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
中文名稱  Course title: ⽣醫感測器
英文名稱  Course English title: Biomedical Sensors
課程簡述  (Brief course description): This course will provide students with the basic introduction of physical,
chemical, and biological sensors. The purpose of this course is to introduce the basic design and working
principles of various biomedical sensors that are currently used in biomedical research and the healthcare
industry. Recent advances and trends of biosensing technologies and future biosensing platforms will also be
discussed.
課程說明 (Course Description)
This course will provide students with the basic introduction of physical, chemical, and biological sensors. The
purpose of this course is to introduce the basic design and working principles of various biomedical sensors
that are currently used in biomedical research and the healthcare industry. Recent advances and trends of
biosensing technologies and future biosensing platforms will also be discussed.
指定⽤書  (Textbook): None
參考書籍  (References):
1. Florinel-Gabriel Banica, “Chemical Sensors and Biosensors: Fundamentals and Applications”, 2012, John
Wiley & Sons, Ltd
2. Ronald Pethig, Stewart Smith, “Introductory Bioelectronics: For Engineers and Physical Scientists”, 2013,
John Wiley & Sons, Ltd
教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lectures and presentations.
教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction to Biosensors
2. Nucleotides, Nucleic Acids, DNA, and RNA
3. Protein Structures and Properties
4. Affinity-based Recognition
5. Materials and Methods in Sensor Manufacturing
6. Nanomaterial Applications in Chemical and Biological Sensors
7. Spectroscopic Techniques
8. Optical Biosensors: Principles and Applications
9. Electrochemical Biosensors: Principles and Applications
10. Electrical Biosensors: Principles and Applications
11. Gas Sensors: Principles and Applications
12. Medical Applications of Biosensors
成績考核 Evaluation:
Midterm 30 %
Final project and presentation 50 %

科號  Course Number ：
11010BMES523100學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：基因晶片及其⽣醫應⽤
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Gene Chips and Its Biomedical Applications
任課教師  Instructor ：許志楧
上課時間  Time ： R6R7R8 上課教室  Room ：醫環 105 ／ 15
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
依據科技之發展趨勢，本課程從五年前開始逐漸將 " ⽣物資訊 " 及 " ⼤數據 " 處理的比重加強
到
⼆分之⼀的比例，希望學⽣能將所學應⽤於將來所⾯臨的各類問題。
在⼈類基因定序計畫（ Human Genome Project, HGP ）接近完成的⼆⼗⼀世紀初，基因晶
片為初步解讀該計畫所揭發出來⼤量訊息的最有⼒⼯具之⼀。 HGP 及基因晶片的跨領域⽣醫研究
也被認為將對⼆⼗⼀世紀初之基礎⽣醫研究及臨床應⽤帶來⾰命性的影響。然⽽，基因晶片之⽣
醫研究實驗得到動輒數⼗萬個的數據，若無有效率的統計⽅法及⽣物資訊學的知識，是無法充分
且正確的得到其中的訊息。另外，基因晶片系統之整體瞭解亦對實驗之設計及結果之分析有著關
鍵性的影響。本課程將針對基因晶片系統及基因晶片實驗相關的實驗設計及⽣物資訊⼤數據處理
進⾏探討並經由對這些領域的文獻之研討得到更深入的瞭解。
由於本課程之跨領域特質，我們亦將介紹基因晶片之⽣醫研究相關的基礎⽣物背景，以利
非⽣科背景同學的學習。

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Design and Application of Organ on a Chip and Bioartificial Organ
任課教師  Instructor ：李亦淇
上課時間  Time ： T5T6T7 上課教室  Room ：醫環 110 ／ 72
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、  課程說明 (Course Description)
The aims of this course is to introduce the technology platforms, methodologies,
and the design of organ on a chip and artificial organs. Knowledge of organ on a
chip design and application will be introduce including brain on a chip, lung on
a chip, and disease on a chip. Various engineering issues surrounding the design
of artificial organs including biopolymers and biocompatibility, stem cell
technology, biomimetic systems, design principles for tissue and blood contact,
and control of artificial organs are emphasized. Knowledge to the design of
artificial organs including circulatory support devices, drug delivery systems,
artificial kidney, and other bioartificial organs are included.

L12. 3D organ bioprinting

中文名稱  Course Title ：神經科學研究⽅法
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Neuroscience research methods
任課教師  Instructor ：朱麗安
上課時間  Time ： R5R6 上課教室  Room ：醫環 418 ／ 20
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
Neuroscience is a multidisciplinary research field. From the biological perspective, neuroscience involves
single neurons to a neuronal network (brain and central nerve system), and eventually this network conduct
animal behaviors. However, to reveal the mechanism of this sophisticated neuronal network, cutting edge
technologies such as automated behavior quantification software, super-resolution microscopy, AI image
analysis for circuit computation. In this class, we aim to study how to study a neuroscience question
systematically, and how these new technologies were brought into play to advance our understanding to the
neuroscience field.
⼆、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture and reports.
三、教學進度 (Syllabus)
（將原 18 週課程內的 1. Imaging 部分集中為⼀週上課，讓同學更能比較⼆種⼯具之差異 ; (2) 三週實驗
課程縮減為兩
週，課程內容不變但密集上課）
Week 1: Introduction of neuroscience research.
Week 2: Genetic tools for neuroscience research, part 1
Week 3: Genetic tools for neuroscience research part 2.
Week 4: Animal behavior assays.
Week 5: Electrophysiology
Week 6: Optical imaging for functional and structural imaging.
Week 7: Midterm
Week 8: Experiment (Animal behavior)
Week 9: Experiment (Functional and structural imaging)
Week 10-16: Case study (reports)

科號  Course Number ：
11010BMES548500學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：超⾳波與光學：⽣醫技術與應⽤
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Ultrasound and Optics : Biomedical Imaging Techniques and
applications
任課教師  Instructor ：林曉均
上課時間  Time ： T5T6T7 上課教室  Room ：醫環 419 ／ 20
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
The course will start with a revision on the motivations of biomedical imaging,
along with common techniques and challenges. Then, we will zoom in on ultrasound
imaging techniques: from acoustic wave propagation in tissue to the
understanding of transducers and image formation. As we explore system designs
and their applications, we will denote the characteristics and limitations of
the method. We will follow this by covering optical imaging. As we go from
fundamentals to systems and applications, and finally to challenges and outlook,
discussion will be steered towards its features complementary to those of
acoustic techniques. Finally, the last third section of the course will be on
the study of photoacoustic (optoacoustic) methods, where we combine optical
excitation and acoustic detection.
⼆、參考書籍  (References)
- Biomedical Optics: Principles and Imaging by Hsin-I Wu and Lihong V. Wang
- Photoacoustic Imaging and Spectroscopy by Lihong V. Wang
- Journal articles (Photoacoustics, Nature Photonics, Light: Science &
Applications, Theranostics...etc)
- Supplementary handouts
三、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
This course will be a combination of lectures and group discussions. Students
will be encouraged to deduct and reason for the purpose of developing critical
thinking as well as reinforce cognitive participation. Homework will be designed
to challenge the students’ literature search ability, along with analytical and
presentations skills.
四、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Course outline
1. Introduction: motivations, techniques, and challenges
2. Image characterization: common features
3. Ultrasound: intro and overview
4. Ultrasound: acoustic wave propagation
5. Ultrasound: transducers and image formation
6. Ultrasound: systems and applications
7. Optical Imaging: light propagation
8. Optical Imaging: methods and applications
9. Optical Imaging: summary
10. Photoacoustics: fundamentals
11. Photoacoustics: systems and applications
12. Photoacoustics: challenges and outlook
13. Summary
五、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Class participation (30%)
Assignment (40%)
Exam (30%)

臉書社團 : 數學為體⼯程為⽤ - 給我⼯數其餘免談
科號  Course Number ： 11010CHE 211002學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 35
中文名稱  Course Title ：⼯程數學⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Engineering Mathematics I
任課教師  Instructor ：潘詠庭
上課時間  Time ： T3T4R3 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  210 ／ 67
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Engineering Mathematics (I) covers the basics of the mathematical tools essential
for defining and solving
problems encountered by chemical engineers. These problems include by are not
limited to transport of maters
and energy, thermodynamics and separation processes, chemical reaction
engineering, process control, and
process design.
We will start our course with the introduction of 1st-order ordinary differential
equations (ODE). Such
equations are commonly encountered in simple chemical kinetics or steady-state
heat and mass transfer
problems. We will cover several types of ODE starting from separable homogeneous
ODE to general 1st-order
ODE. We will also cover 2nd-order ODE, which serves as an important foundation for
dealing with partial
differential equations students will encounter in non-steady state transfer
problems. Finally, toward the end
of the semester, we will cover some concepts in linear algebra and systems of ODEs
that can be used to deal with kinetics of series chemical reactions.
Below are some remarks for the course:
1. The lecture will be offered in English.
2. Final grades will be evaluated based on homework assignments (20%) and three
exams (20% for 1st, and 30% for the 2nd, and 30% for the 3rd exam).
3. Depending on the epidemic situation, the class may be given online in real time
through online meeting software such as google meet.
Detailed course syllabus will be provide in the first class of the semester.
科號  Course Number ： 11010CHE 241000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 67
中文名稱  Course Title ：物理化學⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Physical Chemistry (I)
任課教師  Instructor ：王潔
上課時間  Time ： M3M4W1W2 上課教室  Room ：旺宏 243 ／ 80
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、  課程說明 (Course Description)
Physical Chemistry I is a class focusing on gaining understandings toward chemical thermodynamics topics
such as work, heat, internal energy, heat capacity, enthalpy, entropy, free energy, Helmholtz free energy, Gibbs
free energy, Maxwell relations, chemical potential…etc. In this class, we will focus on (but not limited to) the
following topics:
1. The properties of gases
2. The first law of thermodynamics
3. The second law of thermodynamics
4. Physical transformations of pure substances
5. Simple mixture
6. Phase diagrams
7. Chemical equilibrium
After this class, you should be able to use the methods of equilibrium thermodynamics to describe the
properties and processes of macroscopic systems.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Physical Chemistry, Atkins 10th
三、參考書籍 (References)
Zemanksy, Mark, and Richard Dittman. Heat and Thermodynamics. 7th ed. McGraw-Hill Publishers.
Callen, Herbert B. Thermodynamics and an Introduction to Thermostatistics. Wiley.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)

五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Chapter 1 to Chapter7

Midterm II 30%
Final 35%

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Energy Technology and Environment
任課教師  Instructor ：林育正
上課時間  Time ： M7M8 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  209 ／ 67
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
Net-zero carbon emissions by 2050 is necessary to limit the global temperature
increase within 1.5 C and avoid irreversible damage from global warming. Fossil
fuel power plants are responsible for the most carbon emissions among the
anthropogenic sources. Carbon capture and sequestration (CCS) is an essential
technology to decarbonize power generation and achieve the net-zero carbon
emission target. This course will focus on the CCS technology development in
the context of mitigating the global warming. In this class, the students will
be expected to learn:
1.The greenhouse gas sources and the mitigation methods
2.The low-emission power generation technology
3.The carbon capture and sequestration technology with amine scrubbing
4.Current status of carbon capture in industry
● 參考書籍 (References)
Paul H.M. Feron, Absorption-based Post-combustion Capture of Carbon Dioxide,
Woodhead Publishing, 2016
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lectures, assignments, midterm exam, and final report
● 成績考核 (Evaluation)
Assignment: 40%
Exam: 30%
Final report: 30%

Course description: Instrumental analysis is linked with many fields of science
and engineering. Due to the large number and diversity of instrumental methods,
beginners typically will need a large amount of work to collect the necessary
knowledge in order to understand of the fundamentals of the methods.
Instrumental Analysis is an integrated course of lectures and laboratories and
you will be exposed to a wide variety of analytical instrumentation and
techniques.
Required Text Book
Principles of Instrumental Analysis, 7th Ed., by Douglas A. Skoog et al.
Thomson Brooks/Cole, CA
Course introduction
Part I
Chapters 16-17: Infrared Spectrometry
　 Chapter 19: Nuclear Magnetic Resonance Spectrometry
　 Chapter 20: Mass Spectrometry
　 Chapters 16-20: Combination of Spectrometry
　 Exam #1
Part II
　 Chapters 9-12: Atomic Spectrometry
　 Chapters 13-15: Ultraviolet and Luminescence Spectrometry
　 Chapters 22-25: Electroanalytical Chemistry
　 Chapters 26-28: Chromatographic Separation, LC and GC
Chapter 31: Thermal Methods
Chapter 21: Surface Characterization by Spectroscopy and Microscopy
　 Exam #2
Part III
Lab experiments: Instruments will be selected from UV-vis & PL, IR, XRD, CV,
GCMS, HPLC, GPC, DSC & TGA,AA, and optical microscope, depending on
availability.
Laboratory 1
　 Laboratory 2
　 Laboratory 3
　 Laboratory 4
　 Laboratory 5
　 Laboratory 6; Lab Exam.
Grading: Exam #1 (tentatively 40%), Exam #2 (tentatively 40%), Lab (tentatively
10%), in-class performance (tentatively 10%). Average and distribution of final
grade should be adjusted with another class.

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Transport Phenomena and Unit Operations(I)
任課教師  Instructor ：黃振煌
上課時間  Time ： M3M4W1W2 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  209 ／ 67
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
課程內容以流體⼒學之理論及相關之操作為主，包括：流體物性之介紹、 shell balance 、恆溫下連續⽅
程式及運動⽅程式之建立、 laminar flow 、 turbulent flow 、邊界層理論、介⾯動量傳送與摩擦係數，巨
觀流體流動及非⽜頓流體流動等現象。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Bird, R.B., W.E. Stewart, and E.N. Lightfoot, "Transport Phenomena," Revised 2nd ed., Wiley (2006)
三、參考書籍  (References)
1. 王茂齡 , “ 輸送現象 ” ⾼立圖書  (1993)
2. Stanley & Middleman, “An Introduction to Fluid Dynamics,” Wiley (1998).
3. R.B. Bird, W.E. Stewart, E.N. Lightfoot, and D.J. Klingenberg, “Introductory Transport Phenomena”, 1st
ed., Wiley (2015)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
投影片講解  (Slides presentation)
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Momentum Transfer (Chaps 1-8)
- Viscosity and Momentum Transport
- Shell Balances/Laminar Flow
- Equations of Change/Isothermal Systems
- Velocity Distributions in More than One Variable
- Velocity Distributions in Turbulent Flow
- Interphase Transport in Isothermal Systems
- Macroscopic Balances for Isothermal Flow Systems
- Polymeric Liquids
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)

Mid-term: 2, 48%
(Mid-Term I: Chaps. 1,2 and Appendix A; Mid-Term II: Chaps. 3,4,5)
Final Exam (Chaps. 6,7,8): 1, 27%
Class Quiz: Random 10%

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Materials Science
任課教師  Instructor ：陳信文

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
材料科學為探討材料之微觀結構與其物理，化學及機械性質之科學。本課程之主要分為三部份：
⼀、材料之微觀結構，原⼦鍵結與配位，晶體內之原⼦排列及晶體缺陷（特別是空位與差排之理
論）；⼆、材料之熱⼒學及動⼒學：相圖、固體擴散及熱處理，此為控制與改變材料微觀結構之
基礎；三、材料之性質：針對⾦屬、陶瓷、⾼分⼦及半導體等材料之結構特性，討論其相關之物
理、化學及機械性質。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
”Foundations of Materials Science and Engineering”, 5th edition, by W. F. Smith
and J. Hashemi, McGraw Hill, 6th edition.

科號  Course Number ： 11010CHE 415003學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 20
中文名稱  Course Title ：程序設計
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Process Design
任課教師  Instructor ：林育正
上課時間  Time ： F7F8F9 上課教室  Room ：化⼯ 220 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
This course aims to teach how to apply heat and material balance,
thermodynamics, process optimization, and unit operation method to design
chemical processes using process simulators. The students are expected to:
1. Understand the procedure for chemical process design and delivery
2. Apply basic knowledge of chemical engineering to design a chemical process
3. Calculate process economics and implement optimization
4. Gain open-ended problem-solving skill
5. Learn how to use chemical process simulators
6. Present the results through written reports and oral presentation
● 參考書籍 (References)
Warren D. Seider et al. Product and Process Design Principles: Synthesis,
Analysis and Design. Wiley 2016.
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Courses and project assignment
● 教學進度 (Syllabus)
Week 1 to 8: courses and exam
Week 9 to 18: process design project, presentation, and report
● 成績考核 (Evaluation)
Exam: 25%
Progress report: 25%
Final report: 25%
Presentation: 25%

任課教師  Instructor ：胡育誠
上課時間  Time ： M2R1R2 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  211 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明  This course covers basic cell biology, fundamental genetic
engineering, cell culture, bioreactor design, downstream bioprocesses and
applications of biotechnology. In the end of the semester, the students are
grouped to design and present the production process, starting from genetic
engineering of the cells, production process (including bioreactor design and
operation) and downstream purification process.
計,下游程序⼯程 , ⽣物技術在特⽤化學品、抗⽣素等之應⽤

Cambridge University Press, Cambridge, UK.

Applications of Recombinant DNA. 2nd ed. ASM Press, Washington, D.C.

=548; I recommend that 3 students form a group and each student gives a 10 min
presentation in English.
=548; Each group is free to select a bio-derived product (e.g. ethanol) as the
topic for presentation. You are advised to use the knowledge you learned in
class
for the presentation.
=548; The first student presents the background overview of the product, from
market, demand to the selection and/or genetic engineering of the cells. The

This course shall introduce the fundamental semiconductor materials and
manufacturing technology. It will be covered include semiconductor history,
layout design, mask making, wafer process, package testing, future trends and
industry chain. Enable students to understanding the overall concept of
semiconductor engineering technology.

中文名稱  Course Title ：⾼等化⼯熱⼒學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Advanced Chem. Engineering Thermodynamics
任課教師  Instructor ：汪上曉  David Shan Hill Wong
上課時間  Time ： R5R6R7 上課教室  Room ：化⼯ 220 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
I. Course Description
The objective of this course is to review undergraduate level engineering
thermodynamics and introduce advanced topics of thermodynamic relevant to
research and development in nanomaterials, biotechnology and
energy/environmental technology.
II. Text Books and References
There will be no textbooks nor assigned reference books.
III Teaching Method
Undergraduate classical thermodynamics, will be reviewed in the first 8 weeks
All course materials will be given in the form of precorded video presentations.
Class lectures will be devoted to questions and anwsers and tutorials.
and learning achievements will be assesed by 5 class tests.
Statistical thermodynamics and irreversible thermodynamics will be introduced in
next 4 weeks. All course materials will be given in the form of precorded video
presentations. Class will be devoted to lectures and questions and anwsers.
Learning achievements will be assesed by 1 class test.
Advanced topics will be introduced in last 4 weeks. Each student will do a term
paper on specific subjects in these areas. They are asked to do a presentation of
the paper. Class will be devoted to questions and anwsers on the content
IV. Syllabus
REVIEW OF CLASSICAL THERMODYNAMICS
1. Basic Laws of Thermodynamics (2 weeks)
2. Properties of Materials (2 weeks)
3. Phase Equilibrium (2 weeks)
4. Chemical Equilibrium (2 weeks)
5. Statistical thermodynamics (2 weeks)
6. Nonequilibrium thermodynamics (2 weeks)
ADVANCED TOPICS
1. Energy conversion and environmental protection (1 week)
2. Complex phase behavior in novel materials (1 week)
3. Thermodynamics in biological process systems (1 week)
4. Thermodynamics of information (1 week)
V. Grading
REVIEW OF CLASSICAL THERMODYNAMICS
6 class tests -- 84 % of final grade
ADVANCED TOPICS
1 term paper -- 16% of grades
VI. Useful external links

usp=sharing

科號  Course Number ： 11010CHE 507000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：化⼯原理⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Chemical Engineering Principles (I)
任課教師  Instructor ：蔡德豪
上課時間  Time ： F2F3F4 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  221 ／ 25
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、  課程說明 (Course Description)
This course is designed to provide basic understanding of transport phenomena
and unit operations for graduate students with a non-chemical engineering
undergraduate background. It is divided into two parts. The first part takes 9
weeks to cover physical properties (viscosity, conductivity, diffusivity) and
(momentum, energy, mass) transport mechanisms, and shell balance techniques
for solving physical quantity (velocity, temperature, concentration)
distributions in simple transport problems. The second part focuses on several
key unit operations such as fluid delivery, mixing, separation and heating and
drying that are critical for students to learn so that they can apply some
basic knowledge and skill in this area when they start to work in domestic
plants.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Bird, R.B., W.E. Stewart, and E.N. Lightfoot, "Transport Phenomena," 2nd ed.,
Wiley (2002)
三、參考書籍 (References)
王茂齡 , “ 輸送現象 ” ⾼立圖書  (1993)
Middleman, S., “An Introduction to Fluid Mechanics” and “An Introduction to
Mass and Heat Transfer”, Wiley(1998)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
lectures
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Transport phenomena: 3 weeks for momentum transport, 3 weeks for energy
transport, and 3 weeks for mass transport
Unit operations: Fluid delivery (2 weeks), mixing(2 weeks), separation (2
weeks), heating and drying(2 weeks).
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Transport Phenomena:
1 Midterm Examination 45%
Weekly in-class practice 10%
Unit operations:
1. Final Examination 25%
2. Project & presentation 20%

課程說明 /Course Description and objective
-------
此課程將會介紹代謝⼯程領域中所需的基礎分⼦⽣物技術，微⽣物之各式代謝途徑，及其在⽣質燃
料和
化學品⽅⾯之應⽤
Selected topics in molecular biology that form the foundation of biotechnology
and
metabolic engineering will be discussed. Along with introduction of cell
metabolism, this course will focus on the application of various techniques
in the
production of renewable chemical and fuel.
指定⽤書 /Text Book
-------
無/None
教學⽅式 /Teaching Method
-------
教師授課為主 /based on lecture material
成績考核 /Evaluation
-------
Midterm:30%
Final:30%
Presentation:30%
Quiz:10%
An important objective of this course is to train students in scientific
reading.
The goals are to have the students read critically and use knowledge learned
in
lectures to understand and interpret the scientific merit of a published work.
Scientific paper will be assigned throughout the semester. The content of the
paper
will be subjected to examination during tests and presentations.

科號  Course Number ： 11010CHE 522500學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：⼩⾓度散射原理與應⽤
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Principles and Applications of Small Angle Scattering
任課教師  Instructor ：陳信龍
上課時間  Time ： T2T3T4 上課教室  Room ：化⼯ 220 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
This course will cover the principles and applications of small angle X-ray and
neutron scattering, which are important tools for exploring the nanostructures,
thermodynamics and dynamics of matters. The objective is to provide the
students
a solid background on these techniques, which may be
helpful for their research in related subjects. The topics covered in this
course are outlined as follows.
1. Basics of X-ray and Neutron Scattering
2. Small Angle Scattering
2. Applications to Polymer Blends and
Block Copolymers
4. Application to Amorphous Polymers
5. Study of Surfaces and Interfaces
6. Inelastic Scattering for Dynamics
Studies
The materials taught in class will be based largely on the book of:
R. J. Roe, “Methods of X-ray and Neutron Scattering in Polymer Science”, Oxford
University Press (2000)
Two exams will be held and a final written report is required.

科號  Course Number ： 11010CHE 533000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 15
中文名稱  Course Title ：同步輻射在物質結構上的應⽤
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Synchrotron applications in structural analysis
任課教師  Instructor ：鄭有舜
上課時間  Time ： M6M7M8 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  421 ／ 30
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程將介紹同步輻射在理解物質結構上的各種應⽤技術及相關原  理。主要分為散射技術，光譜分
析，影像技術三類 . 內容紮實豐富 , 為點滴成果累積型的課程 , 非通識類型課程 , 需適度研習每周的課程
講義內容⽅能完成每周作業 .

無

2. Small Angle X-ray Scattering ， O. Glatter and O. Kratky, 1982, Academic Press (London), Ltd.
3. Structure Analysis by Small-Angle X-ray and Neutron Scattering, L. A. Fegin and D. I. Svergun, 1987,
Plenum Press, New York.

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
objective:
To introduce currently available artificial organs and concepts of tissue
engineering from the engineering disciplines' point of view.
Subjects:Chapter 1. Organ Transplant vs. Artificial Organs (1 week)
Chapter 2. Artificial Heart Valve (2 weeks)
Chapter 3. Artificial Vascular Graft (Blood Vessel) (2 weeks)
Chapter 4. Artificial Heart (2 weeks)
Chapter 5. Artificial Blood (2 weeks)
Chapter 6. Artificial Kidney, Lung, Liver, Pancreas (2 weeks)
Chapter 7. Artificial Skins and Other Artificial Organs (1 week)
Chapter 8. Tissue Engineering (3 weeks)
Oral Report (1 week)

科號  Course Number ： 11010CHE 545400學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 25
中文名稱  Course Title ：⾼等⾼分⼦化學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Advanced Polymer Chemistry
任課教師  Instructor ：劉英麟
堀江正樹
上課時間  Time ： T5T6T7 上課教室  Room ：化⼯ 202 ／ 70
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
Polymer chemistry is significantly important for chemical engineering students.
New polymers with required functions can be developed by taking advantage of
chemical synthesis and various polymerization methods. This course deals with
polymer design and synthesis both at the fundamental and the advanced level.
Various polymerization methods, as listed below, are introduced in this course.
In addition, they are related to the latest academic research and industrial
applications.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
George Odian,“Principles of Polymerization,” 4th Ed., Wiley: New York, 2004.
(E-book is available from the library.)
三、參考書籍 (References)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Presentation, group discussion, and in-class quiz
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
劉英麟  Ying-Ling Liu
1. Step Polymerization
2. Radical Chain Polymerization
3. Ionic Chain Polymerization
堀江正樹  Masaki Horie
4. Chain Copolymerization
5. Ring-Opening Polymerization
6. Sterochemistry of Polymerization
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Midterm 50%
Final exam 50%
科號  Course Number ： 11010CHE 554000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 20
中文名稱  Course Title ：微流體系統於化⼯之應⽤與實作
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Microfluidic System: Application and Implementation in Chemical
Engineering
任課教師  Instructor ：黃振煌
上課時間  Time ： T6T7T8 上課教室  Room ：化⼯  210 ／ 67
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course mainly combines three parts. First, students will understand the fundamental aspects of kinetics,
mass-transport, fluid physics, design principle, and the use of software that are relevant to microfluidic
systems. Second, course will provide an understanding of current challenges in Chemical Engineering field.
Finally, students in the course will work together in several groups to design and fabricate microfluidic
systems or devices that address challenges in Chemical Engineering, with an emphasis on students' inventive
contributions and creativity. Participants in this course benefit from enrollment of students with diverse
backgrounds and interests. For chemical engineers, suggested but not required courses are CHE 352 (Transport
Phenomena and Unit Operations), CHE 306 (Chemical Engineering Unit Operations), and CHE 415 (Process
Design). Students are encouraged to contact the instructor to discuss enrollment.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Lecture notes are available during lecture.
三、參考書籍 (References)
1.“Transport Phenomena in Microfluidic Systems” by P. K. Panigrahi, Wiley, 2015
2.“Micro- and nanoscale fluid mechanics : transport in microfluidic devices” by B. J, Kirby, 2010
3. “Unit Operations of Chemical Engineering” 7th edition by W. McCabe, J. Smith, P. Harriott, 2004
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture, experiment, and interaction with students
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
- Introduction of fluidic mechanics, heat transfer, mass transfer
- Current challenges in Chemical Engineering
- Design principles and software
- Fabrication methods
- Suggestion and discussion
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Mid-term Presentation I– Introduction and current challenges, 25%
Mid-term Presentation II–Ideas, innovation and design, 25%
Implementation– Fabrication and Test , 10%
Final Presentation –Results, Discussion and Conclusion, 40%

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Organic Electronics

四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
本課程將以英文授課，每章均以 power point 格式播放上課材料，並⼝頭闡述之，學⽣可以隨時提
出問題。每章材料均在上課發放。
This course will be taught in English. Each chapter teaching materials will be
provided in hard copy of power point format along with oral demonstration.
Students are allowed to rise question at anytime in the class.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
上課共 18 周  (2020.09.14-2021.01.11; no holiday)
考試 : 1次  (final exam 2021.01.11 oral reporting)
課程⽬錄  (Course content)
1. Introduction,
2. Photochemistry
3. Device physics
4. Materials chemistry and physics
5. Emitting species and charge transport
6. Organic light emitting diode (OLED)
7. Polymer light emitting diode (PLED)
8. Organic field effect transistor (OFET, including small molecules and,
Polymers)
9. organic Solar Cell (including small molecules, polymers and quantum dots)
10. Organic Memory Device
11. e-Book
12. Touch panel display
11. Processing technology
12. Flexible electronics
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
全學期考試 1 次，各選課學⽣將依所指定的題⽬尋找資料，並準備書⾯報告 (power point 格式 ) 於
上課時作⼝頭闡述約 20 分鐘。
There is one examination at the end of the semester. Each student will be
assigned a topic for searching on recent progress in that topic; he/she will
then write up a report in power point format and give an oral presentation in
about 20 minutes.

This course describes the basic concepts of chemistry: atoms and molecules, chemical bondings, molecular
structure, orbitals, transition metals and coordination chemistry, organic chemistry, biochemistry, and
chemistry of the nonmetals.

三、參考書籍 (References)
Other textbooks including general chemistry, physical chemistry, inorganic chemistry, organic chemistry and
biochemistry.
1. Chemistry by Silberberg. 2. General Chemistry by Petrucci, Herring, Madura and Bissonnette.

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
(a) 考試作弊者學期成績為零分

company, Boston, New York, 2015. 歐亞書局 , Tel: (02) 77053376
三、參考書籍 (References)
"General Chemistry" Darrell D. Ebbing, 5th edition, Houghton Mifflin Company, Boston,
1996.

五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
chap 2. Atoms, Molecules and Ions
chap 3. Stoichiometry
chap 4. Types of Chemical Reactions and Solution Stoichiometryh
Chap. 5. Gases
Chap. 6. Chemical Equilibrium
Chap. 7. Acids and bases
Chap. 8. Applicaitons of Aqueous Equilibrium
Chap. 9. Energy, Enthalpy, and Thermochemistry
Chap. 10. Spontaneity, Entropy, and Free Energy.
Chap. 11. Electrochemistry
(Chap. 12. Quantum Mechanics and Atomic Theory)

homework & enrollment (10%)

⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
This course describes the basic concepts of chemistry
英語授課普通化學
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
S. S. Zumdahl, D. J. DeCoste, Chemical Principles,8th edition, 2017.
三、參考書籍 (References)
Other textbooks of general chemistry, physical chemistry, and inorganic
chemistry.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture in English
The classes will be held on
Monday 10:10~12:00
Wednesday 8:20~9:50
at Room 326, Chemistry Building.
All but those who are in quarantine or have special permission are required to
attend the class in person and sign the attending sheet. There will be
simultaneous Webex session of the classroom lecture for the first few weeks.
For Class Notes, students in the classroom can hand in either the paper
version or the electronic file due on the same time as those in Webex session,
usually10 minutes after the class is dismissed.
Start of New Semester COVID-19 Prevention Measures(110.9.9)
https://2019-ncov.site.nthu.edu.tw/p/406-1499-212979,r8569.php?Lang=en
The items that are related to the classrooms are as flollows.
1. Wear a mask all the time.
2. In-class teaching should keep a distance from others of at least 1.5
meters.
3. Fixed seats should also be arranged with a photo as the proof for contact
tracing.
We will sign the seat in the first day of class which is scheduled on Sep. 22.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Chapters 1~12, chapters 7 and 8 may be skipped.
The fist few chapters will go fast and the thermodynamics in chapters 9-11
will be in great details. Acids and bases may be skipped if the class runs
too slowly.
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Home work and performance in the classroom 15% (those who are allowed to take
the Webex session have the same assignment simultaneously.)
Midterms 50%
Final 35%
1st midterm exam Oct.25
2nd midterm exam Nov. 29
Final exam Jan. 10, 2022

科號  Course Number ：
11010CHEM221001學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 100
中文名稱  Course Title ：有機化學⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Organic Chemistry (I)
任課教師  Instructor ：陳建添
上課時間  Time ： T1T2F1F2 上課教室  Room ：化⼆  223 ／ 109
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Course Description: This organic chemistry will be aimed at fundamental
knowledge of hydrocarbons and those with functional groups. Their
nomenclatures and physical properties will be presented. Resonance and
conjugation concepts and effects will be further emphasized. Two different key
reaction types related to alkyl halides with varying leaving group ability,
nucleophile basicity, and solvents will be described. Finally, the oxygen,
nitrogen- and sulfur containing compounds will be integrated regarding their
reactivity and selectivity features.
Textbook:
Organic Chemistry Seventh or eighth Edition by Paula Yurkanis Bruice
Method: with ppt files that integrate keep contents and more examples in your
daily life.
Topics
1. Remembering General Chemistry: self study
2. Acids and bases: self study
3. An Introduction to Organic Chemistry
4. Isomers
5. Alkenes
6. The Reactions of Alkenes
7. The Reactions of Alkynes
8. Delocalized Electrons and Their Effect on Stability
9. Substitution and Elimination Reactions of Alkyl Halides
10. Reactions of Alcohols, Ethers, Epoxides, Amines, and Thiols
11. Organic metallic Compounds
1st mid-term exam: Oct 26 (Tue): 25%
2nd mid-term: Nov 23 (Tue): 25%
3rd mid-term: Dec 24 (Fri): 25%
Final exam: Jan 14 (Fri) or 18 (Tue): 25%
Evaluations:
The contents in handouts, exercises, and problems account for 80-90% of the
questions in the exams.
Attendance check: 5 times this semester; accounts for extra 10% bonus score

11010CHEM293000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：應⽤數學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Applied Mathematics
任課教師  Instructor ：周佳駿
上課時間  Time ： M1M2R1R2 上課教室  Room ：化⼆  223 ／ 109
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
No textbook is required for this course.
References:
1. Erich Steiner, The Chemistry Maths Book, 2nd edition, (2008).
2. Donald A. McQuarrie, Mathematics for Physical Chemistry, 1st edition, (2008).
3. Donald A. McQuarrie, Mathematical Methods for Scientists and Engineers, 1st edition, (2003).
4. Robert G. Mortimer, Mathematics for Physical Chemistry, 4th Edition, (2013).
Course objectives:
This course is an introduction to applied mathematics required by chemistry undergraduate students including
multivariable calculus, linear algebra, and ordinary differential equations. Examples will be drawn from a
variety of scientific and mathematical areas.
Course Outline: (topics to be covered and order of presentation subject to change)
1. Complex numbers
2. Differential and integral calculus in several variables
3. Linear algebra
‧ Determinants
‧ Vector spaces
‧ Matrices and linear transformations
‧ The matrix eigenvalue problem
4. Operators
5. Ordinary differential equations
‧ First-order differential equations
‧ Second-order differential equations: Constant coefficients
‧ The power series method
Course Grades:
Homework (10%)
3 Exams: Exam 1 (30%); Exam 2 (30%); Exam 3 (30%)

科號  Course Number ：
11010CHEM331000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 100
中文名稱  Course Title ：無機化學⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Inorganic Chemistry (I)
任課教師  Instructor ：彭之皓
黃暄益
上課時間  Time ： M1M2R1R2 上課教室  Room ：旺宏懷樸／ 170
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
Basic knowledge of inorganic chemistry will be taught in this course.
The content includes:
Topic 1: Introduction
Topic 2: Atomic Structure
Topic 3: Symmetry and Group Theory
Topic 4: Simple Bonding Theory
Topic 5: Molecular Orbitals
Topic 6: Acid-base and Donor-Acceptor Chemistry
Topic 7: Reduction and Oxidation
Topic 8: The Crystalline Solid State
Topic 9: Chemistry of the Main Group Elements
Topic 10: Coordination Chemistry I: Structures and Isomers
⼆、指定書籍  (Textbooks)
Inorganic Chemistry, 5th Ed.
Authors: Catherine E. Housecroft and Alan G. Sharpe
Publisher: Pearson Prentice Hall
三、參考書籍  (References)
Inorganic Chemistry, 5th ed.
Authors: Gary L. Miessler and Donald A. Tarr
Publiser: Pearson Prentice Hall
四、教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
Lectures will be mainly presented by slides.
五、教學進度  (Syllabus)
The content includes: atomic structure, molecular symmetry, group theory, MO
theory, acid-base chemistry, solid state chemistry, reduction and oxidation,
chemistry of main group elements, organometallic complexes.
Special emphasis this time will include more presentation on the structural
characterization and properties of nanoscale inorganic materials.
六、成績考核  (Evaluation)
期中考 : 上課內容與課本習題。  => 100 分  x 2 = 200
期末考 : 上課內容與課本習題。  => 100 分  x 1 = 100
