科號  Course Number ： 11010CS 460100學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 75
中文名稱  Course Title ：⼈⼯智慧概論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
任課教師  Instructor ：蘇豐文  Von-Wun Soo
上課時間  Time ： W3W4F3 上課教室  Room ：台達 104 ／ 116
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course introduces intelligent problem solving methods, knowledge
representaiton, machine learning theories and methods, intelligent systems
applications, the content includes:
1. heuristic search, (hill climbing, A*)
2. planning and problem solving, (partial order planning)
3. logic theorem proving and automated reasoning,
4. knowledge representation and expert systems,
5. uncertain reasoning, (Bayesian belief networks, Kaman filtering, MCMC algorithm)
6. machine learning & deep learning (decision tree, reinforcement learning, CNN, RNN, GAN)
7. natural language processing, (parsing, semantic embedding)
8. computer vision, (neural network vision)
9. intelligent agents. (coordination and negotiation)
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Stuart Russel and Peter Norvig, Artificial Intelligence: A Modern Approach,
Pearson education, Inc. 3nd Edition, 2010.
Deep Learning with Python, Francois Chollet,
三、參考書籍 (References)
Patrick Henry Winston, Artificial Intelligence, 3rd edition.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
lectures,
homework exercises,
term programming project,
Quiz exams
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction and intelligent agents (1 weeks)
2. Problem solving (heuristic search and Constraint Satisfaction problems) (2 weeks)
hill climbing; simulated annealing, A* algorithms,
3. Machine Learning (5 weeks) decision tree, error back propagation, Q-learning, conceptual
clustering, deep learning CNN, RNN, LSTM, GAN
(mid term project due)
4. Uncertainty and probabilistic reasoning [Bayesian networks, MCMC] (1 weeks)
5. Knowledge and logical reasoning (1 week) non-monotonic reasoning,
6. Agent Planning (1 weeks) partial order planning
7 . Natural language processing (1 week)
(Final exam week; term project due)
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Homework exercises 40%
Mid tern project 20%
Final term project 30%
Participation 10%

中文名稱  Course Title ：機器學習概論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Machine Learning
任課教師  Instructor ：郭柏志

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course provides a broad introduction to machine learning. The course
will introduce principles, algorithms, and applications of machine learning
from the point of view of formulation of learning problem, representation,
clustering, and classification. We will also go through some popular methods
such as support vector machines, random forests, and neural networks.
The goals of the course are (1) To understand the basic principles of
machine learning (2) To become familiar with widely used machine learning
algorithms (3) To learn tools that allow you to apply machine learning
algorithms to real data (4) To properly evaluate the model performance.`
In the term project, a group of students (1-5 students per group) will
investigate some interesting aspect of machine learning or apply machine
learning to a problem that interests them.

科號  Course Number ： 11010CS 516000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 40
中文名稱  Course Title ： FPGA 結構及設計⾃動化
英文名稱  Course English Title ： FPGA Architecture & CAD
任課教師  Instructor ：麥偉基  MAK WAI KEI
上課時間  Time ： M5M6R5 上課教室  Room ：台達 102 ／ 100
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
Field programmable gate arrays (FPGAs) are computer logic chips whose function
and wiring can be re-programmed. FPGAs enable the creation of custom computing
engines with higher efficiency than conventional software-programmed
processors. FPGA-based electronic designs are found everywhere such as
consumer gadgets, wired and wireless communication, automotive, industrial,
medical, scientific, aerospace, military, etc. FPGAs are one of the first
commercially available 3D/2.5D ICs. FPGAs are highly power-efficient for
implementing neural networks for accelerating AI applications. Cloud service
providers are offering customers the ability to use FPGAs as accelerators.
Increasingly, FPGAs are displacing ASICs and ASSPs as IC design complexity and
manufacturing costs continue to rise.
This course first introduces the characteristics, evolution and usage of
field-programmable technologies, and then continues to look into some advanced
researches related to FPGA architecture and CAD. On the hardware side, we will
investigate the tradeoff involved in finding a balanced FPGA architecture and
study some recent commercial FPGA architectures as examples. On the software
side, we will look at the FPGA design flow and study the design of efficient
FPGA CAD tools for technology mapping, placement, and routing, etc. to
optimize power and performance. New directions of architecture & CAD research
will be explored together at the end.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
No required textbook
Lecture notes will be provided at the class.
Selected readings will be posted at the e-learning class webpage.
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. Field-Programmable Gate Arrays, by S.D. Brown, R.J. Francis, J. Rose, and
Z.G. Vranesic, Kluwer Academic Publishers.
2. FPGA-based System Design, by W. Wolf, Prentice Hall.
3. Application-Specific Integrated Circuits, by M.J.S. Smith, Addison
Wesley.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lectures, reading & written assignments, student presentation, and project
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Part I. FPGA Technology & Architecture
1. Why FPLDs?
2. Classification and Evolution of FPLDs
3. Programming Technologies and Logic Element Design
4. Routing Architecture Design
5. Commercial Examples
6. Circuit Design and Architecture Issues
Part II. FPGA CAD
1. Technology Mapping for FPGA
2. Placement for FPGA
3. Floorplanning for FPGA
4. Routing for FPGA
5. Timing Optimization Techniques for FPGA
6. Power Optimization Techniques for FPGA
7. Pin Assignment for FPGA
8. CAD for 2.5D FPGAs
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Assignments: 50%
Literature review & presentation: 20%
Quizzes: 30%

科號  Course Number ： 11010CS 517000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 70
中文名稱  Course Title ：數位電視系統
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Digital Television
任課教師  Instructor ：胡龍融  LONRONG HU
上課時間  Time ： M6M7M8 上課教室  Room ：資電  128 ／ 70
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
Television has NOT really changed very much since its first introduction to
the world in the 1950’s. Now some 50 years later, driven by the thirst of
high-resolution multimedia contents and powered by rapid development in
video compression techniques, a high-efficiency video broadcasting system
featuring with massive high-definition digital video transmission results.
This course intends to give students an overview of today's digital TV
standards in the world such as the ATSC system in the US, and the DVB-T/-T2
system in Europe and ASEAN countries. We will also cover some introduction
of technologies involved in the area of terrestrial transmission such as
source coding, channel coding, digital modulation, and RF signal processing.
Topics also included are the digital TV RF front-end design, the operation
of the digital receiving devices (i.e. Set-top Box), and discussion of
example chipsets for DVB-T and ATSC, respectively.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Digital Television: MPEG-1, MPEG-2 and Principles of the DVB system,
Herve Benoit, 2nd Edition, Focal Press 2002
三、參考書籍 (References)
Digital Television: DVB-T, COFDM, and ATSC 8-VSB,
Mark Massel, digitalTVbooks.com 2000
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
以講授為主 , 輔以投影片及⿊板說明 .
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
(1) TV System Overview
(2) Introduction to Color Space
(3) Video Signal Overview
(4) Analog/Digital Video Interface
(5) Source Coding (DCT and MPEG-2)
(6) Forward Error Correction and Conditional Access
(7) Modulation (COFDM and 8-VSB)
(8) frame structure
(9) Operation of the digital receiving devices (i.e. Set-top Box)
(10) Digital TV RF front-end design
(11) Example chipsets for DVB-T and ATSC
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
1.HW/Quiz 20%
2.期中考  40%
3.期末考  40%

(2) https://www.atsc.org/standards/atsc-3-0-standards/

⼀、  課程說明 :
本物聯網技術與應⽤課程，主要針對物聯網感測網路的感測技術、通訊技術及網際網路整合技術製作
課程教材，培植國內物聯網的專業⼈材，讓學⽣了解物聯網感測器與物聯網聯網路技術的相關通訊協
定、軟體開發技術、以及硬體介⾯之基本知識與觀念，本課程評量⽅式除平時作業及考試外，也注重
學⽣實作能⼒及創意思考，因此學⽣將分組完成期末專題，並於學期末報告其專題成果。本課程除了
在課堂介紹物聯網技術外，也會透過⼀系列的實驗，讓同學接觸並學習操作物聯網平台，透過各種物
聯網的應⽤實驗，使學⽣了解物聯網感測技術原理，並具備物聯網技術與應⽤之整合能⼒。
⼆、課程⼤綱內容如下 :
1. 物聯網簡介。
2. 感測器節點軟、硬體架構簡介。

4. 短距離低功耗網路技術 Bluetooth 。
5. ⻑距離低功耗網路技術 LoRa 與 NB-IoT 。
6. 無線感測網路之路由協議。
7. 定位技術。
8. 時間同步技術 (option) 。
實驗項⽬：
實驗 A：物聯網感測器開發環境簡介、熟悉與安裝。
實驗 B： NB-IoT 通訊模組 (SIM 卡 ) ，傳輸數據到雲端。
實驗 C：物聯網感測資料蒐集及控制物聯網設備。
實驗 D：物聯網感測器網路與 RS-485 匯流排整合實驗
實驗 E：物聯網感測器之穿戴式應⽤。
實驗 F：物聯網感測器與嵌入式單晶片之整合實驗。
實驗 G： NB-IoT 智慧校園創新應⽤設計開發。

科號  Course Number ： 11010CS 526200學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 40
中文名稱  Course Title ：多媒體網路與系統
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Multimedia Networking and Systems
任課教師  Instructor ：徐正炘
上課時間  Time ： M7M8R6 上課教室  Room ：台達 102 ／ 100
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
1. 課程說明 (Course Description)
This course covers the latest research in the areas of networking and multimedia systems. Despite the basic
concepts of multimedia networking will be reviewed, the course is a graduate-level course and requires each
student to work on an intensive term project. Students are expected to regularly present their project progress
and turn in publishable technical reports, in order to pass the course.
The lectures will be given in English. All the reports must be in English.
2. 指定⽤書 (Text Books)
- Li, Drew, and Liu, Fundamentals of Multimedia, 2nd Ed., Springer, 2014 (available online on campus).
- Students will search, print, read, and present the latest search papers under the guidance of the instructor.
3. 參考書籍 (References)
- Kurose and Rose, Computer Networking: A top-down Approach Featuring the Internet, Addison Wesley,
2016.
- Schaar and Chou, Multimedia over IP and Wireless Networks: Compression, Networking, and Systems,
Elsevier, 2007.
4. 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Each student will propose and carry out a research project. The expectation for each graduate student is to
generate a research paper at the end of the semester. The expectation for each undergraduate student is to
generate a report for a well-known multimedia grand challenge problem; or to produce a good system demo
with demo abstract at the end of the semester. Students who do not deliver publishable reports at the end of the
semester will fail the course.
5. 教學進度 (Syllabus)
The following tentative topics will be presented by the instructor, if not all students are familiar with them
already.
- Internet Architecture and Services
- Audio/Video Coding Overview
- Scalable Video Coding
- Adaptive Multimedia Streaming
- Stream Synchronization
- Streaming to Wireless and Mobile Devices
- Content-aware Multimedia Streaming and Storage
- 3D Mobile Video
The following is not an exhausted list of the latest research topic in multimedia networking:
- Volumetric videos streamed to head mounted displays (3DoF+ or 6DoF)
- Multimedia Internet-of-Things
- Media-Aware Network Elements
- Virtual Reality and Augmented Reality
- 3D Scene Reconstructions
- Machine-learning Enabled Multimedia
- Point Cloud Compression
- Multimodal Speaker Recognition in Video Conferences
- Decentralized Social Media
6. 成績考核 (Evaluations)
- Programming projects: 20%
- Quizzes (10 times): 20%
- Paper and book chapter presentation and discussion: 20%
- Term paper: 40%
Note that students who do not deliver publishable reports at the end of the semester will receive failing grades.
7. 可連結之網⾴位址
https://nmsl.cs.nthu.edu.tw/courses/
科號  Course Number ： 11010CS 530600學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 20
中文名稱  Course Title ：社群網路
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Social Networks
任課教師  Instructor ：李端興
上課時間  Time ： T5T6F5F6 上課教室  Room ：台達 109 ／ 116
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
1. Overview of the course
The past decade has seen a growing interest in the complex “connectedness” of
modern society. At the
heart of this fascination is the idea of a network. How we make decisions to
adopt a new idea, to invest by
buying/selling security stocks, or even to vote for a specific campaign
candidate is influenced by the people
that we are linked with. How people behave is affected by incentives and by
their expectations about the
behaviors of the people with whom they are linked.
In this course the students will be exposed to an interdisciplinary body of
knowledge in sciences,
engineering, social sciences, economics, business, political science and medical
health studies.
The goal of this course is to show how social network is applied to the study of
economics, political science,
and medical health study.
2. Subjects covered in this course
Students will be taught the state-of-the-art research results on social
networks, including Diffusion of
opinions, information, rumors and etc.
Application of social networks to the study of economics, markets, and stock
trading. Application of social
networks to the study of voting, election and political behavior
3. Topics covered
Representing and measuring networks
Empirical background on social, economic networks and health
Strategic Network Formation
Diffusion through networks
Learning and networks
Decisions, behavior, and games on networks
Networked markets
Game-theoretic modeling of networks
Allocation rules and cooperative games
Voting and election
4. Textbook
David Easley and Jon Kleinberg, “Networks, Crowds, and Markets: Reasoning about
a Highly Connected
World,” Cambridge University Press, 2010.
5. Reference books
Serge Galam, ``Sociophysics a Physicist’s Modeling of Psycho-political
Phenomena,” Springer, 2012.
Matthew O. Jackson, “Social and Economic Networks,” Princeton University Press,
2008.
Ahmad K. Naimzada, Silvana Stefani and Anna Torriero, “Networks, Topology and
Dynamics Theory and
Applications to Economics and Social Systems,” Springer, 2009.
6. Grading Policy
Homework (30%)
Midterm exam (20%)
Final (30%)
Class participation (20%)

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Advanced Discrete Structure
任課教師  Instructor ：韓永楷
上課時間  Time ： T5T6R4 上課教室  Room ：台達 105 ／ 142
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
This course is an extension to the Discrete Mathematics. We will introduce a 
couple of interesting and useful combinatorial mathematics tools and concepts, 
and we hope that by mastering these techniques, we can strengthen our problem 
solving abilities.
Most of our topics have direct application to important CS areas, including 
coding, crypotography, network design, data compression, theory of 
computation, and analysis of algorithms.
⼆、指定⽤書  (Text Book)  
    Introduction to Combinatorial Mathematics
    by C. L. Liu
三、參考書籍  (References)   
    1. Discrete Mathematics and Its Applications, by K. H. Rosen  
    2. Introduction to Algorithms, by T. H. Cormen and others
    3. Concrete Mathematics,       by R. Graham and others
四、教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)  
    Lectures and Tutorials (Lectures in English)
五、教學進度  (Syllabus)
    1.  Permutations and Combinations
    2.  Generating Functions
    3.  Recurrence Relations
    4.  Methods of Proving
    5.  Number Theory
    6.  Group Theory
    7.  Automata Theory

中文名稱  Course Title ：數值最佳化
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Numerical Optimization
任課教師  Instructor ：李哲榮
上課時間  Time ： W3W4F3F4 上課教室  Room ：台達 102 ／ 100
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
線上課程連結

https://eeclass.nthu.edu.tw/
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
Numerical optimization concerns the computations of the maximum (or the
minimum) of differentiable functions which can have one or several variables,
with or without constraints. Important classes in the numerical optimization
problems include linear programming, unconstrained optimization, and nonlinear
programming. This course will study the numerical algorithms and the
theoretical background for each problem. Applications that motivate the
computation, especially for machine learning and deep learning, will be focused.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
None
三、參考書籍 (References)
Numerical optimization, Jorge Nocedal and Stephen J. Wright
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture presentation.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Background introduction.
1.1 One variable optimization
1.2 Linear algebra
2. Unconstrained optimization
2.1 Optimality condition
2.2 Newton’s method
2.3 Line search method
2.4 Trust-Region method
2.5 Practical concerns
3. Linear programming
3.1 Geometry interpretation and properties
3.2. The simplex method
3.3. Duality, sensitivity, and complexity
4. Constrained programming
4.1. Lagrange multiplier and KKT conditions.
4.2. Feasible direction method
4.3. Penalty and Augmented Lagrange method.
4.4. Interior point methods
5. Numerical optimization for machine learning

1. Class participation (10)
2. Midterm exam (30)
3. Final exam (40)
4. Report (20)

科號  Course Number ： 11010CS 546000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 0
中文名稱  Course Title ：軟體專案管理
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Software Project Management
任課教師  Instructor ：黃慶育
上課時間  Time ： M5M6R5 上課教室  Room ：台達 108 ／ 116
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
(1) This course provides an overview of the roles, responsibilities, and
management methods of the technology project manager. The course assumes no prior
knowledge in management techniques and is intended to teach students how to
develop approaches and styles of management for software projects. The course
assumes a basic understanding of software analysis techniques. (2) Project
Management is presented from a practitioner s view. Special emphasis is placed on
professional standards such as IEEE software engineering standards, etc. Specific
topics include managing people, leadership, software development processes,
estimation, risk analysis, scheduling and tracking, leveraging measurements, and
project completion. In-class project meetings are held to reinforce people
management concepts. (3)We also give a step by step description of the
software
metrics. It will include introduction to foundations of measurement theory,
models of software engineering measurement, software products metrics, software
process metrics and measuring management.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
(1) Joel Henry, Software Project Management: A Real-World Guide to Success,
Addison Wesley, 2004.
(2) Norman Fenton & James Bieman, Software Metrics: A Rigorous and Practical
Approach, 3rd Edition, CRC Press, 2015
(3) Adolfo Villafiorita, Introduction to Software Project Management, Auerbach
Publications, 2014.
(4) Watts S. Humphrey, Introduction to the Team Software Process, Addison Wesley,
1999.
三、參考書籍 (References)
(1) Pankaj Jalote, Software Project Management in Practice, Addison-Wesley, 2002.
(2) Daniel Galin, Software Quality Assurance: From Theory to Implementation,
Addison Wesley, 2004.
(3) Watts S. Humphrey, PSP : A Self-Improvement Process for Software Engineers,
Addison Wesley, 2005.

第６週 . Measuring internal and external product attributes
第７週 . Business visit I ( 校外參訪 )
第８週 . Manage your people & implement your process
第９週 . Leverage your tools and form your vision
第１０週 . Midterm Exam.

科號  Course Number ： 11010CS 546100學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 0
中文名稱  Course Title ：軟體產品開發技術
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Development Technology on Software Production
任課教師  Instructor ：黃慶育
上課時間  Time ： W2W3W4 上課教室  Room ：資電  125 ／ 0
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
Practical development of software requires an understanding of successful methods
for bridging the gap between a problem to be solved and a working software system.
This course will expose students to techniques used to develop large software
systems. Major topics include system and requirements engineering, object-
oriented design, and systematic code testing techniques. The focus is on software
engineering principles and the methods/tools that support the principles. In
addition, we also give a step by step description of the software metrics. It
will include introduction to foundations of measurement theory, models of software
engineering measurement, software products metrics, software process metrics and
measuring management. Basically, the course is composed of the following basic
modules: (1) Measurement theory (overview of software metrics, basics of
measurement
theory, goal-based framework for software measurement, empirical
investigation
in software engineering), (2) Software product and process measurements (measuring
internal product attributes: size and structure, measuring external product
attributes: quality, measuring cost and effort, measuring software reliability,
software test metrics, object-oriented metrics), and (3) Measurement management.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
N. E. Fenton and S. L. Pfleeger, Software Metrics: A Rigorous and Practical
Approach, (2nd ed.), PWS Publishing, 1998.
三、參考書籍 (References)
Ian Sommerville, Software Engineering, Addison Wesley, Sixth Edition, 2001.

以投影片配合⼝述 , 必要時得搭配⿊板圖例說明⽅式。

依指定⽤書之內容每週 1~2 個章節 (Chapter) ，必要時酌量調整之
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
階段進度報告 (50%) ，期末成果展⽰及軟體競賽 (50%) 。

深
度與廣度。本課程希望透過訓練學⽣以準備軟體競賽的上課形式，要求修課學⽣遵循各種國際標準來
進⾏
軟體開發與測試及文件撰寫，同時對開發團隊所訂定的各種軟體品質政策以及品質⽬標能夠得到落

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
蔡老師的特⾊
https://youtu.be/mJhNr8xUGAA
老師是神奇⽯頭湯的引導者，奇妙的激發每⼀個⼈的潛能 !
老師細⼼佈局，⽤⼀種介於推⼒跟拉⼒之間的⼒量，讓我們不⾃覺的突破⾃⼰
老師⼈好，在矽⾕創業成功。但是絕不教你投機。同學上課有提出投機的點⼦，都會被老師當場提醒
投機成
不了事。老師和藹，念過神學但上課絕不會提宗教，有讓⼈易於親近的牧師氣質。  　
蔡老師不像是⼀般教導專業知識的教授，反⽽更像我們的導師 (mentor) 。我們如同⽺群⼀般，容易埋
頭吃
草⽽迷失了⽅向，老師如同牧⽺⼈在我們偏差時拉我們回到正確的道路上。
老師常⼀針⾒⾎，可以⼀句話將我們所有⼈打醒。
⼈好，但課怎麼會很操？這是蔡老師 " 溫和但不苟且 " 的獨特風格 ...
課程特⾊
與創業要付出的成本相比，這⾨課絕對是零成本
課堂中講授⼀套非常有系統性的創業學習⽅法，包含創業過程中的各項要素。內容更是包含了⼯程師
平常接
觸不到的⾏銷與財務，團隊的風險控管等
這⾨課真正的精華與挑戰不是在於課堂上的學習，⽽是在  " 課外 ” 每個禮拜與老師的 15 分鐘  meeting, 個
⼈
作
業與團隊的討論
蔡老師所要傳授給我們的是⼀種  “ 計畫型創業 ” 訓練。因為創業影響的不只是你⾃⼰的時間與⽣活，必
須⼀
起考慮你的創業伙伴、員⼯。你的決定可能影響他們⼀輩⼦ !
High-Tech Entrepreneurship
Ren-Song Tsay, Ph.D.
National Tsing-Hua University
School of Electrical Engineering and Computer Science
Course Description:
This course offers an intensive one semester emulation of a hi-tech company
start-up process and hence it demands heavy self-motivated reading, research,
and
hands-on practice. Students are responsible for forming teams of four to five
people, although the teacher may facilitate the process. At least half of the
members must be of engineering majors and two must be from business or law or
other school. Teamwork is essential for successful course completion. Each team
will need a technical advisor, business advisor and mentor. Three hours of
lecture
each week will cover systematic business plan writing steps. Outside of class,
students are expected to spend at least 12 hours each week on reading, research,
group discussions, and meetings with advisors and mentors. In the final week, a
business plan presentation to invited venture capitalists will determine the
final
grade.
Course objective:
This course is designed to bridge the gap between the academic and real world.
Each team will create a solid business plan; receive critique from practiced
venture capitalists. Upon completion, the team should be able to start a company
if desires so. However, even if the plan is not realized, each student will
acquire equivalent start-up experience and will be well-equipped for future
success. .
Textbook:
⾼科技創業與營運  https://readmoo.com/book/210175476000101

Course Requirements:
1. To mimic the real business environment, each deadline is a hard
deadline. No late reports will be accepted.
2. At the second class meeting, students must submit a 4-page biography
and a 1-page resume introducing themselves.
3. Every other week, each student must submit a 5-page book report on
the required reading.
4. Every week, each team has to complete a section of the business
plan, as covered in class.
5. In the final week, each team will present a 20 minute complete
business plan.
Note: All students have the choice to write in either Chinese or English.
All reports should follow the standard essay writing style and be typed in
12 pt font and double-spaced.
Grading:
Individual reports 30%, Team business plan 20%, and VC presentation 50%.
科號  Course Number ： 11010CS 565600學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 75
中文名稱  Course Title ：深度學習
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Deep Learning
任課教師  Instructor ：吳尚鴻
上課時間  Time ： T7T8R7 上課教室  Room ：台達 107 ／ 150
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、  課程說明  (Course Description)
This class introduces the concepts and techniques of deep learning. The
course consists of three parts. In the first part, we give a quick introduction of
classical machine learning and review some key concepts required to understand
deep learning. In the second part, we
discuss how deep learning differs from classical machine learning and
explain why it is effective in dealing with complex problems such as the image and
natural language processing. Various CNN and RNN models will be covered. In the
third part, we introduce the deep reinforcement learning and its applications.
This course also gives coding labs. We will use Python 3 as the main
programming language throughout the course. Some machine learning libraries such
as Scikit-learn and TensorFlow will be explained and heavily used.
Students are required to have proper understanding of Calculus, Linear
Algebra, Probability Theory, and the Python programming language. Although it
would be helpful, knowledge about classical machine learning is NOT required.
IMPORTANT: Students will group (3~4 people a group). This class requires
**each group of students to prepare a GPU card** to perform the necessary
computing. You can follow this
link (http://timdettmers.com/2017/04/09/which-gpu-for-deep-learning/) to
decide which GPU card to go for. NO GPU CARD PROVIDED IN THE CLASS.
⼆、  指定⽤書  (Textbook)
Ian Goodfellow, Yoshua Bengio, Aaron Courville, Deep Learning, MIT Press,
2016, ISBN:
0387848576
四、  教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
Video Lecture + Labs
五、  教學進度  (Syllabus)
1. Fundamentals of Machine learning (5 weeks)
2. Neural Networks (NNs): Design
3. NN Optimization and Regularization
4. Computer Vision & CNNs
5. Natural Language Processing & RNNs
6. Unsupervised learning
7. Semi-supervised & transfer learning
8. Deep reinforcement learning (2 weeks)
六、  成績考核  (Evaluation)
Quiz: 20%
Assignments: 40%
Competitions/projects: 40%
科號  Course Number ： 11010CS 573200學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 30
中文名稱  Course Title ：巨量資料分析導論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Massive Data Analysis
任課教師  Instructor ：王家祥  Wang, Jia-Shung
上課時間  Time ： W3W4F3 上課教室  Room ：資電  127 ／ 0
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
課程⽬標：培養學⽣具備巨量資料分析之概念、理論與演算法。
The course will discuss data mining and statistical learning algorithms
for analyzing very large amounts of data, with emphasis on social network
graphs mining and large scale machine learning.
Topics include: Frequent itemsets and Association rules, Near Neighbor
Search in High Dimensional Data, Locality Sensitive Hashing (LSH),
Dimensionality reduction, Recommendation Systems, Clustering, link
Analysis, Large scale supervised machine learning, Data streams, Mining
the Web for Structured Data, Relation extraction and Web Advertising.
⼆、課程⼤綱 (Outline)
Chapter 1 Data Mining
Chapter 2 Map-Reduce and the New Software Stack
Chapter 3 Finding Similar Items
Chapter 4 Mining Data Streams
Chapter 5 link Analysis
Chapter 6 Frequent Itemsets
Chapter 7 Clustering
Chapter 8 Advertising on the Web and Bandit Algorithms
Chapter 9 Recommendation Systems
Chapter 10 Mining Social-Network Graphs
Chapter 11 Dimensionality Reduction
Chapter 12 Large-Scale Machine Learning, Random Forests, Perceptrons, SVM
三、指定⽤書 (Textbook)
Jure Leskovec, Anand Rajaraman, Jeff Ullman, “Mining of Massive Datasets,”
v3.0 beta edition, Cambridge University Press, 2018.
四、參考書籍 (References)
1. Kai Hwang and Min Chen, “Big-Data Analytics for Cloud, IoT and Cognitive
Computing,” John Wiley & Sons,
2017.
2. Nate Silver, “The Signal and the Noise: Why So Many Predictions Fail —
but Some Don't,” Penguin, 2012.
五、先修  (Prerequisites)
六、教學進度 (Syllabus)

Homework and Program Assignments 55%

英文名稱  Course English Title ： AI seminars
任課教師  Instructor ：賴尚宏
郭昱廷
上課時間  Time ： F3F4 上課教室  Room ：台達 103 ／ 121
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course aims to provide an overview of the latest advances in AI technology
with a focus on practical applications in the industry. The AI technologies
considered in this course includes machine learning/deep learning, computer vision,
natural language processing, speech recognition, etc. In this course, we will
invite renowned international and domestic subject matter expert guest speakers
from the industry and academia to discuss the current trends of the AI research,
opportunities, and challenges of AI deployment. This course features not only an
overview of the latest advances in AI technology but also practical applications of
AI technology in the industry. Upon completion of this course, the students shall
have an overall understanding of the latest AI technology and its practical
applications in the industry.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Assigned paper readings.
三、參考書籍 (References)
Reference papers and books.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Class and online lectures
Student presentations
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction to AI
2. Machine learning and AI I (supervised and unsupervised learning)
3. Machine learning and AI II (reinforcement learning and deep learning)
4. Advances in CV - Image understanding & object detection
5. Application of CV - Business Form processing
6. Application of CV - Bio-metric access control
7. Application of CV – Human Tracking
8. Advances in NLP - The Transformer
9. Application of NLP - Conversational AI/Assistant
10. Advances in speech recognition
11. Application of speech recognition
12. Application in retail
13. Application in healthcare
14. Project presentations
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Class participation (30%), Reports (30%), Project presentation (40%)

科號  Course Number ： 11010CS 761000學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 0
中文名稱  Course Title ：深度增強式學習專題
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Special Topics on Deep Reinforcement Learning
任課教師  Instructor ：李濬屹
上課時間  Time ： RaRb 上課教室  Room ：資電  131 ／ 0
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程為開設給⼤四，碩⼠，博⼠的研究所課程，為⼀個探討深度增強式學習的深入主題的課程。由
於
深度增強式學習的發展⽇新⽉異，其中包含的特殊主題，包含探索  (Exploration) 、元學習  (meta
Learning) 、基於模型之增強式學習  (Model-based Reinforcement Learning) 、多代理⼈增強式
學習  (Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning) 、模仿學習  (Imitation Learning) 等等。這些
研究主題通常並無包含於基礎的機器學習以及深度學習課程，但卻都是最近⼀兩年於深度增強式學習
最
為前沿且最重要的研究⽅向。此課程將以專題討論的模式，搭配深度增強式學習模型實作，訓練修課
學
⽣實際學習以上這些研究領域，以對深度增強式學習領域有更優秀的研究實⼒。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
無，本課程將探討最新的增強式學習領域，主要將以研究論文為主。研究論文將來⾃機器學習最頂尖
的
會議，包含 NeurIPS 、 ICML 、 IJCAI 、 AAAI 、 CoRL 、 AAMAS 等。
三、參考書籍 (References)
“Reinforcement Learning: An Introduction” by R. S. Sutton and A. G. Barto, Second
Edition.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
本課程將使⽤專題討論的形式，每週探討不同的深度增強式學習的主題，教材包含最新機器學習頂尖
會
議的研究論文。課程中將⿎勵學⽣對論文內容提出質疑，⿎勵學⽣提出改善⽅案，尤其希望參與課程
的
學⽣能夠實際將⾃⾝想法與概念經由實驗，投稿⾄頂尖 AI 研討會。
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
本課程教學進度將根據以下進度規劃 :
- 深度增強式學習基礎回顧  (Review of Deep Reinforcement Learning Concepts) – 2 Weeks
- 探索  (Exploration) – 2 Weeks
- 元學習  (meta Learning) – 3 Weeks
- 基於模型之增強式學習  (Model-based Reinforcement Learning) – 3 Weeks
- 多代理⼈增強式學習  (Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning) – 3 Weeks
- 模仿學習  (Imitation Learning) – 3 Weeks
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
本課程的成績將由以下⽅式評量 :
- 課程討論參與、研究論文評析  (40%)
- 期末專題實作  (60%)
七、可連結之網⾴位址  相關網⾴ (Personal Website)
無，採⽤ ILMS 進⾏課程討論與參與，以及做也繳交等。

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Special Topics in Data Base Management Systems(II)

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
This course is designed for graduate students who are interested in knowing
state-
of-the arts and applications of the information technology. The objective
of
this
course is: 1) guide students to recognize the current state of the art of
information technology and emerging killing applications; 2) identify their
research topics; and 3) write a research proposal in the related fields.
Students
will learn how to find an interesting IT application problem by surveying a
specific application domain, understand the current information techniques
available to solve the problem, assess the applicability and weakness of the
current IT technology to the problem, narrow down specific aims as research
goal
for writing a research problem.

390002學分  Credit ： 1 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 10
中文名稱  Course Title ：書報討論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Seminar
任課教師  Instructor ：邱于芯
上課時間  Time ： R2 上課教室  Room ：⽣⼆  213 ／ 30
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Course Requirement:
1.The presentation order will be decided in the first class.
2.Each student will select and present a peer-reviewed research paper (i.e.,
no Reviews/Perspectives), published in the last 4 years (2017~2021) by any of
the corresponding authors below:
David E. Clapham; Karl Deisseroth; Catherine Dulac; Ehud Isacoff; Akiko
Iwasaki; Lily Y. Jan; Thomas J. Jentsch; David Julius; Zachary A. Knight;
Ardem Patapoutian; Kodi Ravichandran; David M. Sabatini; Bernardo Sabatini;
Li-Huei Tsai.
Or, a peer-reviewed research paper, published within 2 years (2019-2021),
depicting roles of ion channels in non-excitable cells (i.e.g, not neurons nor
muscle cells) on journals with Impact Factor >10
(https://jcr.clarivate.com/).
Grading Criteria (pending to change):
1. Oral presentation (45%):
o Submit the paper of choice on time (5%)
o Post your paper of choice on time (5%)
o Submit the presentation slides on time (5%)
o Averaged score from the Presentation Evaluation Form (30%)
2. Participation (40%):
o Submit 2 questions to iLMS (22%)
o participate in Q&A (18%)
3. Attendance (15%): no skipping class more than 2 times without prior
notice or acceptable reasons. Student coming in 10 minutes after class start
is considered as skipping class.
4. Presentation in English: for those who choose to present the paper in
English, additional 5 bonus points will be added to the final score. Note, the
final score is capped at 100 pts.
Online Resources:
NCBI Pubmed ：  http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/
Journal Citation Reports ： https://jcr.clarivate.com/
Google Scholar: https://scholar.google.com/
Faculty of 1000: https://f1000.com/prime/home
bioRxiv: https://www.biorxiv.org/

⼀、  課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程⽬的為
1. 培養學⽣搜尋彙整及閱讀科學期刊的能⼒
2. 訓練學⽣整合論文內容並闡述其內容
3. 練習答辨與發問的技巧
4. 瞭解論文所闡述之相關知識與當今該領域之發展情形
5. 找出該論文的不⾜或不當之處，並思考改善及解決⽅法（進階）

Cell Series, Nature Series, Science Series, EMBO J, PNAS 等
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method):
學⽣先分為 2-3 個⼩組，⼩組討論決定報告主題後再各⾃去找該主題相關之論文，每⼈分配⼀篇論
文做⼝頭報告。學⽣必需在上課前⼀週上傳報告期刊文章，讓其他同學事先閱讀。報告論文必需是
⼆年內發表之論文。在老師的指導下，學⽣藉由簡報⽅式闡述該論文內容，報告時間不超過 40 分
鐘，其他的學⽣也⼀起參與討論。期末報告總結⼩組所選主題之論文內容，將其內容彙整並撰寫⼼
得。
所有資料與報告均上傳⾄ NTHU iLMS e-learning system
五、教學進度 (Syllabus):
第⼀週：說明教學規範及如何準備分組專題討論、搜集資料、研定題⽬ , 同時分組
第⼆週⾄最後⼀週：學⽣依⼩組分組依序簡報相關主題論文
六、成績考核 (Evaluation):

出席  10%

2.對論文的觀點或實驗提出有效質疑，思考並提出改善⽅法

本課程將由企業基本概念介紹為開端（包括企業組織類型﹑企業外在環境與企業在社會之⾓⾊扮演
等），企業內部機能（包括⼈⼒資源﹑⾏銷﹑⽣產﹑研究發展﹑財務）為主軸，詳述現階段與未來

Ch 6 Organizing the Business
Ch 7 Operations Management and Quality

Ch 8 Employee Behavior and Motivation
Ch 9 Leadership and Decision Making

COMPETITIVE ADVANTAGE

Ch12 Developing and Pricing Products
Ch13 Distributing and Promoting Products
PART V: MANAGING INFORMATION FOR BETTER BUSINESS DECISIONS
Ch14 Information Technology (IT) for Business
Ch15 The Role of Accountants and Accounting Information
PART VI: THE FINANCIAL SYSTEM AND ISSUES IN FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT
Ch16 Understanding Money and the Role of Banking
Ch17 Managing Business Finances

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
不論是營利事業或非營利事業，亦不論是組織規模的⼤⼩，「成本」經常是管理者做決斷時所需要
的關鍵性資訊。本課程主要的⽬的，在循序漸進地介紹與討論各類成本計算的⽅法與成本管理的理
論，引導學⽣瞭解處於動態環境下的組織，如何運⽤成本會計的技術進⾏規劃、控制及做決策。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Horngren's Cost Accounting: A Managerial Emphasis (GE)
三、參考書籍 (References)
無
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
課堂講授、練習及討論。
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
本學期預定進度為  Chapters 1-12
Ch 1 The Manager and Management Accounting
Ch 2 An Introduction to Cost Terms and Purposes
Ch 3 Cost–Volume–Profit Analysis
Ch 4 Job Costing
Ch 5 Activity-based Costing and Activity-based Management
Ch 6 Master Budget and Responsibility Accounting
Ch 7 Flexible Budgets, Direct-Cost Variances, and Management Control
Ch 8 Flexible Budgets, Overhead Cost Variances, and Management Control
Ch 9 Inventory Costing and Capacity Analysis
Ch10 Determining How Costs Behave
Ch11 Data Analytic Thinking and Prediction
Ch12 Decision Making and Relevant Information

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
** 詳細規定將在課堂宣佈 **
本課程為教授基礎總體經濟理論的要旨與其內涵。其重⼼與
⽬的有三。第⼀、介紹總體經濟理論對於總合變數與宏觀現
象的解釋，預測與分析。第⼆為注重經濟模型的介紹，簡⾔
之是以模型為分析⼯具，使學⽣熟捻對模型的設定，操作與
對其之詮釋。第三點注重在當代總體經濟理論的演化與其歷
史背景。

科號  Course Number ：
11010ECON309102學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 80
中文名稱  Course Title ：總體經濟學⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Macroeconomics (I)
任課教師  Instructor ：黃朝熙

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程將介紹總體經濟學的基本觀念與架構，包括衡量總產量與價格⽔準等的重要總體經濟變數、廠
商的投資與勞動
需求理論、家計單位的消費與勞動供給理論、以及商品、勞動與資產市場的均衡分析。最後，本課程
將利⽤上述市場
均衡的架構，分析⻑期經濟成⻑的關鍵因素。
This course introduces the structure of macro economy and major concept of macroeconomics: including the
variables measuring aggregate output and general price level, theories on consumption, investment, labor
demand/supply, and asset allocation. The course also introduce the concept of goods market, labor market
and asset market equilibrium. Finally, the course introduces important theories on economic growth.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Abel, Andrew, Bernanke, Ben, and Croushore, Dean, Macroeconomics, 10th edition, Global Edition, Pearson
Education, 2020. （雙葉書廊 )
三、參考書籍 (References)
Barro, Robert, Macroeconomics (any edition)
Mankiw, Gregory N., Macroeconomics (any edition)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
講授⽅式
Lecture.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
本課程將涵蓋  Abel, Bernanke and Croushore 教科書的第 1 章⾄第 7 章，平均約每六堂課教完⼀章。
The course will cover chapters 1-7 of Abel, Bernanke and Croushore.

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
介紹期貨市場之運作⽅式及各期貨交易所之商品內容  , 除深入淺出說明期貨與選擇權的理論定
價模式外 , 將充分探討實務上的策略應⽤。整個課程設計兼顧理論與實務，搭配介紹其他衍⽣性
⾦融商品之操作，期使同學們能完全領會期貨市場的奧妙與威⼒ !
The operation mechanism of futures market and the products in major Futures
Exchanges will be introduced in this course. By taking the course, students
will learn the futures trading both from pricing theory and practical
transactions. Additional material about other derivative products is also
provided to let students understand the most delicate knowledge in futures
market.

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
這⾨課要將深入介紹文化經濟學的重要主題，並且指導同學瞭解相關的理論與應⽤實務。文化經濟學
在經
濟學界已有很⻑的歷史，近年來因為各國文化與創意產業的蓬勃發展以及相關政策的關注，⽽在學術
界受
到重視。學術研究文獻快速成⻑，相關的應⽤實務著作更為可觀，這⾨課將要求同學⼤量閱讀文獻，
並且
應⽤於國內的產業實務個案與政策分析。選修同學必須具備個體經濟學分析基礎，以及對於文化與創
意產
業活動的興趣。每位選修的同學必須有積極閱讀與收集資料，⼀學期之中，我們會有許多的⼝頭報告
與撰
寫作業的要求，具有很強的學習意願與準備的同學才適合選這⾨課。上課⽅式以同學報告討論為主，
⼀學
期將有多次作業，期末必須完成⼀份研究報告，學期成績將依據綜合表現。

任課教師  Instructor ：李怡嫺
上課時間  Time ： TaTbTc 上課教室  Room ：台積 104 ／ 94
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
1.To introduce to the students the conceptual structure of accounting. This
course is designed to develop an in-depth understanding of the concepts,
principles, and practices of financial accounting under IFRS.
The emphasis is on understanding and applying basic accounting principles
and other concepts that guide the reporting of the effect of transactions
and other economic events on the financial condition and operating results
of a business.
2.To provide an opportunity to apply theoretical solutions to practical
problems.
Since this course is offered to students with non-accounting major and that
the number of participants is expected to be manageable, the detailed
contents of the course may be adjusted and tailored, during the semester, to
the needs of the class and in accordance with the different backgrounds of
the participants.
With over 15-year experience in the accounting profession, the instructor is
also prepared and keen to share, whenever appropriate, her experiences as a
accounting manager with certificate of CPA(Certified Public Accountant)in
USA and SAP Finance consultant ; particularly, the accounting's application
in the Accounting policies and procedures and accounting system .
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Intermeditate Accounting, IFRS Edition
By Donald E.Kieso/Jerry J. Weygandt/Terry D. Warfield
三、參考書籍 (References)

科號  Course Number ：
11010ECON524800學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 18
中文名稱  Course Title ：應⽤產業經濟學專題⼆
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Topics on Applied Industrial Economics II
任課教師  Instructor ：祁⽟蘭
上課時間  Time ： R3R4Rn 上課教室  Room ：台積 732 ／ 18
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
I. Course introduction
It is important to understand why regions or countries have different growth
rates. Knowledge creation, flows, and capitalization are important elements in
stimulating economic growth and development. Governments around the world are
searching for ways to join the power of science, technology and innovation to
foster economic development and growth. This course aims to link between
theories of entrepreneurship, innovation and economic growth and development.
The course begins with an introductory session on entrepreneurship, followed
by an overview of current research on the topic and provides an overview of
data resources and research methods used in entrepreneurship and public policy
studies. Later sections include a discussion of entrepreneurship, innovation
and economic growth. In addition to entrepreneurships, the technological
innovation and associated institutional innovation have played essential roles
in the process of economic transformation. In this course, we will discuss
theoretical and empirical issues pertaining to the entrepreneur. Some
empirical methods in assessing the policy and institutional that regions or
countries can pursue are also covered.
Reference:
(AA) Handbook of Entrepreneurship Research, by Acs and Audretsch (2010)
Springer Publishers.
Acs, Zoltan, Pia Arenius, Michael Hay and Maria Minniti (2005) Global
Entrepreneurship Monitor, Boston, London, and various years.
http://www.gemconsortium.org/
II. Evaluation:
Participation in class discussion: 30%
Project: 70% (Final Project to be presented in class)
III. Course Outline
A. Entrepreneurship, Innovation and Economic Growth
1. Introduction
2. Entrepreneurship and Economic Growth
3. New Growth Theory - Creative Destruction
4. Knowledge Spillover Theory of Entrepreneurship
5. Agglomeration Economics and Firm Productivity
B. Technological Innovation, agglomeration and regional development
China: Fan and Scott, 2003;
High-tech computer: Wallace and Walls, 2004
C. Empirical Issues
1. Causal Inference and Propensity Score Matching
2. Difference-in-Difference Estimation for Policy and Practice Evaluation

科號  Course Number ： 11010EE 221002學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 70
中文名稱  Course Title ：電路學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Electric Circuits
任課教師  Instructor ：吳財福
上課時間  Time ： M3M4W1W2 上課教室  Room ：台達 216 ／ 103
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This is one of the mandatory courses for the EE Department. This course
introduces the basic theory of linear circuit analysis, which is essential for
designing complex electronic, communication, computer, and control systems.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Svoboda and Dorf, Dorf’s Introduction to Electric Circuits, Global Edition,
Wiley
Course materials available on https://elearn.nthu.edu.tw/
三、參考書籍 (References)
To be determined.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lectures in English
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Zero-Order Circuits
& Circuit variables and elements
& Resistive circuits
& Method of analysis of resistive circuits
& Circuit theorems
First-Order Circuits
& Operational amplifiers
& Energy storage elements
& Complete response of RL and RC circuits
Second-Order Circuits
& Circuits with two energy storage elements (RLC circuits)
& Sinusoidal steady-state analysis
& AC steady-state power

1. Quizzes (30%)
2. Mid-term Examination (35%)
3. Final Examination (35%)

科號  Course Number ： 11010EE 224501學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 70
中文名稱  Course Title ：電⼦電路實驗
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Microelectronics Labs.
任課教師  Instructor ：陳新  CHEN HSIN
上課時間  Time ： M7M8M9 上課教室  Room ：台達 216 ／ 103
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course is intended for EE students at the junior level who have already
taken the courses in basic circuit theory and micrelectronics. Students will
get
hands-on experiences through experiments to complement the learning of
microelectronics and circuit theories. Op-amps, passive elements (e.g. R, L,
and
C), and transistors will be used extensively to implement various circuits.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Class Handout
三、參考書籍 (References)
N/A
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Powerpoint presentation and blackboard
因應防疫規定， 9/21 以前的課程改採 Google Meet 線上教學⽅式進⾏，課程連結如下
電⼦電路實驗
9⽉ 13⽇  ( 星期⼀ ) · 下午 3:30 - 6:00
視訊通話連結： https://meet.google.com/xqi-mkkh-rvd
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Introduction to Lab Instruments (1 week)
Lab 1: DC and AC Circuits (2 weeks)
Lab 2: Time-Domain Responses of 1st- and 2nd-order Circuits (2 weeks)
Lab 3: Oscillator Circuits (2 weeks)
Lab 4: Passive Filters (1 week)
Lab 5: Active Filters (4 weeks)
Lab 6: Parameter extraction of MOS Transistors (2 weeks)
Lab 7: Single-Stage and Multi-Stage MOS Amplifiers (3 weeks)
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Lab report: 60% and Final exam: 40%

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Microelectronics Labs.

上課時間  Time ： T7T8T9 上課教室  Room ：台達 217 ／ 135
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course is intended for EE students at the junior level who have already
taken the basic circuit theory and micrelectronics. Students will get hands-on
experiences through experiments to complement the learning of microelectronics
circuit theories. Op-amps, passive elements (e.g. R, L, and C), and
transistors will be used extensively to implement various circuits.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Class Handout
三、參考書籍 (References)
N/A
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Powerpoint presentation and blackboard
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Introduction to Lab Equipments (1 week)
Lab 1: DC and AC Circuits (2 weeks)
Lab 2: Time-Domain Responses of 1st- and 2nd-order Circuits (2 weeks)
Lab 3: Oscillator Circuits (2 weeks)
Lab 4: Passive Filters (1 week)
Lab 5: Active Filters (2 weeks)
Lab 6: Parameter extraction of MOS Transistors (2 weeks)
Lab 7: Single-Stage and Multi-Stage MOS Amplifiers (3 weeks)
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Lab report: 60% and Final exam: 40%

科號  Course Number ： 11010EE 225500學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 80
中文名稱  Course Title ：電⼦學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Electronics
任課教師  Instructor ：徐碩鴻  Hsu Shuo Hung
上課時間  Time ： T3T4R3R4 上課教室  Room ：台達 217 ／ 135
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course is an introductory course of microelectronics. We will focus
on the fundamental knowledge of microelectronic circuits and emphasize the
design-oriented approach. This course introduces the most important concepts
for design of analog circuits such as characteristics of semiconductors,
operating principles of diodes and transistors, and various amplifier
configurations for both BJTs and MOSFETS. The frequency response,
differential
pairs, multi-stage amplifiers are also included. By developing solid
understanding of basic knowledge, learning microelectronics could be
enjoyable.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Behzad Razavi, “Fundamentals of Microelectronics,” 2nd edition, Wiley, 2013
三、參考書籍 (References)
A. Sedra and K. Smith, "Microelectronic circuits," 6th edition, Oxford
university press, 2011
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Power point handouts are used in this class together with a tablet computer
for equation derivation and additional materials. The course materials are
also recorded by the software "powercam" and uploaded in the iLMS system for
easy access and review. The iLMS system also provides an effective platform
for the interaction among the teacher, TAs, and students. A quiz is held on
a
bi-weekly basis to help the students following the course schedule. The
homework is also assigned bi-weekly to let the students practice for
comprehensive understanding. The students also have the opportunity to use
the
CAD tool (SPICE) for circuit
simulation and design to verify the materials learned in the class.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction to microelectronics (ch. 1)
- Examples of electronic systems
- Basic circuit theorems
2. Basic physics of semiconductors and diodes (ch. 2 and ch. 3)
- Semiconductor material properties
- PN junction and diodes
- Diode circuits and applications
3. Basic physics of transistors and their equivalent circuit models
(ch. 4 and ch. 6)
- Basic structures and characteristics of MOSFETs and BJTs
- Equivalent circuit model of MOSFETs and BJTs
- Large-signal and small-signal operation
4. Single-stage (multi-stage) amplifiers and frequency response
(ch. 5, ch. 7, ch. 9, and ch. 11)
- Operating point analysis and design
- MOSFET and BJT amplifier topologies (CS, CG, CD, and cascode)
- Transfer function and Bode's plot
- Frequency response of different amplifiers
5. Differential amplifiers (ch. 9 and ch. 10)
- Basic MOS and BJT differential pairs
- Large-signal and small-signal analysis
- Current mirror and active load
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Homework: 25%
Quiz: 25%
Midterm: 25%
Final: 25%

https://eeclass.nthu.edu.tw/

Course Description
This course is targeted at those who are interested in programming but have not learned anything in this area
before. We chose the C programming language because it is the most widely used in the world. All course
lectures will be given in computer labs. In each lecture, students are expected to learn the designated material,
complete some small tasks, and upload to our server to get points. Attendance is mandatory (could be done
online if Covid-19 is not contained). If you register in this course, you are expected to GET UP BEFORE
8AM TWICE A WEEK. For those who could not register but wish me to sign, please show up in our class for
the first two weeks. I will only sign the add/drop form right at the deadline if you manage to do so.
請注意：這是早八的課程，⽽且是全上機，每次上課都會有記錄（等於每堂課點名），沒有決⼼每週
兩次八點以前起床上課的同學⼀定無法滿⾜課程要求（不會及格）
選不上本課程但有興趣學習的同學，只要你有決⼼早起上課，學習動機強，我們也有少量加簽名額，
請前兩週直接來上課（或者遠距，視疫情狀況），只有前兩週都不缺課的同學我才會加簽。

中文名稱  Course Title ：計算機程式設計
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Programming

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
The main objective of this introductory course is to help students develop programming skills to solve
problems. As computers are becoming more powerful and ubiquitous, proper use of computers can increase
productivity significantly. Thus, the ability to write efficient programs to solve problems improves one’s core
competence and can be an important differentiator for one’s career. Among today’s popular programming
languages, C is found to have the biggest impacts. Many modern computer languages borrowed heavily from
C. Thus, proficiency in C language would pave ways to good programming in other languages. In this course,
we will devote most of the time in C programming. object-oriented programming and classes, however,
will
also be briefly introduced.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
C Programming: A Modern Approach, 2nd Edition by K. N. King
三、參考書籍 (References)
The C Programming Language, 2nd edition, by B.W. Kernighan and D.M. Ritchie
The C++ Programming Language: Special Edition by Bjarne Stroustrup
Starting Out with C++ Early objects, 6th Edition, by Tony Gaddis, Judy Walters, Godfrey Muganda,
Addison Wesley.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture and in-class practice
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Introduction
Input/output
Variables and data types
expressions and operators
Conditional statements
Iteration statements
Functions
Arrays and pointers
Standard libraries
Classes and object-oriented programming

“光電⼯程 ” 課程⼤綱  (“Introduction to Optics and Photonics” syllabus)
背景：  本課程將原來的光電⼯程 I 以及光電⼯程 II 合併為⼀⾨課，上、下學期都開。主要的⽬的
在介紹光學以及光⼦學的基礎概念以及產業應⽤，希望同學即使未來不⾛光電領域，也能具備
光電領域的紮實基本觀念以及對於光電應⽤的⾼度興趣以俾應⽤於未來的跨領域產業。
開課年級：三年級上、下學期都開
學分數： 3
參考課本： ”Optics” by Eugen Hecht, “Fundamentals of Photonics” by Saleh and
Teich,
and lecture notes.
任課教師：趙  煦
授課內容
（1）  Review of basic EM theory （ 1 week ）
（2）  Imaging optics （ 2 weeks ）
─ Fermat’s principle and optical components
─ Lens and lens system
─ Ray transfer matrix
─ Practice on imaging system design with Zemax
（3）  Fourier optics （ 2 weeks ）
─ Spatial frequency analysis of image and light propagation
─ Diffraction phenomenon
─ Fourier transform properties of lens and application
─ Analysis on imaging resolution
（4）  Physical optics （ 3 weeks ）
─ Polarization and interface optics
─ Crystal optics and applications
─ Guided-wave optics and optical dispersion
─ Non-linear and short-pulse photonics
─ Modulation of light
（5）  Laser principle and applications （ 3 weeks ）
─ Resonator optics
─ Concept of coherence
─ Basics of photon optics
─ Photon-atom interactions
─ Laser amplifier
─ Laser oscillation
─ Common lasers and applications
─ Interferometers and applications
（6）  Field visit to industry 台灣代表性光電產研領域介紹及參觀（ 4 weeks ）
─ ⾏動光電（兩場次演講及兩家廠商參觀）
─ 綠能光電（兩場次演講及兩家廠商參觀）
─ 光通訊（兩場次演講及兩家廠商參觀）
─ 同步輻射（⼀場次演講及參觀）

layout, RC-extraction) after finishing all the assigned homeworks and project.

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This is a fundamental course for analysis and design analog integrated
circuits.
It covers quantitative analyses, design considerations and system
applications
from circuit and physical viewpoints. Most material is for CMOS technology.
BJT
may be introduced briefly if needed.
Topics for this course includes
- Modern VLSI technologies, device operations and models.
- Elementary gain stages.
- Current sources.
- Frequency responses.
- Feedback, stability and compensation.
- Operational amplifiers.
- Bandgap references. (optional)
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Behzad Razavi, Fundamental of Microelectronics, John Wiley & Sons Inc.,
2009.
Behzad Razavi, Design of Analog CMOS Integrated Circuits, McGraw-Hill, 2016.
三、參考書籍 (References)
Paul R. Gray, Paul J. Hurst, Stephen H. Lewis, and Robert G. Meyer,
Analysis and Design of Analog Integrated Circuits,
5th Edition, John Wiley & Sons Inc., 2009.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture : 3 hours
Outside Reading : 3 hours
7 homework
1 term project
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
-Basic physics of MOS transistors and their equivalent circuit models (ch.
6)
-Elementary gain stages (ch. 7, ch. 9, and ch. 10)
-Frequency responses (ch. 11)
-Operational amplifier basics (ch. 8)
-Feedback, stability and compensation (ch. 12)
-Operational amplifiers (ch.9, Design of analog CMOS ICs)
-Bandgap references (ch.12, Design of analog CMOS ICs)
-Noise (ch.7, Design of analog CMOS ICs) (if time permits)
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Homework (1-7): 70 %
Term project: 30 %

科號  Course Number ： 11010EE 345000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 90
中文名稱  Course Title ：計算機結構
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Computer Architecture
任課教師  Instructor ：劉靖家
呂仁碩
上課時間  Time ： T3T4R3R4 上課教室  Room ：台達 215 ／ 135
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course will discuss the basic architecture, organization, and design of a modern computer system. The
contents cover instruction sets, computer arithmetic, processor core and pipelining, caches, virtual
memories, and parallel processors. Students are assumed to have taken courses on logic design and
programming in C/C++.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
David A. Patterson & John. L. Hennessy, Computer Organization and Design RISC-V Edition -- The
Hardware/Software Interface", 1st Ed., 2017, Morgan Kaufmann Publishers.
三、參考書籍 (References)
William Stallings, "Computer Organization and architecture -- Designing for
performance", 9th Ed., 2013, Pearson
Behrooz Parhami, "Computer Architecture", 2005, Oxford University Press
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
3-hour lecture per week.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
The lectures will be offered by two professors:
Part I: The Core Concepts on Computer Abstractions and Technology
(a)Basic introduction
(b)Instructions: Language of the Machine
(c)Arithmetic for Computers
Part II: Computer organization and design
(a)Basic processor design: Datapath and Control
(b)Enhancing Performance with Pipelining
(c)Large and Fast: Exploiting Memory Hierarchy
(d)Multi-cores and Multiprocessors*
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Programming Assignments 30%
Homework and Quiz 10%
Midterm Exam 30%
Final Exam 30%
七、可連結之網⾴位址
NTHU EEClass and Teams
科號  Course Number ： 11010EE 351000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 58
中文名稱  Course Title ：控制系統
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Feedback Control Systems
任課教師  Instructor ：邱偉育
上課時間  Time ： M3M4W2 上課教室  Room ：資電  104 ／ 0
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
Control systems have been used widely applied to solve engineering problems.
This class covers several basic but important concepts of control theory,
including open- and closed-loop control, system stability, root locus,
frequency response methods, Nyquist criterion, and system designs.
● 指定⽤書 (Text Books)
R. C. Dorf and R. H. Bishop, Modern Control Systems, 13th edition, Pearson
Prentice Hall, 2017.
● 參考書籍 (References)
1. Farid Golnaraghi and Benjamin C. Kuo, Automatic Control Systems, 10th
Edition, McGraw-Hill Education, 2017.
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Blackboard and Powerpoint presentation.
● 教學進度 (Syllabus)
Chapter 1 Introduction to Control Systems
Chapter 2 Mathematical Models of Systems
Chapter 4 Feedback Control System Characteristics
Chapter 5 The Performance of Feedback Control Systems
Chapter 6 The Stability of Linear Feedback Systems
Chapter 7 The Root Locus Method
Chapter 8 Frequency Response Methods
Chapter 9 Stability in the Frequency Domain
Chapter 10 The Design of Feedback Control Systems
● 成績考核 (Evaluation)
Exams: 25% x 4 = 100%
● 可連結之網⾴位址  相關網⾴ (Personal Website)
TBA.

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Digital Signal Processing Laboratory

上課時間  Time ： M7M8M9 上課教室  Room ：台達 209 ／ 53
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
EE3662 數位訊號處理實驗  (Digital Signal Processing Lab.)
**修課條件 : 必需修過⾄少訊號與系統以上以及會 C 或 C++ 程式設計  建議修過數位訊號處理概論
為佳
Class Hours: Mon. 15:30-18:20.
Class Room: 台達  209 教室 .
Practice Hours: Mon. 15:30-18:20.
Practice Room: 台達  219 DSP 與嵌入式系統教學實驗室 .
Instructors: 劉奕汶、李祈均、黃朝宗、李夢麟 ( 今年總負責 ) 、⾺席彬
Course objectives:
從應⽤出發，培養 DSP 實際解決問題的 sense 與經驗。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
None.
三、參考書籍 (References)
C-algorithms for real-time DSP, Paul M. Embree, Prentice Hall.
Digital Signal Processing Using MATLAB, 2nd ed., Vinay K. Ingle and John G.
Proakis,
Brooke/Cole Thomson Learning, 2007.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
本課程採⾳訊、影像、⽣醫三個⼤的單元，每個單元 4 週，由負責之教師（各兩位）負責實際授
課與帶實驗。期末則留有⼀些時間進⾏⾃訂專題 .
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Unit 1:
Biomedical application, ECG signal acquisition and processing (Prof. ⾺席彬、
李夢麟 )
Week 1: Course Logistics. Arduino platform and its communication with PC
Week 2: ECG circuitry, signal sampling and digitization
Week 3: Fundamental ECG digital signal processing
Week 4: Heart rate detection, final project ideas.
Unit 2:
Visual Signals (Prof. 黃朝宗 )
Week 1: Pixel Array Manipulation (3-hr lecture + take-home lab)
Week 2: Image Filtering and Hybrid Images
Week 3: Image Filtering and Corner Detection
Week 4: Seam Carving for Content-Aware Image Resizing
Unit 3:
Audio and Speech (Prof. 劉奕汶、李祈均 )
Week 1: Python Introduction & Mel-Frequency Cepstrum Coefficients (MFCC)
Week 2: Audio Reconstruciton from MFCC
Week 3: Environment Sound Classification
Week 4: Baby Sound Challenge
Final Project/ Final Presentation
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
由於此實驗課由六位老師及各⾃的助教帶領⼤家作實驗，以下為課程進⾏⽅式與要求：
A. 對老師與助教的要求
* 上課前⼀週透過 LMS 發佈講義與建議預習資料。
* Lecture (1 hr/week, approximately) 以介紹⼯具與經驗分享 (e.g., 可能遭遇的困難 )
* 每次實驗前準備好  check list ，供考核學⽣ demo 使⽤。
B. 學⽣的義務與權利：
* ⼀⼈⼀組，每次每個⼈需 demo 才可離開。
* 若下課或甚⾄當天晚上 (2100 以前）仍無法順利  demo ，則建議帶回家做，⾄遲下⼀週下課
(18:30)前補  demo ；請注意這是  hard deadline.
* 實驗結報每個⼈都要交， deadline: 隔週週⼀早上 8am 。
* 期末專題可依題⽬喜好分組。
C. 成績考核：
* Unit 1, 2, 3 各 25% ，期末專題  25%.
* 各單元內部， demo 通過後，以報告成績計算；若 demo 未通過，以零分計算

科號  Course Number ： 11010EE 412000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 25
中文名稱  Course Title ：固態物理導論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Solid-State Physics
任課教師  Instructor ：楊尚樺
上課時間  Time ： T3T4R4 上課教室  Room ：台達 212 ／ 22
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
This course provides basic principles and fundamental knowledges of solid state
physics. Course instructor will use notes, readings, presentations and in-class
discussions to guide students through several solid-state topics. In this course,
students will learn how to analyze thermal, optical and electrical properties of
solid-state devices. Moreover, cutting-edge research breakthroughs in related
fields would be included in this course. This way, students can get better ideas
of fundamental physics, solid-state devices and their impacts.
● 指定⽤書 (Text Books)
C. Kittel, "Introduction to Solid State Physics", 8th edition (Wiley)
● 參考書籍 (References)
M. A. Omar, “Elementary Solid State Physics”, 4th edition (Addison Wesley)
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
This course is offered in English. Lectures are composed by slides, science
updates, discussions and presentations.
● 教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Crystal Structure
2. Reciprocal Lattice
3. Crystal Binding
4. Phonon I: Crystal Vibration
5. Phonon II: Thermal Properties
6. Fermi Gas
7. Energy Band
● 成績考核 (Evaluation)
1. Participation: 40%
2. Homework Assignment: 10%
3. Midterm: 10%
5. Final: 20%
6. Oral Presentation: 10%
7. Final Report: 10%
● 可連結之網⾴位址  相關網⾴ (Personal Website)

Online teaching connection:
Microsoft Teams 110 上光電實驗  連結 :

4e95da1aae9f&tenantId=6c3bc511-43c7-4596-baeb-2335c69c41f1
This course includes 18 experiments on basic optics and electro-optics.
There are 3 experiments in geometrical optics, 4 in diffraction and
interference,
2 in
image
formation(including Fourier Optics), 2 in polarization(including crystal
Optics),
2 in
optical
holography, 3 in
lasers, 2 in optical modulation.
Students are required to have background in fundamental electromagnetism.
There are three hours laboratory work every week. 3 weeks of lecture on basic
theory
of the
experiments
will be given before lab work start.
實驗前有基本理論講解，有電磁學基礎即可。
本課與光電⼯程導論相輔相成，修過光電⼯程導論的同學，將可從本實驗課中，經由動⼿實
做，得到課堂理
論的具體驗
證。
實驗講義：每⼀實驗均包括基本原理及實驗操作。
科號  Course Number ： 11010EE 429200學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 60
中文名稱  Course Title ：積體電路設計實驗
英文名稱  Course English Title ： IC Design Laboratory
任課教師  Instructor ：黃朝宗
上課時間  Time ： R7R8R9
Ra上課教室  Room ：台達 216 ／ 103
台達 209／ 53
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
EE4292 IC Design Laboratory ( 積體電路設計實驗 )
**修課條件 : 必需修過邏輯設計、積體電路設計導論 ( ⾄少得同時修課 )
**課程特⾊ : 使⽤ 45nm 製程進⾏數位電路晶片之完整流程設計
**今年特點 (TBD): 預計有三週以「智慧影像處理 AI 加速器設計」為主題，提供額外的數位電路設計
之範例與練習
Class Hours: Thu 15:30-19:20
Lecture Room: 台達 209 教室
Lab Room: 資電 407 ( 電機系⼯作站教室 )
Instructor: 黃朝宗
TA: TBD
Course objectives:
學習如何將頭腦裡的想法與紙上的演算法，實際以數位電路設計的⽅式實現於晶片上。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
None.
三、參考書籍 (References)
- Cadence Lecture Manuals for Verilog (only in paper format)
- M. Keating and P. Bricaud, Reuse Methodology Manual for System-on-a-Chip
Designs, Springer, 2007.
- TSRI course lecture notes
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
本課程依數位電路設計的 cell-based design flow 分為三單元： Verilog 硬體描述語⾔、邏輯合
成、⾃動佈局繞線。
除了講堂上的授課以外，每週皆有上機實驗課程，另有五次數位電路設計作業 ( 例如先前有 RSA 加解碼
器、 QR code 編解碼器、 ResNet 卷積網路等 ) 與期末專題。本課程強調紮實的 Verilog 語⾔撰寫以及
CAD⼯具的操作，以實際體驗與了解數位電路設計的趣味與精髓。
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Part I – Verilog HDL: 四週
Part II – Logic synthesis: 四週
Part III – Placement & Routing: 三週
Final Project: 六週
智慧影像處理 AI 加速器設計 : 三週  (TBD)
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Lab (15%)
Homework (55%)
Term Project (30%)

iLMS website

科號  Course Number ： 11010EE 432001學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 32
中文名稱  Course Title ：固態電⼦實驗 -- 半導體製程與實驗
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Solid-State Electronics Laboratory-Semiconductor Processing
任課教師  Instructor ：邱博文
上課時間  Time ： T7T8T9 上課教室  Room ：台達 211 ／ 51
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
The silicon integrated circuit is surely one of the wonders of our age. The
ability to fabricate tens of millions of individual components on a chip with an
area of a few centimeter square has enabled the information age. This course
attempts to describe not only the manufacturing practice associated with the
technologies used in silicon chip fabrication, but also the underlying scientific
basis for those technologies. This course will show the students how silicon
field-effect transistors are made using the knowledge learned in the ULSI technologies.
However, due to the limited implementation hours, students can only fabricate
p-type or n-type MOSFET with characteristics measured and simulated.
⼆、參考書籍 (References)
1. J. D. Plummer, M. M. Deal, and P. B. Griffin, Silicon VLSI Technology, Prentice
Hall, 2000.
2. Michael Quirk and Julian Serda, Semiconductor Manufacturing Technology, Prentice
Hall, 2001.
3. Robert Doering and Yoshio Nishi, Handbook of Semiconductor Manufacturing Technology,
CRC Press 2008.
三、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
1. In Chinese
2. The TA will give the students a mini instruction of the fabrication process and principles.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. MOS structure and MOS process flow
2. RCA clean and Wet oxidation for MOS
3. Optical lithography-1 + Wet etching for MOS
4. TCAD simulation Ⅰ (Process)
5. TCAD simulation Ⅱ (Device)
6. Exam of TCAD simulation
7. RTA for MOS
8. Wet etching
9. Optical lithography-2 + Wet etching for MOS
10. metallization for MOS via E-gun
11. Optical lithography-3 + Wet etching for MOS
12. Backside metallization
13. Measurement of MOS
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
1. Pre-assessment: those who cannot pass the assessment will fail in the final score.
2. Simulation test (40%)
3. Measurement report (60%)

科號  Course Number ： 11010EE 465000學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 30
中文名稱  Course Title ：通訊系統實驗
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Communications System Laboratory
任課教師  Instructor ：劉光浩
上課時間  Time ： W7W8W9 上課教室  Room ：台達 202 ／ 32
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This class aims to offer hands-on experience for students to appreciate the principle of wireless
communications. For every week, there will be a one-hour lecture to introduce the underlining principle and
steps of the experiment unit and 2~3 hours of hands-on lab experiment. The class students will be able to use
the design tools to understand various aspects of modern wireless communication systems. However, the
mathematical derivation of communication theories is de-
emphasized in this class to facilitate the construction of both the hardware and the software systems. This class
is expected to be offered regularly every Fall semester for junior, senior under-graduates and first-year
graduate students.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Class Handouts and Notes
三、參考書籍 (References)
Class Handouts and Notes
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
One hour of weekly lecture plus 2~3 hours of weekly experiment
Lecture Session: W7 15:30 PM – 16:20 PM,
Lab Session: W8W9 16:30 PM – 18:20 PM,
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Coverage –
Lab0: Tutorial on LabVIEW
Lab1: M-sequence generator and AWGN Channel
Lab2: Wireless channel measurement
Lab3: Wireless RF Frontend
Lab4: Modulation(1): PSK 、 FSK 、 ASK
Lab5: Modulation(2): MSK 、 DPSK
Lab6: modulation(3):BPSK 、 QPSK 、  QAM 、 PAM
Lab7: Channel Emulation
Lab8: Channel coding
Lab9: Direct Sequence Spread Spectrum (DSSS)
Lab10: Frequency Hopping Spread Spectrum (FHSS)
Lab11: OFDM
One Final Term Project
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
1. 84% Lab Reports:
2. 16% Term Project

http://www.ee.nthu.edu.tw/~jmwu/ee4650/ee4650.htm

Machine learning has been proved useful for addressing a number of engineering
problems. Among various advanced machine learning methods, reinforcement
learning (RL) has attracted much attention because of its effectiveness and
simplicity. This course covers some basic ideas of RL and has the primary focus on the
software implementation of RL algorithms.

科號  Course Number ： 11010EE 521600學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 90
中文名稱  Course Title ：時序電路設計及應⽤
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Timing Circuit Designs and Their Applications
任課教師  Instructor ：黃錫瑜
上課時間  Time ： W6W7F5 上課教室  Room ：台達 216 ／ 103
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
* 課程說明  (General Description)
晶片內部的執⾏有⼀定的時序，就像⼈的脈搏⼀樣。因此，每⼀個晶片內部都常有時序相關的控制電
路，譬如鎖向迴路  (Phase-Locked Loop) 、鎖延遲迴路  (Delay-Locked Loop) 、時間量化器  (Time-
to-Digital Converter) 、數位轉時間之轉換器  (Digital-to-Time Converter) 等，這些電路在晶片
設計、設計⾃動化與測試等領域都有廣泛的應⽤  ( 如全晶片⾼速時脈之產⽣與控制，異質整合晶片時
脈訊
號同步、電路速度測試與分級、連接線速度量測與監控、晶片線上健康狀況監控等 ) 。過去⼗幾年，有
許
多全數位化的時序相關電路之設計理念的發展，因此希望透過此⾨課程，提供有志於電路設計領域發
展的
同學相關的紮實的訓練並建立相關的研發能⼒。
* 先修課程  (Prerequisites)
- 邏輯設計 (Verilog 硬體描述語⾔ ), 積體電路設計導論。
另外，作業及期末計畫需要跑數位電路模擬、合成、與⾃動產⽣佈局圖的軟體，
並進⾏電路特性與效能之歸納和比較。
* 主要參考書  (Textbook): 無，以論文研討為主。
* 教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
- 以使⽤  PowerPoint 投影片為主的課堂討論
(Lecturing using PowerPoint Slides) ，加上期末計畫討論。
* 教學進度 (Syllabus)
(Part I: Fundamentals)
1. Introduction
2. Review of Cell-based Design Flow
3. Delay-Locked Loop (including Ping-Pong DLL?)
4. Phase-Locked Loop
5. Time-to-Digital Converter
6. Digital-to-Time Converter
(Part II: Applications)
7. Performance Monitoring for DLL and PLL
8. Duty-Cycle Monitoring and Correction (DCC)
9. Fault Tolerant Delay-Locked Loop
10. Built-In Speed Grading
11. Delay Testing of Die-to-Die Interconnects in 3D ICs
12. Built-In Self-Repair for Interconnects in 3D ICs
13. Delay Monitoring of Die-to-Die Interconnects in 3D ICs
* 成績考核 (Evaluation)
- 出席  5% ，實作型作業  30% ，期中考 30% ，期末考 35% 。

中文名稱  Course Title ：類比電路設計
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Analog Circuit Design
任課教師  Instructor ：黃柏鈞  Po-Chiun Huang
上課時間  Time ： T5T6R6 上課教室  Room ：資電  106 ／ 0
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
This is an extended course for analysis and design analog integrated
circuits. It covers quantitative analyses, design considerations
and system applications from circuit and physical viewpoints. All material
is for CMOS technology.
Topics for this course includes
- Modern VLSI technologies, device operations and models.
- Elementary gain stages.
- Current sources.
- Frequency responses.
- Feedback, stability and compensation.
- Differential CMOS Operational amplifiers.
Remarks: 在您修課前 , 請先評估
1. 今年本課程將有修改 , 非基礎課程 , 會使⽤較多時間⽤於後段較困難的 amp 設計及模擬討論 .
2. 本系⼤學部 EE3235 類比電路分析與設計⼀是基礎課程 , 建議優先考慮 .
3. 本課程將⼤量使⽤ HSPICE 為作業模擬之⽤ , 課堂上將無額外時間進⾏軟體教學 .
4. 本學期預計將有⼀次上機考試 , 包含模擬及報告 .
5. 各類需求 , 包含博⼠班資格考 , 及各學程必修等 , 將不被接受成為調分的理由 .
本課程將於下階段開放修課⼈限⾄ 98 名 , 9 ⽉ 12 ⽇⾄ 9 ⽉ 29 ⽇將進⾏下階段加退選，

中文名稱  Course Title ：超⼤型積體電路設計
英文名稱  Course English Title ： VLSI Design
任課教師  Instructor ：謝志成
上課時間  Time ： T3T4R4 上課教室  Room ：台達 216 ／ 103
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course
Description)
This course provides the
fundamental knowledge of
designing Very Large-Scale
Integrated circuits (VLSI). It
begins with a review of the IC
fabrication
process and the CMOS transistor
theory. Then, the layout rules
and design
techniques for a variety of CMOS
logic circuits such as inverters,
logic
gates, flip-flops, and arithmetic
circuits using different design
styles (e.g.,
static logic, steering logic, and
dynamic logic) are discussed. For
system-level
design, low-power techniques,
semiconductor memories, and IO
plan will be
discussed in detail.

Circuits and Systems
Perspective, 4th Ed., Addison
Wesley, 2010.

Integrated Circuits, 2nd Ed.,

科號  Course Number ： 11010EE 528000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 98
中文名稱  Course Title ：射頻積體電路設計
英文名稱  Course English Title ： RF IC Design
任課教師  Instructor ：朱⼤舜
上課時間  Time ： T8T9R9 上課教室  Room ：資電 205 ／ 0
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
本課程授課教師為朱⼤舜老師。
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course will cover the design and analysis of RF, mm-wave, high speed
mixed signal integrated circuits for wireless communication and sensing based
on
today’s CMOS technology. We will begin with noise analysis, and cover
fundamental concepts in high speed circuit design such as nonlinearity,
sensitivity, and dynamic range. The main part of this class will focus on the
analysis and design of Low Noise Amplifier (LNA), Mixer, Oscillator (OSC),
Phase
Locked Loop (PLL), Frequency Synthesizers, Power Amplifier, High Speed Sample
And
Hold (S&H) circuitry. Transceiver architectures for different wireless
applications will also be discussed in this class.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
RF Microelectronics, 2/E , Behzad Razavi
三、參考書籍 (References)
The Design of CMOS Radio-Frequency Integrated Circuits, Thomas H. Lee
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction of RF wireless communication and sensing system
(Introduction of Antenna, LNA, PA, Mixer, Oscillator, PLL, Filter, ADC, DAC)
2. Noise (This is the most important topic.
Review random process, stationary and cyclostationary process. Noise source:
thermal, flicker, quantization noise)
3. Dynamic range (Noise and Linearity), SNR, SNDR .
4. Narrowband and wideband low noise amplifier
5. Passive and active mixer.
6. Oscillator (especially for phase noise analysis)
7. PLL and frequency synthesizer
8. Filter Design
9. Power Amplifier (Narrowband PA (including class A, B, AB, C, F, E) and
wideband PA)
10. Introduction of ADC and DAC.
11. System level consideration
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Final Exam (100%)

Research due: 3PM Jan. 7, 2022.
Research Problem (make your own assumptions for area and delay models)
For 1-member team: select one problem from problems 1-4.
For 2-member team: select two problems from problems 1-4.
For 3-member team: select three problems from problems 1-4.
For 4-member team: select all 4 problems.
1. For 54-bit CLA binary addition, compare and discuss the following
implementations:
a. 4-level CLA (you decide the bit number in each level)
b. Carry-skip method with variable block length (you decide the length)
c. Carry-select adder with variable block length (you decide the length)
2. For 6-digit BCD addition (24 bits), compare and discuss the following
implementations:
a. 3-level CLA (you decide the bit number in each level)
b. Carry-skip method with variable block length (you decide the length)
c. Carry-select adder with variable block length (you decide the length)
3. For Mod-65 addition with diminished-1 method (6-bit plus real-zero
detector), compare and discuss the following implementations:
a. 2-level CLA (you decide the bit number in each level)
b. carry-skip method with real-zero detector (you decide the length)
c. carry-select method with real-zero detector (you decide the length)
4. Conventional mod-65 (7-bit, 2-level CLA) binary addition compare and
discuss the following implementations:
a. 2-level CLA (you decide the bit number in each level)
b. carry-skip method with variable block length (you decide the length)
c. carry-select method with variable block length (you decide the length)

科號  Course Number ： 11010EE 563000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 135
中文名稱  Course Title ：數位訊號處理
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Digital Signal Processing
任課教師  Instructor ：劉奕汶
上課時間  Time ： M7M8W7W8 上課教室  Room ：台達 217 ／ 135
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
This course introduces discrete-time signal processing with an emphasis on rigor.
Topics including sampling and aliasing, discrete-time Fourier transform, z-
Transform, FIR/IIR filter design, filter structures, and discrete and short-time
Fourier transform.
Pre-requisite: Calculus, Linear Algebra, Probability (to a certain extent),
Signals and Systems (or equivalent, upon lecturer's consent).
⼆、指定⽤書  (Textbook)
Discrete-Time Signal Processing, A. V. Oppenheim, and R. W. Schafer, 3rd Ed.,
Pearson, 2009.
三、參考書籍  (References)
四、教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
This course will be taught **in English** by the lecturer using combination of
slides and the blackboard, and online streaming through Webex when necessary.
五、教學進度  (Syllabus) ：
Please refer to the university elearning system "eeclass" for a detailed
syllabus.
Lectures will cover sampling and signal reconstruction, analysis of LTI systems,
FIR and IIR filter design, discrete Fourier transforms, short-time Fourier
transform (above are covered in textbook Chapter 4-10).

科號  Course Number ： 11010EE 565000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 60
中文名稱  Course Title ：隨機程序
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Stochastic Processes
任課教師  Instructor ：呂忠津  Lu Chung-Chin
上課時間  Time ： W1W2F1F2 上課教室  Room ：台達 210 ／ 40
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
This course discusses mathematical models for physical phenomena which
possess random features. Physical phenomena which occur in the study of
networking, economics, finance, control, communications, signal
processing, statistical physics and biological processes often present
random behaviors. Stochastic processes which are useful in the modeling of
these random phenomena will be discussed, including point processes,
Markov processes, second-order processes, martingales, Brownian motion and
stochastic differential equations. This course requires knowledge on
calculus, linear algebra and elementary probability theory.
Due to the Covid-19 pandemic, this course will have online class meeting with
Google Meet in the regular class time 08:00-09:50 every Wednesday and Friday.
The link is https://meet.google.com/iuo-smvf-bbw .
⼆、指定⽤書  (Text Books)
1. S. M. Ross, Stochastic Processes, 2nd edn. John Wiley & Sons, Inc.,
1996.
2. C.-C. Lu, Lecture Notes.
三、參考書籍  (References)
I. Probability Theory
I.1 S. Ross, A First Course in Probability, 10th edn. Pearson, 2018.
(a very good first course on this subject)
I.2 K.-L. Chung, A Course in Probability Theory, 3rd edn.
New York: Academic Press, 2001. (highly recommended)
I.3 A. N. Shiryayev, Probability. New York: Springer-Verlag, 1984.
(chapters 1-4)
II. Stochastic Processes
II.1 E. Cinlar, Introduction to Stochastic Processes. Englewood Cliffs,
NJ: Prentice-Hall Inc., 1975.
II.2 E. Wong and B. Hajek, Stochastic Processes in Engineering Systems.
New York: Springer-Verlag, 1985.
II.3 J. Lamperti, Stochastic Processes. New York: Springer-Verlag,1977.
II.4 A. N. Shiryayev, Probability. New York: Springer-Verlag, 1984.
(chapters 5-8)
II.5 B. Oksendal, Stochastic Differential Equations: An Introduction with
Applications, 6th edn. Berlin: Springer-Verlag, 2014.
四、教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
This is an English–teaching course. After a review on essentials of abstract
integration theory and probability theory in my lecture notes and the first
chapter of the textbook by Ross, we will cover Poisson processes and renewal
theory (Chapters 2 and 3 of Ross) before the first midterm in late October.
Then we will continue to cover discrete-time Markov chains and continuous-time
Markov chains (Chapter 4 and 5 of Ross) before the second midterm in late
November. Finally we will study second-order processes (my lecture notes),
martingales (Chapter 6 of Ross), and stochastic differential equations (my
lecture notes) before the final exam in middle January next year. Homework
problem sets will be assigned weekly and graded. And homework solutions will
be distributed in the classroom. You are encouraged to consult or collaborate
with other students while solving the problems but you will have to turn in
your own solutions. Copying will not be tolerated. If you consult or
collaborate, you must indicate all of your consultants or collaborators with
their contributions.
五、教學進度  (Syllabus)
1. A review of abstract integration theory and probability theory
2. Poisson process
3. Renewal theory
4. Discrete-time Markov chains
5. Continuous-time Markov chains
6. Second-order processes
7. Martingales
8. Stochastic differential equations
六、成績考核  (Evaluation)
There are weekly homeworks (25%), two midterms (50%) and one final (25%).
