11010PHYS468000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 36
中文名稱  Course Title ：⼆維材料物理導論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction of two-dimensional (2D) materials
任課教師  Instructor ：徐斌睿
上課時間  Time ： W6W7W8 上課教室  Room ：物  313 ／ 60
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼆維材料在近年來是許多前端物理研究的熱⾨主題，其中許多新穎的物理特性，量⼦現象和廣泛的實
際應
⽤，希望能藉由開設這⾨⼆維材料物理導論的課，讓物理系的學⽣有機會接觸和理解到這些前沿的研
究進
展和有趣的知識，⽽課程內容的設計會涵蓋基礎的量⼦物理、奈米科技、表⾯磁學、⾃旋電⼦學以及
超導
物理等，這些跨領域的了解，可以引導未來研究主題的選擇和具備相關領域的基礎知識。
課程內容參考下列書籍設計 :
⼀、  Advanced 2D Materials, A. Tiwari and M. Syväjärvi, Scrivener & WiLey (2016)
⼆、  Handbook of Spintronics, Y. Xu, D. D. Awschalom and J. Nitta, Springer
(2016)
三、  Introduction to magnetism and magnetic materials, 3rd, D. Jiles, CRC Press
(2015)
四、  Physics of surface and interface, Harald Ibach, Springer (2006)
授課是以整理過重點的投影片為主，上⾯的書籍都有電⼦檔，學⽣實際上不需要去花錢購買這些書
籍。
課程內容⼤致上分成兩部分，第⼀部分是⼆維材料物理的基礎知識，第⼆部分是⼆維材料的實際應
⽤。
Part I:
1. Introduction: quantum physics at atomic scale
2. Electronic band structures at low-dimension
3. Characterization and growth of 2D materials
4. Multi-layered 2D heterostructures
Part II:
1. Massless Dirac fermion and 2D superconductivity in graphene
2. Rashba effect and topological insulators
3. 2D noncollinear magnetoresistance and spin valley effect
4. 2D Transition metal dichalcogenides and iron-based superconductors
備註 : 這⾨課雖然是⼤四選修，但也歡迎⼤三修過量⼦物理⼀的同學選修。

課程說明 (Course Description)
Germar Hoffmann
Introduction to Solid State Physics I gives a deeper insight into the physical
properties of ordered matter structures with a special emphasize on experimental
methods.
We will have a homework every week - which can be solved in groups of 2-3 persons.
I strongly suggest to solve in groups (to share the work load) and to see it as an
occasion to learn from each other.
We will have one midterm exam and one final exam - dates will be announced later
on the course web page.
指定⽤書 (Text Books)
a script will be supplied
參考書籍 (References)
1. "Introduction to Solid State Physics", 8th edition, by C. Kittel (Wiley, 1996)
2. "Solid State Physics", by N. Ashcroft and D. Mermin (1976)
教學進度 (Syllabus)
The first semester will cover the first 8 chapters in Kittel's book; and the
contents will be enriched to a more sophisticated level.
1. Forces & Bonds
2. Crystal Structures
3. Structure Analysis
4. Dynamics of Crystal Structures
5. Thermodynamic Properties
6. Introduction to Electron System
7. Fermi Distribution
8. a) Free Electron Model
b) Tight Binding Model
c) Density of States
d) Experimental Methods
9. Magnetism
成績考核 (Evaluation)
Grading:
1/3 Exercises
1/3 Midterm Exam
1/3 Final Exam

中文名稱  Course Title ：系外⾏星導論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Exoplanets
任課教師  Instructor ：江瑛貴
上課時間  Time ： R7R8R9 上課教室  Room ：物  313 ／ 60
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Course Description:
This course is mainly for senior undergraduate and
junior graduate students who are interested in exoplanets.
This course will make students to have opportunities
to learn about the background and the knowledge of this field,
including the methods of
detecting exoplanets, the planetary dynamics,
the atmosphere of exoplanets,
the planet formation, the recent observational
and theoretical results, and
the future direction of this field.
Text Books and References:
(1) title: Extrasolar Planets and Astrobiology
Author: C. A. Scharf
(2) title: Exoplanets
Editor: Sara Seager
(3) title: Solar System Dynamics
Authors: C.D. Murray and S.F. Dermott
(4) title: Exoplanet Atmosphere
Author: Sara Seager
(5) title: Astrophysics of Planet Formation
Author: P.J. Armitage
(6) title: The Exoplanet Handbook (2nd Edition)
Author: M. Perryman
Teaching Method:
It is mainly taught in English, but
I will make students have no any language problems.
Although the above books are good,
I do not feel there is any one book can be
the main text book of this course.
I will describe in details on the important topics.
In addition, students will have chances to think
about possible research projects,
and present their proposals or results.
Syllabus:
(1) Discoveries
(2) Planetary Orbits
(3) Detection Methods
(4) Observations of Planetary Systems
(5) Exoplanet Atmosphere
(6) Dynamics of Planetary Systems
(7) Planet Formation
(8) Exoplanet Research
Evaluation:
examinations/presentations

11010PHYS505000學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 24
中文名稱  Course Title ：光電實驗
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Optics and Photonics Laboratory
任課教師  Instructor ：施宙聰  Jow-Tsong Shy
上課時間  Time ： F5F6F7F8 上課教室  Room ：物  508 ／ 30
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
光電實驗是物理系碩⼠班光電物理組必修的實驗課程，內容以雷射特性及光譜為主。學⽣將學習雷
射和光學儀器基本原理、使⽤和操作。此外將教導學⽣如何做實驗紀錄。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
光電實驗講義 ( ⾃編 ) 。
三、參考書籍 (References)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
上課時間：星期五下午。前四週為講解。
本學期實驗共計 10 個，實驗項⽬由下列實驗選擇：
modern interferometer
He-Ne 雷射  --- Transverse modes and Gaussian beam
He-Ne 雷射  --- Longitudinal modes and Lamb dip
He-Ne 雷射  --- mode locking
He-Ne 雷射及 CO2 雷射 --- Laser alignment
DDSS 雷射  --- Q-switching and SHG
Spectrometer and lock-in amplifier
Acusto-optical modulator (AOM)
Photon statistics
Saturation spectroscopy
Raman spectroscopy
每兩位同學為⼀組。由於器材的限制，所有的實驗是同時進⾏的。
每位同學需準備⼀實驗紀錄本 , 每位同學需將實驗預習、實驗數據、結果、討論
及建議、實驗問題解答等詳實的寫在紀錄本中。
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
第⼀⾄第四週  講解及器材準備
第五⾄第⼗五週  實驗
第⼗六週  補做實驗
第⼗七週  期末測驗
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
上課表現  20% 實驗紀錄 + 實驗報告  50% 學期測驗 ( 操作考 + 筆試 ) 30%

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
“古典⼒學 “ 為 “ 理論⼒學 “ 的延伸課程。適合修過 " 理論⼒學 " 的⼤三（含）以上及研究所同學修習。
主要內容為
a) quick review on Principle of Least Action, Lagrangian and Hamilton formulation.
b) extensive discussion on Canonical Transformation.
c) application of the principle of least action and Lagrangian in classical fields
and special relativity.
d) role of Canonical Transformation in Quantum Mechanics.
e) classical mechanics and Quantum Path Integral.
Course contents:
1. Generalized Coordinates and Lagrange's Equations
2. The Principle of Least Action and Lagrange's Equations
3. Special Relativity and Covariant Lagrangian formulation
4. Hamilton Equations of Motion
5. Canonical Transformation (and its relation to Quantum Theory)
6. Hamilton-Jacobi Theory
7. The Principle of Least Action in Continuous System and Classical Fields
8. Lagrangian (Action) in Quantum Mechanics and Path Integral (Dirac & Feynman)
9. Canonical Transformation in Dirac's Quantum Field Theory
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Goldstein, Poole, and Safko, "Classical Mechanics", third ed., (Addison Wesley)
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. Landau and Lifshitz: "Mechanics".
2. Landau and Lifshitz: "Classical Theory of Fileds",
3. J. Marion: "Classical Dynamics of Particles and System".
4. Feynman and Hibbs: "Quantum Mechanics and Path Integrals"

中文名稱  Course Title ：流體⼒學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Fluid Dynamics
任課教師  Instructor ：周定⼀
上課時間  Time ： T7T8T9 上課教室  Room ：物  504 ／ 36
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
A. This course is designed for physics students, and is very different from
usual fluid mechanics courses for engineering students.
B. It emphasizes physics concepts in fluid mechanics and related topics,
and uses a lot of order-of-magnitude estimates to explain the physics
concepts. It is a good place for physics students to learn order-of-magnitude
estimates.
C. Content:
1. Ideal Fluid
2. Viscous Fluid
3. Turbulence
4. Energy Transport in Fluid
5. Diffusion in Fluid
6. Sound Waves
7. Shock Waves
8. Relativistic Fluid Mechanics
and other selected topics.

11010PHYS541000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 100
中文名稱  Course Title ：量⼦⼒學⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Quantum Mechanics (I)
任課教師  Instructor ：牟中瑜
上課時間  Time ： W3W4F3 上課教室  Room ：物  019 ／ 129
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
The formal language in this course is English.
This course aims at senior and graduate students with
physics major. Through systematic and detailed explanations
and demonstrations in the class, it is aimed to help students
to grasp the basic principles of quantum mechanic.
In order to have a better view on some recent developments
of quantum mechanic, the course will also cover subjects such
as Berry phase, AC effects, entanglement, and ect.
Other interesting subjects, such as quantum computation or
conceptual problems related to quantum mechanics, can be
discussed with students through projects after class.
本課程為英語授課
本課程乃針對⼤四與⼤四以上的同學設計，
藉由詳細有系統的解說使同學掌握量⼦⼒學的基本原理。
為了讓同學⼀窺與這些原理有關的新發展，
將盡可能涵蓋新的題⽬如  Berry phase 、 AC effect 。
對於其他有趣的題⽬如  quantum computation 或
由量⼦⼒學所引發概念上  (conceptual) 的問題，
可指導同學於課後討論。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
1. Lecture notes ⾃編講義
2. Principles of Quantum Mechanics, 2nd edition, by R. Shankar
三、參考書籍 (References)
1.Modern Quantum Mechanics, 2nd edition, by J.J. Sakurai
2.Feynman's Lectures on Physics, Vol.3
3.Quantum Mechanics, I & II, by A. Messiah
4.Quantum Mechanics, 3rd edition, by Landau & Lifshitz

and lecture
演講
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
預定包括 :
It tends to cover
1. Foundations and Dirac notations
2. Simple 1D systems
3. Classical limit and the WKB approximation
4. Uncertainty principle
5. Particles in E.M. fields
AB & AC effects
Introduction to Feynman's path integral formulation
6. Quantum harmonic oscillators
Dirac's method
Coherent states
7. Identical particles
Introduction to method of second quantization
8. Symmetries and their consequences

11010PHYS571000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：凝態物理⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Condensed Matter Physics I
任課教師  Instructor ：張博堯
上課時間  Time ： M6M7M8 上課教室  Room ：物  019 ／ 129
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Condensed Matter 1
Syllabus
Course Introduction:
This course covers the basic concept and some theorical tools in condensed matter physics including
understand the transport, magnetization, superconducting properties, and field theory methods, gauge
theories, and topological concepts in many-body electronic systems.
Evaluation:
Homework 60 %
Term paper [with oral presentation] 40 %
Course Plan:
1. Introduction and brief review of second quantization.
2. Path Integral formulism and the response theories.
3. Magnetization and superconductivity
4. Topology and geometry in condensed matter systems: Lattice gauge theories and other advance topics.
References:
1. Steven M. Girvin, Kun Yang, Modern Condensed Matter Physics, Cambridge University Press (2019)
2. Eduardo Fradkin, Field Theories of Condensed Matter Systems (2nd edition), Cambridge University Press
(2013)
3. David Vanderbilt, Berry Phases in Electronic Structure Theory: Electric Polarization, Orbital
Magnetization and Topological Insulators, Cambridge University Press (2018).
4. Piers Coleman: Introduction to Many-Body Physics, Cambridge University Press (2016)
5. Alexander Altland and Ben Simons, Condensed Matter Field Theory (2nd edition), Cambridge University
Press (2010)
6. Xiao-Gang Wen, Quantum Field Theory of Many-Body Systems, Oxford University Press (2007)

科號  Course Number ：
11010PHYS597001學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：物理專題 -- 對撞機物理
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Special Topic - Collider Physics
任課教師  Instructor ：張敬⺠
上課時間  Time ： W7W8W9 上課教室  Room ：綜⼆ 501 ／ 25
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程概述 :
質量的起源是我們存在的最根本的問題之⼀。如果⼀個電⼦是無質量的，它必須根據狹義的相對性以
光速⾏進，
所以不能被⼀個核俘獲形成⼀個原⼦，不幸的是我們不能存在。粒⼦物理學通過電弱對稱破決
（EWSB ）解釋質
量的起源。在電弱對稱被破壞之前，整個宇宙充滿了希格斯（ Higgs ）場，每個粒⼦都是無質量 j 的。
當希格斯
場發展真空期望值（ VEV ）時，選擇場空間中的特定⽅向，並且對稱性被破壞。粒⼦然後獲得與希格
斯場的 VEV
成比例的質量。
對撞機實驗⼀直是標準模式早期以來許多理論的終極考驗。由於 Glashow ， Salam 和 Weinberg ，我們⽬
前的粒
⼦物理學標準模型（ SM ）在 20 世紀 80 年代被證實，是基於 W 和 Z 玻⾊⼦的發現。  20 世紀 90 年代和 2000
年代 Z和
W玻⾊⼦的精確測量已經測試了 SM 的精準度為 0.1 ％。儘管如此，無論實驗家多麼努⼒，他們都無法
完成 SM，因
為沒有追溯到希格斯玻⾊⼦的 $394; 跡。隨著 2011 年 LHC 實驗的開始，對撞機物理學進入其⾼峰階段。
LHC實驗將
探索許多理論，許多已知的未知數，也許未知的未知數。令⼈興奮的機會正在等待年輕科學家和博⼠
⽣。
 2012年發現了⼀個標量的希格斯玻⾊⼦，其性質與 SM 希格斯玻⾊⼦相似。從 2012 年到 2014 年的數據
更為實實
在在地⽀持了 SM 希格斯玻⾊⼦。被稱為 “Higgsless 模型 ” 的⼀類模型被立即排除。現在希格斯玻⾊⼦
成為探
索超越 SM 的途徑。常⾒的智慧告訴我們，單⼀的希格斯玻⾊⼦不能是最終的理論，因為它受到規範層
級或⾃然
度問題的影響，即電弱和⼤統⼀或普朗克尺度之間的巨⼤分隔，將使得希格斯玻⾊⼦質量的輻射修正
顯著不穩
定。⼈們必須調⽤進⼀步的對稱性，例如超對稱（ SUSY ）或 TeV 合成，以拯救希格斯質量穩定性。在
未來⼆⼗
年， LHC 將繼續運⾏⾄ 2035 左右，將有很多機會。博⼠現在進入這⽅向的研究確是⼀個⼤好時機。
 張敬⺠教授提供了⼀個關於碰撞物理學的新課程，重點是當前的理論發展，特別是電弱對稱性破壞
（EWSB ）和
當前的實驗狀態。⽬標是讓學⽣了解理論的發展如何導致 EWSB 成功，如何在當前和未來的實驗中測
試每個模
型，以及當前數據如何限制每個模型。可以說明⼀些具體的模型，例如 two-Higgs- doublet 模型，
SUSY，
⼩Higgs 模型。
 課程⼤綱：
I. Introduction (2 lectures)
1.1 Gauge principle
1.2 Abelian case – QED
1.3 Non-abelian gauge – weak interaction
1.4 Unbroken SU(2)L x U(1)Y
1.5 Higgs mechanism
1.6 Quark and lepton Yukawas
II. Calculation of Cross Sections (1 lecture)
2.1 Cross section formulas
2.2 Heavy quark decays
2.3 e+ e- and photon e processes
III. Higgs Boson Physics (1 lecture)
3.1 Importance of the Higgs boson
3.2 Theoretical limits
3.3 Decays
3.4 Production mechanisms
3.5 Current limits
IV. W and Z Boson Physics (1 lecture)
4.1 Decays
4.2 Production
4.3 Pair production
V. Quantum Chromodynamics (QCD) (1 lecture)
5.1 Perturbative QCD
5.2 Renormalization
5.3 RGE running of the strong coupling
5.4 Jet physics
VI. Drell-Yan Production (1 lecture)
6.1 Drell-Yan process
6.2 4-fermion contact interactions
6.3 Z’ interactions
6.4 Leptoquarks
VII. Two Higgs Doublet Model (2HDM) (2 lectures)
7.1 The model
7.2 Theoretical constraints
7.3 Spectrum
7.4 Contributions to low energy observables
7.5 b -> s l l, B-Bbar mixing, rho parameter, g-2
7.6 Types I, II, III
VIII. Minimal Supersymmetric Standard Model (MSSM) (3 lectures)
8.1 Higgs sector
8.2 Higgs boson spectrum, decays, production
8.3 Superpotential, soft SUSY breaking, and Lagrangian
8.4 Squarks and sleptons
8.5 Neutralinos and Charginos
8.6 mSUGRA
IX. Little Higgs Models (2 lectures)
9.1 Collective symmetry breaking
9.2 Littlest Higgs model
9.3 T parity
9.4 Current limits
X. Dark Matter (3 lectures)
10.1 Observational evidences
10.2 Various candidates
10.3 Relic abundance
10.4 Direct detection limits
10.5 Indirect detection
10.6 Collider signals
科號  Course Number ：
11010PHYS597002學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：物理專題 -- 量⼦資訊
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Special Topic: Quantum Information
任課教師  Instructor ：褚志崧
上課時間  Time ： M3T5T6 上課教室  Room ：物  501 ／ 45
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
1. Course Description:
This course introduces the quantum information science, which includes
quantum cryptography, quantum teleportation and quantum computation. We will try
to cover the following topics.
1. Basic concepts
2. Quantum cryptography
3. Quantum dense coding and quantum teleportation
4. Concepts of quantum computation
5. Experiments leading towards quantum computation
6. Quantum networks and multi-particle entanglement
7. Decoherence and quantum error correction
8. Entanglement purification
2. References:
--Bouwmeester, Dirk, Ekert, Artur K., Zeilinger, Anton (Eds.), "The Physics of
Quantum Information" (Springer). eBook can be found at library.
--M. A. Nielsen, I. L. Chuang, "Quantum computation and Quantum Information"
(Cambridge University Press).
3. Grading Policy:
Some homework sets and reports (100% of grade). No exams.
科號  Course Number ：
11010PHYS645000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：量⼦場論⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Quantum Field Theory(I)
任課教師  Instructor ：朱創新
上課時間  Time ： M3M4Mn 上課教室  Room ：綜⼆ 521 ／ 45
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
Introduction to the basics of Quantum Field Theory (QFT), plus advanced topics
such as Chiral Anomaly, QFT in curved spacetime, and Entanglement Entropy in
QFT.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
lecture notes
三、參考書籍 (References)
L. Ryder, Quantum Field Theory, CUP
N.D. Birrel, P.C.W Davies, Quantum Fields in Curved Space, CUP
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Mainly by course lectures. Occasionally, I will also assign some extra
reading materials.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Basic Introduction:
. Lagrangian field theory and symmetries
. Quantum theory of field, particle interpretation.
. Perturbative S-matrix
. Spontaneous symmetry breaking
- Yang-Mills gauge theory
Advanced Topics (selected):
. Chiral Anomaly and anomaly cancellation
. QFT in curved spacetime
. Entanglement entropy in QFT
. Duality in QFT: S-duality in supersymmetric Yang-Mills theory, T-duality in
string theory, holographic duality in large N gauge theory
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Assessment will be based on class assignments and a final report.

科號  Course Number ： 11010PME 101301學分  Credit ： 2 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 72
中文名稱  Course Title ：⼯程圖學⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Engineering Drawing I
任課教師  Instructor ：郭詩坪
上課時間  Time ： T6T7T8 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  434 ／ 55
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程主要分為三⼤部份，第⼀部份為基本⼯程圖學探討，包括三視圖、剖⾯圖、立體圖、尺⼨
標註、量測與公差概念等，基本圖學概念及實例練習；第⼆部份為電腦 2 維模型繪圖，包括 2 維零
件各種視圖、尺⼨標註及圖⾯附註等；第三部份為立體基本模型繪圖，本課程也兼具立體基本模
型繪圖學習引導功能。
為加深動機系學員對產業界實體運作了解，課程中除實體繪圖操作之外，也會講解製圖標準及相
關的零件設計與製造管制關係，以期學習者在學習繪圖技藝之外，也同時了解尺⼨設計，公差嚴
緊度與製造成本相互關係，及如何對重要尺⼨ (Critical to function) 在量產製造上管理。
第⼀部份基本繪圖講解佔課程 40%, 第⼆部份電腦 2 維繪圖佔課程 40%, 第三部份電腦立體基本模
型繪圖及軟體間轉換佔課程 20%

中文名稱  Course Title ：⼯程圖學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Engineering Drawing
任課教師  Instructor ：劉俊賢
上課時間  Time ： F7F8F9 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  434 ／ 55
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
各位同學好 :
歡迎您加入設計製圖的⾏列 , 本課程的主要⽬標是建立傳統圖學設計製圖基礎，學習電腦輔
助繪圖⼯具的操作與應⽤，整合圖學理論、繪圖軟體與設計實務。學習過程中將給各位相當的壓
⼒,相對的 , ⼀學期 ( 年 ) 下來 , 您將有更⼤的收獲 , 在您與學⻑學姐的家聚時 , 不妨問問他 ( 她 ) 們的意
⾒,意者趕緊接受老師的挑戰吧 !
課程的撰寫重點在於：將⼯程實務、圖學理論、⼯具軟體三者結合成為⼀體，以迎接新世代的
電腦輔助設計與繪圖。
傳統⼯程圖學介紹著重基礎製圖規範與圖學理論之介紹，以及平⾯視圖與立體視圖之理論解說
及繪製，內容偏重製圖規範及理論傳授；⽽傳統之電腦輔助設計  (CAD) 繪圖軟體課程，多以強調
軟體的操作為主，輔以圖形範例進⾏繪圖之⽰範。然⽽，隨著電腦輔助設計繪圖軟體的⽇趨成熟，
如何將基礎圖學與電腦輔助設計繪圖軟體進⾏適切的融合，已成為當務之急。
因此，本課程特⾊將朝以下的⽬標發展：從『設計實務』的觀點，進⾏『圖學理論』的介紹，
清晰表達圖學的內涵；從『軟體應⽤』的觀點，進⾏『設計繪圖』的操作，完整發揮軟體的特⾊；
並進⼀步加以整合構成『電腦輔助設計圖學』，並規劃實際之計畫範例，進⾏整合的⼯作，期使本
課程能夠成為兼具學術及⼯程價值。
本課程由設計繪圖的實務觀點開始圖學的簡介；接著，對圖學的規範進⾏系列的介紹，以
建立深厚的圖學基礎，包括基礎圖學內容之⼯程圖的標準、線條的種類與⽤途、正投影、立體圖
與三視圖、剖⾯圖、尺⼨標註、公差與配合 ... 等等；
然後，便是電腦輔助設計繪圖軟體  AutoCAD 的操作基礎培訓，此乃經由系統性的分類及整
理，從基本之繪圖編輯指令⽰範，發展到⾼階之應⽤指令介紹；之後，便是應⽤幾何與投影幾何的
解說，⾄此建立起設計圖學與繪圖軟體之根基；緊接著，進⾏電腦輔助設計製圖的整合，從平⾯的
正投影圖繪製，⼀直到立體之等⾓圖、斜視圖，以及透視圖的電腦輔助繪製；最後，並另以獨立之
章節，透過實際設計範例，展現項電腦輔助製圖觀念與技巧的應⽤成果，期使能夠兼顧理論與實
務。
⾃從  91 學年度開始，圖學教室導入參數式的  3D 系統，因此，整個學年度將教學的層級由
2D 提升到  3D ，也就是說，本學期將為下學期的  3D 參數是設計打下札實的基礎，本學期課程的
學習將以  Autodesk AutoCAD 2D 系統的學習應⽤為主軸，下學期則將衍⽣發展到  Autodesk
Inventor 3D/2D 系統，此舉將會對⼤家有非常正⾯的學習成效，期待與⼤家共同來完成這⼀學
年的訓練

科號  Course Number ： 11010PME 200102學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 63
中文名稱  Course Title ：⼯程數學⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Engineering Mathematics I
任課教師  Instructor ：張敬
上課時間  Time ： M3M4W2 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  215 ／ 63
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
數學為探討各種⾃然與⼯程問題的重要分析⼯具，⼯程數學在微積分的基礎之上，更深入探討各種微
分⽅程
式的應⽤及求解⽅法與技巧，並了解求出其解之特性。透過課堂講授、習題演練及測驗，希望同學能
認識並
熟悉各類⽅程式所描述物理現象與解的性質，為未來修習動機系各項專業課程  ( 材料⼒學、流體⼒
學、控制
理論等 ) 打下基礎。本課程分為上、下兩學期，上學期講授  ordinary differential equations 、
series solution and special functions 、 Laplace transform 、 linear algebra 。
Mathematical tools are essential in analysis and prediction for a wide range of engineering problems.
Engineering
Mathematics is a post-calculus course for undergraduate students. It extends the discussion to various types of
differential equations and advanced mathematical topics. Through class lectures, homework assignments and
exams,
you will acquire the skill to solve some but not all the equations with engineering interest, and be ready for
using it in engineering specializations such as fluid mechanics, solid mechanics, control theory etc.
Furthermore, you should have a good grasp of the physical meaning behind the math, and also be able to
interpret
the solution. This is a two-semester series. In the first semester we will cover ordinary differential equations,
series solution and special functions, Laplace transform, linear algebra.
⼆、指定⽤書  (Text Book)
Kreyszig, E., "Advanced Engineering Mathematics", abridged version 10th ed., John Wiley (2018)
三、參考書籍  (References)
Zill, D.S., "Advanced Engineering Mathematics", 7th ed., Jones & Bartlett (2022)
O'Neil, P.V., "Advanced Engineering Mathematics", 8th ed., Cengage Learning (2018)
Arfken, G.B., "Mathematical Methods for Physicists", 7th ed., Academic Press (2012)
Riley, K.F., "Mathematical Methods for Physics and Engineering", 3rd ed., Cambridge University Press (2006)
四、教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
課堂講授，包括⽅程式與解的推導演算，搭配其物理意義與實際應⽤例⼦的展⽰及解說。
Lecture. Demonstrate the derivation and solution steps for equations, explain the physics and their engineering
applications.
五、教學進度  (Syllabus)
1. Introduction
2. 1st order ODE
3. 2nd and higher order ODE
4. Series solution
5. Special functions
6. Laplace Transform
7. Linear algebra
六、成績考核  (Grading)

Quizzes 20%
Midterm 30%
Final 30%

科號  Course Number ： 11010PME 200600學分  Credit ： 1 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 22
中文名稱  Course Title ：⼯場實習⼆
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Work Shop Practices II
任課教師  Instructor ：林⼠傑  Shih-Chieh Lin
上課時間  Time ： 上課教室  Room ：
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
對機械⼯程師⽽⾔，不僅在專業學識需充實具備 ; 在機械相關的實際加⼯能⼒也要有所認知，尤其是研
發設計規畫職位更為重要。
在⼯場實習⼀的課程中，學⽣有機會接觸並操作常⾒的⼯具機及⼿⼯具等製造設備。但宥於時間有限
及操作⼈數過多，學⽣多只能獲得較為零星的經驗，⽽無法有獨立操作的能⼒。為了提升學⽣獨立操
作機具的能⼒，故開設此⼀課程。
修完此⼀課程，可以獲得操作相關機台的操作許可。
⼆、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
1‧確定選課後請⾄科儀中⼼與辦理實習業務同仁討論擬實作之項⽬以便做⼈員專⻑項⽬之安排與調
整。
2‧課程內容中多個項⽬中，可任選⼀項以上，組合成 24 ⼩時以上之實作⼯作，但需配合指導師傅之總
和⼯作時間，實習時間較⻑者較易於取得較佳之成績。
3‧確認⼯作內容之原則為先到先選，如擬選之項⽬⼈數超過所能排定之⼈數，後到者即調整⾄其它項
⽬。
4‧為考量實作之⼯作安全，⼯作期間指導師傅須全程參與，採師徒制學習模式，但在安全可控狀態下
考慮數⼈同時到場個別進⾏實作。
5‧修課學⽣每次到課及離場請填寫同⼀格式之⼯作紀錄表。
6. 若有需要得在師傅同意下將部分課程延⾄寒假進⾏ .

四、成績考核 (Evaluation)

b. 學習態度及操作技巧 (40%) 師傅評分  5-90 4-75 3-60 2-40 1-20
c. 成品及學習⼼得 (20%)
五 注意事項
由於本課程嘗試以最⼤彈性安排以符合學⽣⾃⾝之需求，課程內容因學⽣需求⽽異；但也因此在課程
內容準備上及教學安排上有其難度。因此請配合完成下列步驟，盡速完成，以免想學之技藝因師傅無
法排出時間⽽使學習規畫不如所願。
1. 學期開始盡速和師傅洽談學習項⽬及上課時間並於九⽉底前⾄數位學習平台  eeclass 下載實習項⽬規
劃表，填寫後繳交⾄科儀中⼼三樓辦公室張⾦  榮先⽣處
2. 為使運作順暢，請於上課前⼀週與欲實習項⽬之師傅預約時段 ; 以便師傅準備實習所需之⼑具及材
料。
3. 上數位學習平台 eeclass 下載實習⼯作紀錄表，每次上課填寫實習⽇期、起訖時間及實習項⽬並於實
習結束前請師傅簽名，並於完程所有項⽬後繳交⾄科儀中⼼辦公室張⾦榮先⽣處以作為實習操作時間
之依據。
4. 加退選 — 經師傅及助教同意簽字後再送老師簽字
教師  林⼠傑  5742920 sclin@pme.nthu.edu.tw
助教  張⾦榮  5715131 轉 35427 jinrong.chang@mx.nthu.edu.tw
科號  Course Number ： 11010PME 210302學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 60
中文名稱  Course Title ：基礎熱流學⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Thermal and fluid Science I
任課教師  Instructor ：李明蒼
上課時間  Time ： T3T4R3 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  101 ／ 80
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
● 課程說明 (Course Description)
Thermal and Fluid Science I is focused on Thermodynamics, a foundation for
analysis of thermal systems on the basis of conservation of mass and
conservation of energy principles, as well as the second law of
thermodynamics. An introduction to the power and refrigeration vapor cycles
will be provided to further illustrate the application of thermodynamics on
R&D of engineering systems.
● 指定⽤書 (Text Books) ：  Lecture notes
● 參考書籍 (References)
1.Potter, M. C. and Scott, E. P., Thermal sciences: an introduction to
thermodynamics, fluid mechanics, and heat transfer, Thomson Brooks Cole,
Cengage Learning, 2004
2.Cengel, Y. A. et al., McGraw Hill, Fundamentals of thermal-fluid sciences,
McGraw Hill, 2016
3.Moran M. J. et al., Introduction to Thermal Systems Engineering, Wiley, 2003
4.Turns, S. R., "Thermal-Fluid Sciences, An Integrated Approach" Cambridge
University Press, 2006
5.Cengel, Y. A. and Boles, M., Thermodynamics: An engineering approach, McGraw
Hill, 2018
● 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecturing, Lab, Hands-on project
● 教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Concepts, Definitions, and Basic Principles of thermodynamics
2. Properties of Pure Substances
3. Work and Heat
4. The First Law of Thermodynamics
5. Second Law of Thermodynamics
6. Power and Refrigeration Vapor Cycles
● 成績考核 (Evaluation)
Midterm exams, Final project, Homework, Lab and Quiz, Class participation

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course aims to learn the fundamental concept and various analytical
techniques for the electric circuits.

Hill
Company, 5th Ed., ISBN 978-1-259-07139-3, 2013.

Learning.,
4th Ed., ISBN 1-4180-3861-x, 2007.
2. J. W. Nilsson and S. A. Riedel, Electric Circuits, 7th Ed., Pearson Education,
Inc.,
ISBN 0-13-146592-9, 2005.

課堂上課 ( 含以電腦製作之投影片 ) 及演習課
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introductions and Basic Concepts Chapter 1
2. Basic Laws Chapter 2
3. Methods of Analysis Chapter 3
4. Circuit Theorems Chapter 4

8. Second-order Circuits Chapter 8

11. Sinusoidal Steady-State Analysis Chapter 10
12. AC Power Analysis* Chapter 11
*: taught only if the time is allowed

科號  Course Number ： 11010PME 235001學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 60
中文名稱  Course Title ：材料⼒學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Mechanics of Materials
任課教師  Instructor ：蔡宏營
上課時間  Time ： T7T8T9 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  107 ／ 200
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
材料⼒學係應⽤靜⼒學於分析剛體 (Rigid Body) 時之理論與⽅法，進⼀步延伸⾄可變形體
(Deformable body) 之探討。材料⼒學為固體⼒學之基礎課程，也是修習機械設計與製造、精密
機械、微機電系統等課程必須之前備知識與分析能⼒訓練，要成為優異⼯程師所不可或缺的專業
基礎。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Russell C. Hibbeler, Mechanics of Materials, 10th ed. in SI units, Pearson,
2018
三、參考書籍 (References)
B. J. Goodno, J.M. Gere, "Mechanics of Materials", 9th ed., Cengage Learning,
2018
F. Beer and E. R. Johnston, Jr. and J. DeWolf and D. Mazurek, Mechanics of
Materials, 7th ed., McGraw Hill, 2015
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
課堂講授配合⼩考、及期中、期末考來評量教學效果，同時完成期末專題。
另安排助教於演習課協助同學解答。
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
(1) Stress
(2) Strain
(3) Mechanical Properties of Materials
(4) Axial Load
(5) Torsion
(6) Bending
(7) Transverse Shear
(8) Combined Loadings
(9) Stress Transformation
(10) Strain Transformation
(11) Design of Beams and Shafts
(12) Deflection of Beams and Shafts
(13) Buckling of Columns
(14) Energy Methods
六、實驗、專題、賽⾞專題課程
1.專題： (1) 電池箱鎖點受⼒分析； (2) 起重機設計製作
2.實驗： (1) 複合材料拉伸試驗； (2)I 型樑應變量測實驗
七、成績考核 (Evaluation)
1. ⼩考 /作業 (15%)
2. 期中考 2 次 (20%+20%)
3. 實驗 (5%)
3. 期末考 (25%)
4. 期末專題報告 *2( 電池箱所點受⼒分析報告 :12/15 ；起重機競賽⽇期 1/14 19:00-22:00( 暫訂 ) 、
書⾯報告繳交⽇期 1/21 前 )(15%)

科號  Course Number ： 11010PME 243101學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 60
中文名稱  Course Title ：機械製造
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Manufacturing Processes
任課教師  Instructor ：曹哲之
上課時間  Time ： T1T2F2 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  215 ／ 63
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程說明  (Course Description)
機械製造 ( 製造程序 ) 課程的⽬的在了解與機械⼯程相關的各種主要⼯業與商業的產品及其
零組件的⽣產⽅法、可採⽤之各種加⼯法、各種加⼯法的基本原理、特性與所須之設備、以及⽣產加
⼯過程中要精進⽣產⼒所涉及的⼯程⽅法。
指定⽤書  (Text Books)
Manufacturing Engineering and Technology, 6th edition, Kalpakjian and
Schmid, Prentice Hall 2010.
(or 7th edition published by Pearson Education South Asia Pte Ltd.)
教學⽅式  (Teaching Method)
課堂授課、學⽣作業、⼩專題及學期專題實驗報告。
教學內容⼤綱  (Course Outline)
T1 Introduction
Processes overview, History, Process features, Recent
Developments and Current Trends
T2 Materials
Engineering materials
Fundamentals: macroscopic: Physical properties, Mechanical
properties
Fundamentals: microscopic
Types, Properties and Cost
T3 Casting (metal casting)
Sand casting, Shell, Plaster, Ceramic, Lost-foam, Investment,
Permanent-mold, Die
Processes and Equipment, Fundamentals, Processes Summary
Design, Materials, Economics
T4 Forming and Shaping (Deformation Processes)
Rolling, Forging, Drawing and extrusion, Sheet metal forming
T5 Cutting (Material Removal Processes)
Turning/Milling/Drilling
Cutting Fundamentals
Tools, Economics
Advanced Machining Processes (non-conventional machining)
Abrasive Machining and Finishing Operations,
Machine tools: structure and control
Ultra-precision Machining
T6 Joining
T7 Powder metallurgy
T8 Polymer (Plastics) (and Composites) Processes
Plastics properties / usages ,
Plastic injection molding, Thermal forming,
Composite materials and processes
T9 Ceramics and Glasses Processes*
Surface Processes*
T10 Rapid Prototyping, Production and Tooling (Additive Manufacturing)
T12 Micro-fabrication Processes*
Microelectronics fabrication
MEMS processes
T11 Engineering Metrology and Instrumentation*
T13 Quality Management
Statistic Process Analysis, Statistical Process Control
Process Optimization
T14 Manufacturing Systems
Design for Manufacturing
Process Planning, Factory Layout and Simulation, Scheduling,
Material Handling
Automation
(*: 視時間允許 )
Term Project (TP) 學期專題實驗  ( 視疫情允許調整 )
Design and make molds and a small casting system to produce a small
quantity of casts, including tasks of
Product design / mold design / production system design
Process planning: mold fabrication / production system setup
Make molds, production system
Casting products
Result analysis and report

科號  Course Number ： 11010PME 243102學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 60
中文名稱  Course Title ：機械製造
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Manufacturing Processes
任課教師  Instructor ：劉俊葳
上課時間  Time ： T1T2F2 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  214 ／ 63
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
藉由機械製造課程了解製造相關程序及拓展熟知製造供應鏈⽣態。  從介紹各領域範疇涉及之製造
技術及⽣產設備作出發點、產品開發及其零組件的⽣產⽅法，最後講述⼈⼯智慧加值製程應⽤及如
何建立製造廠數位串流關係及智慧製造模式。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
1. Manufacturing Engineering and Technology, 7th edition, Kalpakjian and
Schmid, Prentice Hall 2014.
2. ⾃編講義
三、參考書籍 (References)
Groover's Principles of Modern Manufacturing SI Version,Mikell P. Groover,
WIELY,2016
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)

科號  Course Number ： 11010PME 300500學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：系統動態分析
英文名稱  Course English Title ： System Dynamics Analysis
任課教師  Instructor ：林明璋
上課時間  Time ： R7R8R9 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  217 ／ 63
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course deals with mathematical modeling and analysis of devices and process
for the purpose of understanding their time-dependent behavior. In this course,
we will paricularly emphasize on methods for handling applications containing
multiple types of components and processes such as electromechanical devices,
electrohydraulic devices, and fluid-thermal processes. Since control systems are
required to interconnect elements, preliminary controller design is also a major
focus in this course.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
William J. Palm III, System Dynamics, 3rd ed. 2014
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. K. Ogata, Syatem Dynamics, 2nd ed. 1992.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
1. Classroom lecturing
2. 第⼀週上課⽅式  : 採 google meet 視訊軟體 , 請修課同學先加入 ”110-1 系統動態分析 ”LINE
群組 , 請連絡助教詢問群組 QR code.
3. 加簽⽅式  : 可以電⼦表單或 9/23 於實體課堂 ( ⼯⼀ 217) 加簽
4. 助教  :林威廷  (Office: ⼯⼀ 504, Tel :42597)
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction and Overview
2. Introduction of MATLAB and SIMUlink
3. Dynamic Response and the Laplace Transform Method
4. Rigid-Body Mechnical System and Spring and Damper elements
5. State Variable Model and Simulation Methods
6. Electrical and Electromechanical Systems
7. Fluid and Thermal Systems
8. System Analysis in the Time Domain
9. System Analysis in the Frequency Domain
10.Control System Design and Root-Locus Plot
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Linear Algebra

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
線性代數為⼯程問題分析的重要⼯具，此課程將⼤⼆的⼯程數學中的線性代數不⾜部份做⼀個完
整的介紹，此課程主要探討 linear equations, vectors and matrices; vector spaces;
numerical linear algebra 等相關理論。不論同學未來分組為何，均屬基礎⼯具課程，非常
重要。
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)

John Wiley & Sons.
三、參考書籍 (References)

edition, Pearson (2014)

edition, Hwa Tai Publishing (2013)

(2010).

科號  Course Number ： 11010PME 311300學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：進階流體⼒學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Advanced Fluid Dynamics
任課教師  Instructor ：李國賓
上課時間  Time ： F1F2F3 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  213 ／ 63
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
PME 311300 ADVANCED FLUID DYNAMICS (2021 Fall)
課程⽬的
This course will derive governing equations in fluid dynamics in differential forms. Viscous flow in pipes and
over immersed bodies will be then covered. Finally, two other important flow theories including compressible
flow and potential flow will be briefly covered.
TEXTBOOK
Munson BR, Okiishi TH, Huebsch WW and Rothmayer AP, 2013, Fluid Mechanics, 7th ed., Wiley Singapore.
歐亞書局。
CONTENT
1. Tensor notation
2. Differential Form of Fluid Dynamics
3. Viscous Flow in Pipes
4. Flow over Immersed Bodies
5. Compressible Flow
6. Potential flow
Grading policy
Midterm Exam.: 35%
Final Exam. 35%
Homework: 30%
科號  Course Number ： 11010PME 312100學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：能源⼯程
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Energy Engineering
任課教師  Instructor ：李明蒼
上課時間  Time ： F5F6F7 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  213 ／ 63
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Course description:
This course aims to lead students to further strengthen their knowledge in
thermophysical principles and transport phenomena. The theme is the
application of those fundamental principles in energy systems engineering.
Students should leave the course with confidence and sufficient abilities to
readily apply techniques as engineers on the design and analysis encountered
in a variety of emerging sustainable and renewable energy systems. A hands-
on project will be carried out as the platform for students to learn by
doing. Students should also be able to readily use the basic computer
software in solving energy related problems, as well as having a clear concept
when utilizing advanced commercial software in solving engineering problems.
The skills developed in this course will be applied in the semester-long
project to practice the detailed design of a complete sustainable energy
system. The objective is to translate the statement of an energy system
analysis and design problem into a series of tasks and step-by-step practices.
References:
1. Y.A. Çengel and M.A. Boles, Thermodynamics: An Engineering Approach
(McGraw-Hill)
2. B.R. Munson and T. H. Okiishi et al., Fluid Mechanics (Wiley)
3. F.P. Incropera and D. P. DeWitt et al., Principles of Heat and Mass
Transfer (Wiley)
4. R.A. Dunlap, Sustainable Energy 2nd edition (Cengage Learning)
Topics:
1. Introduction of course, The basics of energy conversion
2. Review of basic thermodynamics and thermosystems
3. Review of fluid dynamics
4. Review of fundamental heat transfer
5. Overview of HVAC system and thermal comfort, Green building
6. Solar thermal energy systems
7. Wind, Hydropower, Wave and Tidal energy systems
8. Oceanthermal and Geothermal energy systems
9. Hydrogen energy, Biomass energy
10.Nanotechnology for renewable and sustainable energy
Evaluation:
Homework, Midterm exam, Final project, Labs and quiz, Class participation
科號  Course Number ： 11010PME 320701學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 60
中文名稱  Course Title ：控制系統⼀
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Control System I
任課教師  Instructor ：馮國華
上課時間  Time ： M7M8F3 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  216 ／ 63
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course provides the students with basic knowledge in modeling, analysis and
design for linear feedback control systems. It begins with reviewing some
mathematical fundamentals and introducing block diagrams and signal-flow graphs.
Students will then learn how to model mechanical, electrical, and
electromechanical systems as differential equations and transfer functions. The
analysis in this course includes stability and steady-state errors of systems,
time responses and frequency responses of low order systems. The design methods
are divided into root-locus techniques and frequency response techniques using
Bode plots for designing PID and lead/lag controllers. Students will also learn
how to apply the automatic control theory to real engineering problems via
Matlab simulations and homework assignments.
Pre-requisite: Applied Mechanics ( 應⽤⼒學 ), Engineering Mathematics ( ⼯程數學 ),
Electrical circuits and Electronics ( 電⼦電路學 )
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Norman S. Nise, "Control Systems Engineering", 8th edition, John Wiley & Sons,
Inc., 2019.
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. Gene F. Franklin, J. David Powell, and Abbas Emami-Naeini, Feedback Control
of Dynamic Systems, 7th Edition, Prentice Hall, 2015.
2. Farid Golnaraghi, and Benjamin C. Kuo, "Automatic Control Systems", 9th
edition, John Wiley & Sons, Inc., 2009.

6. Root Locus Techniques and Design Method
7. Frequency Response Techniques and Design Method

considered during evaluation).

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
⾼等材料⼒學延續材料⼒學之理論與⽅法，材料⼒學為固體⼒學之基礎課程，也是修習機械設計與製
造、微機電系統等課程必須先有之訓練，為成為優良的⼯程師不可或缺的課程。修過材料⼒學後，⾼
等
材料⼒學進⼀步探討機械結構承受各種不同負載之情況，修習之後可在固體⼒學領域有較完整之訓
練。

科號  Course Number ： 11010PME 334700學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 55
中文名稱  Course Title ：有限單元法導論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Finite Element Methods
任課教師  Instructor ：李銘孝
上課時間  Time ： TaTbTc 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  434 ／ 55
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
實際的⼯程與科學問題往往相當複雜，不易⽤理論⽅法來處理；另⼀⽅⾯，因為電腦的進步，數值⽅
法成為處理⼯程與科學問題最經濟⽽有效的⽅法。在相關數值⽅法中，有限單元法是最被廣泛使⽤的
⽅法，尤其在固體⼒學領域。相關的軟體功能也⽇益完備，已成為有效⽽⽅便的⼯具。學⽣可透過基
礎理論的介紹與實際的操作練習，熟悉⼀個有⽤的⼯具 ( 以 ANSYS 為例 ) ，提升往後解決⼯程與科學問
題的能⼒。
!!! 注意 !!! 因為本校 9/13~9/21 全⾯實施遠距授課，本課將採非同步⽅式，上傳課程錄影檔，請
上網觀看。

無指定教科書  ( 老師提供⾃編講義 )

edition, John Willey & Sons, Inc.(1989).
2. Bathe, K. J., "Finite Element Procedures", Prentice-Hill Inc.

講授與實作練習
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)

3. Related issues: analysis types, element types, analysis procedure
4. Introduction to Finite Element Software: ANSYS
5. Modeling for engineering problems
6. Introduction to geometry modeling with ANSYS
7. Introduction to Mesh generation with ANSYS
8. Structural analysis with FEM
9. Thermal Analysis with FEM
10. Introduction to Nonlinear structural Analysis: geometric nonlinearity,
material nonlinearity, contact analysis

科號  Course Number ： 11010PME 343301學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 65
中文名稱  Course Title ：機械設計
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Machine Design
任課教師  Instructor ：宋震國
上課時間  Time ： W3W4F4 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  216 ／ 63
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
Design of Machine Elements
This is the first course for ME undergraduate students to touch upon
the
inside of machine design. The objective of this course is to teach students
to
transfer their basic knowledge, which are learned from the courses such as
Engineering Material, Statics, Dynamics, Strength of Materials,
Thermodynamics,
Fluid Mechanics, Mechanism Design, into the tools of machine element design.
Therefore, this course is not mainly directed towards fostering students
with
the capability of creative design, yet training them how to design machine
elements with adequate strength and rigidity to prevent from failure under
use.
機械元件設計
本課程是機械系學⽣接觸機械設計的第⼀⾨課，其⽬標在於教導學⽣如何將應⽤⼒學、材料
⼒學、熱⼒學、流
體⼒學等基礎⼒學之分析知識轉為機械裝置及元件的設計與選⽤⼯具，因此這⾨課並非期望培養
學⽣創新發明的
能⼒，⽽是訓練學⽣紮實的設計功夫，使其學會如何定義某⼀元件的形狀、尺⼨、材料，⽽使該
元件在機械裝置
中使⽤時不致因受⼒及環境因素⽽產⽣破壞。
由於這是⼀⾨三學分的課程，時間相當有限，無法將課本所有內容詳細說明，本⼈乃摘取重
要的且具代表性的
章節作較詳細的講授。⾸先，討論材料式元件破壞機制及設計原則，包括延性及脆性材料之靜⼒
及疲勞破壞，接
著，探討彈簧設計，原因是彈簧的破壞分為靜⼒及疲勞破壞，剛好可以將前⾯所學之破壞理論做
⼀實際的應⽤，
以增進同學的了解深度。另外，將講授軸承及潤滑設計及選⽤，包括滾動軸承、滑動軸承等，因
其內容及⽤到的
知識除應⽤⼒學外，尚包括流體⼒學及熱傳學，且其應⽤範圍很廣，可以擴展學⽣對機械設計了
解的廣度。最後
特講授離合器及煞⾞器的設計，此為機械系學⽣⽿熟能詳的機械裝置，講授內容除包括數學模式
建立、分析外，
亦將對各式離合器及煞⾞器的選⽤及設計作較為深入的探討。綜合⽽⾔，本課程的內容如下：
1. Static Failure Theories
2. Fatigue Failure Theories
3. Surface Failure
4. Spring Design
5. Bearings and Lubrication
6. Clutches and Brakes
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Richard G. Budynas and J. Keith Nisbett, Shigley's Mechanical Engineering
Design, Eleventh Edition (Tenth edition is also OK if you already have) in SI
Units,
McGraw Hill 2011 東華書局 ( 新⽉圖書 )
ISBN: 0073529281
三、參考書籍 (References)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Steady Failure
2. Fatigue Failure
3. Mechanical Springs
4. Rolling Contact Bearings
5. Lubrication and Journal Bearings
6. Clutches , Brakes , Couplings , and Flywheels
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Homework 10% Project 15% three Exams 25% each
科號  Course Number ： 11010PME 343302學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 65
中文名稱  Course Title ：機械設計
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Machine Design
任課教師  Instructor ：馮國華
上課時間  Time ： W3W4F4 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  431 ／ 123
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
本課程將介紹機械元件的基本構造及選⽤機械元件的⽅法，以及機械系統設計時機械強度設計的理
論基礎。課程內容涵蓋機械設計的基礎知識，包括⼯程⼒學和材料⼒學，靜態和可變載荷下的故障
預防，以及主要機械元件的特性與原理。
This course will introduce the basic structure of mechanical components, the
method of selecting mechanical components and the theoretical basis of the
design of mechanical strength during design. The content covers the basics of
machine design, including engineering mechanics and materials, failure
prevention under static and variable loading, and characteristics of the
principal types of mechanical elements.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Richard G. Budynas and J. Keith Nisbett, Shigley's Mechanical Engineering
Design , eleventh Edition,Mc,Graw Hill 2020
三、參考書籍 (References)
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture (in English or chinese if no international student registered)
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction ( Chapter1)
2. The Failure prevention (Chapter 5,6)
3. Shaft and Shaft Component (Chapter 7)
4. Screws, fasteners, and the design of nonpermanent joints (Chapter 8)
5. Springs (Chapter 10)
6. Rolling contact bearing element bearing (Chapter 11)
7. Lubrication and Journal Bearing (Chapter 12)
8. Clutch, Breaks, Couplings, and Flywheel (Chapter 16)
9. Flexible Mechanical Element (Chapter 17)
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
25%第⼀次期中考  (Midterm I)
25%第⼆次期中考  (Midterm II)
25%期末考  (Final exam)
10%專題  (Project)
15%作業及⼩考  (Homework and Quiz)
上課出缺席和課堂表現亦列入評分考量  (Attendance and performance in class will be
considered during evaluation).
七、可連結之網⾴位址
edl.pme.nthu.edu.tw

中文名稱  Course Title ：賽⾞實務專題
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Formula Student Racing Car Design and Manufacture Project
任課教師  Instructor ：林昭安  Chao-An Lin

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程說明 :
本課程為學⽣參加⽅程式賽⾞團隊進⾏分組之專題訓練 , 將著重於對零組件設計 , 規格分析 , 材料選
⽤,加⼯⽅法 , 熱處理技術及量測驗證之訓練 , 所有相關技術學⽣必須於學重依報告並⼝頭說明 .
教學⽅式 :
團隊不定期進⾏⼝頭報告及討論
教學進度 :
每個⽉進⾏進度報告 , 並組成匴體學習群組及安埋訓練課程 .
成績考核 :
以學期末書⾯報告及平⽇⼝頭報告為成績計算內容 , 平時成績占 60%, 期末報告占 40%.
科號  Course Number ： 11010PME 401301學分  Credit ： 1 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 35
中文名稱  Course Title ：熱流與動⼒系統實驗
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Thermo-fluid and Power System Lab
任課教師  Instructor ：黃智永
上課時間  Time ： M5M6M7M8 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  319 ／ 35
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
熱流與動⼒系統實驗課程⼤綱
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
以實驗操作與數據分析的⽅式讓同學瞭解熱流基礎與動⼒系統相關特性 :
This course stems from fundamentals of thermo-fluids (combustion, diffusion, heat
transfer, gas dynamics), electrochemistry and optoelectronics to the power system
of motorcycle engine, jet nozzle, steam turbine, flow field analysis,
motor/generator, fuel cells and solar cells. The objective is to explore the
power mechanical engineering under safety conditions.
實驗項⽬包括以下八項：
質傳 /熱傳實驗  (Mass Transfer/Heat Transfer Experiment) ，燃料電池 (Fuel Cell) ，氣體動
⼒與噴嘴性能測試  (Gas Dynamics and Nozzle Performance Test) ，⽔洞速度場量測與邊界層
分析  (Velocity Measurements and Boundary layer Analysis in a Water Tunnel)(TBD) ，
⾺達 /發電機測試與風⼒發電系統量測  (Motor/Generator Test and Wind Power System) ，圓柱
流場量測與阻⼒分析  (Flow Field and Drag Force Analysis with a Circular Cylinder
Model)(TBD) ，  蒸汽渦輪動⼒實驗  (Steam Turbine Cycle Experiment) ，太陽電池測試  (Solar
Cell Tests)
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Lab manuals will be provided to cover the guidelines and procedures for the
experiments as well as safety procedures as mandatory to follow.
三、參考書籍 (References)
Any thermodynamics, thermal science, and energy engineering related textbooks
will be of help to this course.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
上課⽅式 :
1. 每⼈在做實驗前先繳預習報告 (A4 紙 ) ⼄份，內容包括 (1) 封⾯、 (2) 實驗⽬的、 (3) 實驗原理、 (4)
實驗設備、 (5) 量測項⽬清單、及 (6) 預期結果。
2. 每⼈在實驗完畢後⼀週，於上課時繳交實驗報告 (A4 紙 ) ⼄份，內容包括 (1) 封⾯、 (2) 摘要、 (3) 實
驗⽬的、 (4) 實驗原理、 (5) 實驗設備、 (6) 實驗結果與討論、 (7) 結論與⼼得、 (8) 參考資料、及 (9)
附錄  [原理推導過程、計算過程、準確度分析及其他 ] 。
3. 預習報告及實驗報告可⽤電腦打字 ( 包括封⾯及圖表 ) ，結論與⼼得不得與他⼈重覆。
4. 實驗結束前，各組組員進⾏個⼈⼝試，助教打個⼈⼝試成績。
分組⽅式 : 共分八組，每組以 4 ⼈為原則 ( 若該時段選課⼈數超出 35 者則以 5 ⼈為原則 ) 。
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
實驗講解 : 講授實驗項⽬之⽬的、原理及注意事項。
時間 : 9⽉ 15 ⽇ ( 星期三 )19:00 實驗⼀、實驗⼆、實驗三、實驗四
實驗五、實驗六、實驗七、實驗八
地點 : ⼯程⼀館 107 階梯教室
實驗時間 : ⾃ 10 ⽉ 4 ⽇起每週⼀、⼆、三  ( 詳細時間請參考實驗時程表 )
14:10-14:20 報到簽名、繳交預習報告及上週實驗報告
14:20 助教收⾛簽名單
14:20-14:40 助教⽰範講解及告知安全事項
14:40-16:00 實驗操作及數據初步分析
16:00-16:30 實驗組員⼝試，助教打個⼈⼝試成績
16:00-17:00 數據經實驗助教檢查簽名後，⽅可離開， 17:00 前結束
實驗項⽬
1. 質傳 /熱傳實驗  (Mass Transfer/Heat Transfer Experiment)
2. 燃料電池  (Fuel Cell)
3. 氣體動⼒與噴嘴性能測試  (Gas Dynamics and Nozzle Performance Test)
4. ⽔洞速度場量測與邊界層分析  (Velocity Measurements and Boundary layer Analysis in
a Water Tunnel) (TBD)
5. ⾺達 /發電機測試與風⼒發電系統量測  (Motor/Generator Test and Wind Power System)
6. 圓柱流場量測與阻⼒分析  (Flow Field and Drag Force Analysis with a Circular
Cylinder Model)(TBD)
7. 蒸汽渦輪動⼒實驗  (Steam Turbine Cycle Experiment)
8. 太陽電池測試  (Solar Cell Tests)
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
成績計算⽅式 : 預習報告 (10%) 、⼝試 (10%) 、實驗報告 (50%) 、及期末報告 (30%)
期末報告  時間 : 12 ⽉ 20 、 21 、 22 ⽇ ( 星期⼀、⼆、三 ) 的上課時間
地點 : 待公佈

重要通知 :

科號  Course Number ： 11010PME 435200學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：微機電系統導論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Microelectromechanical Systems
任課教師  Instructor ：⽅維倫
上課時間  Time ： F5F6F7 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  431 ／ 123
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
⾃從  1947 年第⼀顆固態電晶體被發明後，半導體製程技術即不斷地演進，由 IC ⾄  LSI 然後
到VLSI ，再到⽬前的 ULSI 。隨著半導體製程技術的進步，許多的研究⼈員開始思考如何將該技
術作更廣泛的應⽤。 1965 年美國  Westing House 的  Dr. Nathanson 利⽤半導體製程，⾸度
製造⼀極⼩的機械懸臂結構於晶片上。該文發表後引起許多迴響，隨後陸續有多篇論文探討關於
半導體製程製造微機械結構的技術，以及結合半導體電⼦元件和機械結構以形成各種感測器，如
壓⼒計、加速度計等，這些元件的尺⼨甚⾄可⼩⾄微米。然⽽直到  1982 年美國  Dr.
Petersen 的⼀篇回顧的論文，才真正引起世⼈對微加⼯  (Micromachining) 技術的重視。
1988 年美國  UC Berkeley 的  Fan 和  Tai 製造的微⾺達，更造成舉世轟動，並將此領域的
研究風潮推向⾼峰。
早期這項技術被利⽤來製造微⼩的機光電等元件，例如：齒輪、閥⾨、⾺達等等，⽬前此領域已
由單⼀的機械元件或結構，發展到複雜的由機光電等元件與功能整合⽽成的系統，稱之為微機電
系統 (Microelectromechanical systym, 或簡稱  MEMS) ，也有⼈稱之為微系統技術
(MicroSystem Technology, 或簡稱  MST) ；⽽製程技術也由早期依附於半導體製程，發展到
已有專屬  MEMS 的加⼯技術。⼀般咸認為微機電系統除了本⾝是⼀項重要的科技外，它也將是
未來許多⾼科技產品所仰賴的關鍵技術。由於製程具有相容的潛⼒，微加⼯技術製造的機械元
件，可以和半導體製程製造之電⼦線路整合  (integrate) 於同⼀矽晶片，形成⼀極微⼩的機
電整合系統。所以微機電系統具有下列優點： (1) 可將機械結構和電⼦線路整合， (2) 可批量
製造 (batch fabrication) 使成品造價降低且品質均⼀， (3) 縮⼩成品尺⼨且增⾼精度， (4)
系統整體設計製造使可靠度提⾼；  因此微機電系統被應⽤在許多低成本的感測器和致動器。
⽬前和微機電技術相關的應⽤有：壓⼒計、加速計、陀螺儀、濕度計、流量計、噴墨頭、數位光
切換晶片等等，也廣泛應⽤於⼿持式電⼦  ( 如  智慧型⼿機、平板電腦、 Wii 等等 ) 、消費性電⼦
(如單槍投影機、噴墨印表機等等 ) 、⾞⽤電⼦  ( 如安全氣囊、胎壓計、定位、防滑等等 ) 等產
品。預期未來微機電技術結合感測、無線通信、雲端計算、 AI 等技術，可進⼀步應⽤於智慧⽣
活、物聯網 (IoT, Internet of Things) 、⼯業 4.0 、⾃駕⾞等頗受矚⽬的領域。
由於以微加⼯技術製造的微機械元件，其設計和製程有密不可分的關係。因此，本課程有三個⽬
的：
(1) 希望將  MEMS 的製作過程介紹給沒有修過積體電路和薄膜製程相關課程的同學，
(2) 如何利⽤這些基本製程作出我們所設計的元件，
(3) 討論  MEMS 在設計、製造、及應⽤時可能產⽣的問題。
因此本課程的安排依序為 :
(1) 積體電路的單元製程，例如 : photolithography, etching, and deposition 等等
(2) 利⽤這些單元製程發展出來的數種微加⼯製程 , 例如 : bulk micromachining,
surface micromachining, 和  LIGA 等等
(3) 舉例說明如何利⽤這些微加⼯基本製程來設計製造微機械元件
(4) 討論  MEMS 在設計製造的過程以及實際應⽤時可能產⽣的相關問題
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
講義  (http://mdl.pme.nthu.edu.tw/NTHU_PME_lab_CHT/links.html)

科號  Course Number ： 11010PME 513100學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：燃燒學概論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Introduction to Combustion
任課教師  Instructor ：劉通敏
上課時間  Time ： R4R5R6 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  209 ／ 24
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
燃燒學在機械、化⼯以及航太⼯程問題上存在著很多有趣的應⽤，其所牽涉到的基礎學科很
廣，包括：流體⼒學、熱⼒學、熱傳學、質傳學、化學動⼒學、多相流以及⼯程數學等等。燃
燒學概論的課程，⼀開始先以專章介紹關於⼀個反應系統之反應流體的保守⽅程式和其之簡
化，接著分章介紹基礎火焰反應⾏為：第⼆章層流預混火焰結構與應⽤；第三章預混火焰於爆
燃現象之應⽤；第四、第五章為層流非預混火焰（或稱擴散火焰）結構及其於噴流火焰與油滴
燃燒的應⽤。在上述主要內容的介紹中隨時輔以質傳學、流體⼒學、熱傳學、化學動⼒學、多
相流以及氣體動⼒學等基礎學科之補充教材。

McGraw Hill,2012.

中文名稱  Course Title ：實驗熱流學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Experimental methods in Thermo-Fluid Science
任課教師  Instructor ：黃智永
上課時間  Time ： F5F6F7 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  209 ／ 24
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course aims to provide a comprehensive view of theory and application of
experimental techniques for thermo-fluid measurements. Computer data
acquisition, pressure, temperature, and velocity measurements with advanced
experimental techniques like particle image velocimetry (PIV),
pressure/temperature-sensitive paint (PSP/TSP) will be included, as well as
flow visualization.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Textbook: Class notes
三、參考書籍 (References)
Recommended references:
‧ Fluid Mechanics Measurements, R. Goldstein
‧ Particle Image Velocimetry, M. Raffel, C. E. Willert, S. T. Wereley, J.
Kompenhans
‧ Pressure and Temperature Sensitive Paints, T. Liu, J. Sullivan
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture, labs, and course project
Course project: Teams of up to two/three, select a topic which is interesting
to you and your teammate. Use the skill learned from the course, design and
execute experiment to acquire the necessary information for your project.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Topics:
Introduction
Measurement uncertainty
Pressure measurement
Velocity measurement
Temperature measurement
Flow visualization
Pre-designed lab for calibration and data analysis
Pre-designed lab for wind tunnel measurement
Pre-designed lab for water tunnel measurement
Course project
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Grading: Midterm 20%, Final project 45%, HW 10%, and Labs 25%

科號  Course Number ： 11010PME 520100學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 50
中文名稱  Course Title ：線性系統理論
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Linear System Theory
任課教師  Instructor ：⽩明憲
上課時間  Time ： W3R3R4 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  201 ／ 63
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
SYLLABUS
Linear System Theory and Design
Bai, Mingsian R. Office: Room 622 Phone: (03)5742915
Lab: Room 505, (03)5742599
Email: msbai@pme.nthu.edu.tw
Web: http://tea.pme.nthu.edu.tw/
COURSE DEscriptION
This course covers theory and design of linear systems. Mathematical
descriptions
of linear systems using state-space equations are introduced. Notions of
controllability and observability are covered. Design using state feedback and
estimation is discussed.
TOPICS
1. Introduction
2. Mathematical descriptions of systems
3. Linear algebra
4. State-space solutions and realizations
5. Stability
6. Controllability and observability
7. Minimal realizations and coprime fractions
8. State feedback and estimators
GRADING POLICY
HW 40%
Midterm exam 30%
Final exam 30%
100%
TEXTBOOK
Chi-Tsong Chen, 2013, Linear System Theory and Design, 4th ed., Oxford
University
Press, New York.

中文名稱  Course Title ：數位控制系統

⼯⼀  108／ 100
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This course provides the students with basic knowledge in discrete-time control
systems. It covers the introduction of discrete-time systems, z-transform,
sampling and reconstruction, open-loop/closed-loop discrete-time systems, time-
response characteristics, stability analysis techniques, and digital controller
design. Students will also learn how to apply control theory to real
engineering problems via Matlab simulations and Lab assignments.
Pre-requisite: Control Systems ( 控制系統 )
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Phillips, Charles L., and H. Troy Nagle. Digital control system analysis and
design, 4th Edition, Pearson, 2014.
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. Landau, Ioan Doré, and Gianluca Zito. Digital control systems: design,
identification and implementation. Springer Science & Business Media, 2007.
2. Franklin, Gene F., J. David Powell, and Michael L. Workman. Digital control
of dynamic systems. Vol. 3. Menlo Park, CA: Addison-wesley, 1998.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
課堂投影片 , ⿊板講解與演習
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Introduction of discrete-time systems
2. Z-transform
3. Sampling and reconstruction
4. Open-loop/closed-loop discrete-time systems
5. Time-response characteristics
6. Stability analysis techniques
7. Digital controller design
8. Pole-Assignment Design and State Estimation
9. System Identification
10. Optimal Control
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Homework assignments (25%), Midterms(30%), Final exam(40%), and Lab
assignments (10%)

http://elearn.nthu.edu.tw

中文名稱  Course Title ：微奈米系統之感測與致動
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Sensing and Actuation in Miniaturized Systems
任課教師  Instructor ：劉承賢  Cheng-Hsien Liu
上課時間  Time ： M2M3M4 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  216 ／ 63

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
PME5230-Sensing and Actuation in Miniaturized Systems ( 微奈米系統之感測與致動 )
3 Units (3 學分 )
Instructor: Cheng-Hsien Liu ( 授課老師 : 劉承賢 )
http://mx.nthu.edu.tw/~chhsliu/transducer_new/PME5230_Liu.html
Course objectives:(Lectures will be given in English and your oral
presentation will be requested in English)
The Goal of the course is to provide senior and graduate students with the
basic concepts and principles of sensing and actuation in miniaturized
systems, which mostly use integrated circuit fabrication for their
realization. Categories of sensors and actuators include Mechanical,
microfluidics, Lab on Chip (for biological applications) etc. Basic mechanism
of transduction, micro/nanofabrication techniques, and relative merits of the
different technologies will be addressed. This course will be research
oriented and focuses on paper survey.

Textbook/ Required Class material:
My class notes (on web downloadable files)
Proceedings of Transducers (will be given on class)
Proceedings of MicroTAS (will be given on class)

1.Gregory Kovacs, "Micromachined Transducers Sourcebook," McGraw-Hill, 1998
(highly recommended)
2."Microsystems Design” by Stephen Senturia (ISBN 0-7923-7246-8)
3."Fundamentals of BioMEMS and Medical Microdevices” by Steven Saliterman
(ISBN 0-8194-5977-1)

⼀、課程說明  (Course Description)
This course introduces students to the fundamentals, problem-solving methods, knowledge and reasoning, and
learning paradigms of artificial intelligence. Topics covered include intelligent agents, uninformed and
informed search, genetic algorithm, games, knowledge based systems, propositional logic, machine learning,
and neural networks.
Goals:
1. Learn the fundamentals and technologies of AI
2. Learn to use AI approaches to solve practical and engineering problems
3. Establish the foundation for future use, study, and research of AI
Prerequisite: Computer Programming
You must have reasonable programming ability in C, C++, Java, or Python.
*There will be a tutorial and a test on Python programming (control of flow , loops, functions, arrays, etc.) in
the second week.

科號  Course Number ： 11010PME 545900學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：製程診斷與分析
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Process Diagnosis and Analysis
任課教師  Instructor ：林⼠傑  Shih-Chieh Lin
上課時間  Time ： W2W3W4 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  213 ／ 63
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
在現實的⼯作環境中 , 我們會發現以往在書本上所學得的理論 , 公式所計算出來的結果與實際發
⽣的永遠有⼤⼩不⼀的差距 , 這些差異經常源⾃於難以預測的變異 . 變異經常影響實際的結果並
造成困擾 , ⽽本課程的⽬的便是介紹⼀些⽤於偵測變異發⽣的⽅法 , 及消除變異的⽅法 . 由於這
些⽅法往往需藉由實驗來驗證 , 因此如何設計規劃分析實驗也是本課的重點
本課程適合⼤三以上學⽣修習 , 研究⽣未曾修習品質管制及統計課程者 , 應修習本課 . 您在未來
的⼯作時 , 必會發現這⾨課會是非常實⽤的課程 .
In reality, we will find that the results estimated or calculated based on
the
equation or theory introduced in text books are somehow different from those
measured experimentally. Frequently the difference is because of the
unpredictable variance. The goal of this course is to introduce approaches
to
identify unpredicted process variance and methodologies to eliminate these
variances. Frequently, these approaches or methodologies had to be verified
experimentally. Therefore, how to design and analyze experimental results is
the other major issue in this study.
This course is recommended for junior, senior and graduate student who did not
have much knowledge about statistics and quality control. You will find that
this is a very useful course when you start your career.
上課課程內容 (course content):
A. Fundamental Concepts and Methods
Evolution of quality design and control
Conceptual framework for quality
Statistical methods and probability concept for data characterization
B. Process Control and Improvement
Conceptual framework for statistical process control
Construction and interpretation of Shewhart control chart
Importance of rational sampling
Process capability assessment
C. product Design and Improvement
Conceptual framework for planned experimentation
Design, interpretation and analysis of two-level factorial design
Two level fractional factorial design
Model building for design and improvement
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Statistical quality design and control :/contemporary concepts and methods,
Richard E. DeVor, Tsong-how Chang, John W. Sutherland, New York :Maxwell
Macmillan International,/c1992./
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. Statistical Principles of Research Design and Analysis, Robert O. Kuehl,
Duxbury Press
2. Design and Analysis of Experiments, Montgomery,
3. ⽥⼝式品質⼯程導論 , 鐘清章校訂 , 品質管制學會
4. Experimental methods for Engineers, Holman, Mc Graw Hill
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
授課 ,討論
Lectures and discussion

科號  Course Number ： 11010PME 625000學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 35
中文名稱  Course Title ：非線性控制系統
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Nonlinear Control systems
任課教師  Instructor ：王培仁
上課時間  Time ： T6T7T8 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  214 ／ 63
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Syllabus:
Simulation Tools- Matlab and Simulink; Phase Plane, Mathematical
Background, PID Controller, Tuning Methods, Lyapunov Stability Theorem,
Sliding Controller, Adaptive Systems, Self-Tuning Controller, Model Reference
Adaptive Controller.
Course Descriptions:
This course is intended for graduate level MS/ Ph. D. students who are
interested in advanced control theory and practices. The course is prepared
with basic feedback control background starting from PID controllers. Since
tuning and nonlinearity are main obstacles in control practice, the textbook
is selected for engineering students rather for theoreticians’.
Textbook:
W. E. Dixon, A. Behal, D. M. Dawson and S. P. Nagarkatti, Nonlinear Control of
Engineering Systems- A Lyapunov-based Approach, Springer Science+Business
Media, ISBN 978-1-4612-6581-8, 2003.
J. E. Slotine and W. Li, Applied Nonlinear Control, Pearson Ed., ISBN 986-
154-138-1.
References:
1) M. Johnson and M. H. Moradi, Ed. PID Control, New Identification and
Design Methods, Springer Ver., ISBN 978-1-85233-702-5, 2005.
2) K. J. Astrom and T. Hagglund, 2nd Ed., PID Controllers: Theory, Design
and Tuning, ISBN 978-1-55617-516-9, Instr. Soc. of America, 1995.

科號  Course Number ： 11010PME 634500學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：破裂⼒學
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Fracture Mechanics
任課教師  Instructor ：黃琮暉
上課時間  Time ： W6W7W8 上課教室  Room ：⼯⼀  209 ／ 24
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
Due to the regulations, the first two weeks will be online via the google link:
meet.google.com/jsu-rifr-zyq (same lecture time). For registered students, please
check eLearn website of NTHU to find more information.
Course Description:
Fracture mechanics is an important tool used to analyze and improve the performance
of mechanical components. The vast increase in the use of high strength metals
and the reduction in design safety factors motivated many researchers to
investigate the mechanics of the fracture. As a result, Fracture Mechanics, a new
branch of materials mechanics, has emerged and acted as a primary approach to
controlling fracture and fatigue failures in structures. The present course has two
aims:
(a) To provide the physical mechanics and the mathematical theory of fracture
mechanics.
(b) To present different fracture mechanics applications to practical engineering
problems.
Prerequisites:
Elasticity or advanced mechanics of materials.
Grading Evaluation:
Homework 30%; Midterm 30%; Final 30%; Final Report 10%
Lecture Materials:
There is no textbook in this class. Hand-written notes will be given in the
lectures with black-board type instruction.
Reference Books:
Fracture Mechanics: Fundamentals and Applications by T.L. Anderson, (CRC Press,
1998)
Advanced fracture mechanics by M.F. Kanninen and C.H. Popelar (Oxford University
Press, 1985)
Elements of Fracture Mechanics by P. Kumar, (Mc Graw Hill Education, 2009)
Elementary engineering fracture mechanics, D. Broek (Martinus Nijhoff Publication,
1986)

科⽬英文名稱  Introduction to Precision Medicine
任課教師  黃玠誠、陳致真、周裕珽
⼀、課程說明
伴隨式診斷與藥物的結合及次世代定序的進展已形成精準醫學的治療⽅法也影響藥物開發的模式。奈
米材料的應⽤使藥物的釋放更為精準及安全。新穎檢測平台的開發及應⽤使分⼦診斷更為靈敏。影像
醫學及⼈⼯智能的結合使病灶辨識的精準度及診療速度⼤幅提升。硼中⼦捕獲達成核醫於精準醫療的
應⽤。本課程結合校內外精準醫學領域專家、臨床醫師、業界實務講師帶領學員瞭解精準醫學。
⼆、指定⽤書  NA

Library
2. Precision medicine in cancer therapy/edited by Daniel D. Von Hoff, Haiyong
Han. Springer, 2019. eBook accessible at NTHU Library
3. Oncology in the precision medicine era: value-based medicine/edited by Ravi
Salgia. Springer, 2020. eBook accessible at NTHU Library

1. 伴隨式診斷及癌症精準醫學之進展
2. 次世代定序於癌症精準醫學之應⽤
3. 液態活檢於癌症及⺟胎精準醫學之應⽤
4. 微⽣物基因體學於精準醫學之應⽤
5. 蛋⽩質體學與代謝體學於精準醫學之應⽤
6. 基因編輯於基因療法及分⼦診斷之應⽤
7. 細胞治療於精準醫學之應⽤
8. 硼中⼦捕獲於癌症精準醫學之介紹
9. 影像醫學與⼈⼯智慧於精準醫學之應⽤
10. 奈米材料於精準醫學之應⽤
11. 微機電系統、微感測器、微制動器、微流體⽣物晶片於精準醫學之應⽤

科號  Course Number ： 11010QF 320400學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 79
中文名稱  Course Title ：⾼等微積分⼆
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Advanced Calculus II
任課教師  Instructor ：鄭志豪
上課時間  Time ： R1R2R3 上課教室  Room ：綜三  203 ／ 110
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
計財系的⾼等微積分⼀及⼆是⼀學年課程 , 設定的⽬標是建立⼀個扎實的數學基礎以瞭解⾼階
計量⾦融理論如選擇權的定價模型 Black-Sholes Model 等 . 本⾨課先從邏輯開始介紹 , 延續
⼤⼀微積分課桯 , 將連續 , 微分及積分的定義及結論推廣到更⾼維度的歐氐空間上 . 為達此⽬
的, 我們需要⼀些嚴格的定義及⼀些來⾃於拓撲學的基本概念 . 緊緻的概念是拓撲中最重要的
概念之⼀  , 也是許多定理的基本條件 . 我們會研究緊緻集與連續函數之間的關係 . 幾乎所有
的⾦融模型都需利⽤到機率論與統計學 , 我們也會介紹測度理論 , 這是機率論的基礎 . 建立
在第⼀學期的基礎上 , 第⼆學期我們會推導 Black-Sholes Model 及其數學解法 , 因此會介紹
⼀些 Fourier transform 及 heat equation.
相較於數學系的⾼等微積分 , 本⾨課傾向介紹與應⽤⽅⾯有更直接聯繫的數學 , 故⼀些較理論
的部份會被略過 .
這⾨課是邁向⾼階數學的起點 . 課程難度⾼ , 對抽象思維的訓練非常扎實 . 同學需有投入⼤量時
間的⼼理準備 . 我們幾乎每⼀堂課都會介紹⼀個新的概念 .
⽽對新概念的掌握 , 需要經過五階段 :
瞭解 ---> 解構 ----> 沉澱 ----> 吸收 ----> 應⽤
這些都需要時間 . 雖然這⾨課只有 3 學分 , 但應將之視為 8 學分的課 , 其他課不要修太多 .
以下為基本內容 :
1. Riemann integrals
2. Lebesgue measure and Lebesgue integrals
3. Fourier transform and the heat equation
4. Black-Scholes model
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Advanced calculus II for quantitative finance,
by Jyh-Haur Teh
請到以下課程網⾴下載 :
http://www.math.nthu.edu.tw/~jyhhaur
三、參考書籍 (References)
1. Real Mathematical Analysis, by Pugh.
2. Elementary Classical Analysis(second edition), by J. Marsden & M.
Hoffman.
以下兩本是比較多⼈知道的⾼微課本 , 年代較久 , 有些缺點 , 並非適合⼤部份⼈ .
近年新的書本已有很多 , 同學可參考適合⾃⼰的書 .
(1) Principles of Mathematical Analysis, by W. Rudin.
(2) Mathematical Analysis, by T. Apostol.

中文名稱  Course Title ：⾦融科技專題研習
英文名稱  Course English Title ： FinTech Projects Workshop
任課教師  Instructor ：翁禮祺
上課時間  Time ： W2W3W4 上課教室  Room ：台積 204 ／ 70
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
【課程⽬標】 : 將⾦融、資訊，運營、管理各種科學的綜合應⽤。
【學習成效】 :
藉此課程能讓學⽣具備以下⾯向的學識涵養：
1. ⾦融領域 (Financial Domain) 知識、
2. 科技創新 (Technology Innovation) 思維、
3. 商務發展 (Business Models) 趨勢。
4. 能夠掌握當前國際⾦融科技最新之實務脈動，分析並預測未來可能發展。
【教學⽅式  Teaching Approach 】
包括 (但不限 ) 以下各部分 :
第⼀部分 :< 基礎課題講授 >
1.上課講義 ppt 介紹⾦融科技之技術、應⽤、服務和商業模式等各項基礎議題，
2. 並依上課內容指定書本閱讀章節，
第⼆部分 :< 專題企劃 >
1. 進⾏⾦融科技專題分組，⽅向擬定、商業模式設計，科技導入，效益評估，書⾯以及⼝頭報
告，
2. 期中以及期末組別報告，以⾦融領域專業知識、  資訊科技兩者共同輔助實現專題。
3. 導入專案設計客群分析模型  – SPIN
4. 導入專案設計效益思考模型  – FABE.
第三部分 :< 業師演講 >
1. 視學⽣專案⽅向，邀請相關實務界領袖與菁英演講，與學⽣交流互動，加深學習效果。
第四部分 :< 媒體素養、職場即戰⼒培養 >
1.每堂課內特別著重媒體閱讀培訓、應⽤解讀
2.適當課程說明⾦融科技與就業能⼒培訓與訓練
【評分標準  Grading 】
期末分數為以下各項項⽬總和
1. 課程參與  (15%)

英文名稱  Course English Title ： Financial Econometrics
任課教師  Instructor ：黃裕烈

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This is the required M.A. course for quantitative method. The
materials in this course are arranged according to the estimation
methods: least squares method, quasi-maximum likelihood method,
and bayesian analysis. Each chapter will concentrate on a
particular estimating method which includes various financial
models as examples and exercises. I hope at the end of this
semester you will find my efforts are indeed effective. Note that
we will NOT have the time to review basic mathematical and
statistical concepts in this course. Thus, students who are not
familiar with these mathematical tools (e.g., linear algebra,
measure theories) are encouraged to read related textbooks and
lecture notes on these topics (see below).
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Lecture notes
Philip, H.F. & D. van Dijk, (2000). Non-linear time series models
in empirical finance, Cambridge.
Tsay, R.S., (2002). Analysis of financial time series, Wiley.

Kuan, C.M., (2000).
Introduction to Econometric Theor and Methods,
Lecture notes. (the pdf file is available at
www.sinica.edu.tw/as/ssrc/ckuan).
Baxter, M. & A. Rennie, (1997).
Financial calculus: An introduction to derivative pricing,
Cambridge.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)

1.1 Classical least squares theory

1.4 Models for panel data
1.5 Asymptotic properties of the OLS estimator

2.1 Quasi-maximum likelihood theory
2.2 MA models and ARCH models
2.3 Asymptotic properties of the QMLE
Bayesian analysis
3.1 Gibbs sampling
3.2 Markov Switching Models

科號  Course Number ： 11010QF 521400學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 30
中文名稱  Course Title ：數理⾦融
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Mathematical finance
任課教師  Instructor ：黃裕烈
上課時間  Time ： T2T3T4 上課教室  Room ：台積 223 ／ 72
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
This is the first course of four sequential courses: Financial Mathematics, Discrete Time Financial
Mathematics, Stochastic Financial Theory, and Continuous-Time Financial Mathematics. The four courses are
designed to provide the students with a solid background in financial engineering - a topic which becomes
more and more important for financial analysts. Financial engineering discusses how to price (evaluate) and
hedge (eliminate) risks associated with the uncertainties of asset prices such as stocks, interest rates, credits,
energy, loans, insurance, etc.
The Financial Mathematics course will start from introducing some basic optimization methods, and applying
them to financial problems. It will also use economic theories to explain how individuals make decisions under
uncertainty. The course will examine the Binomial and Black-Scholes option models from the perspective of
mathematical programming, and integrate three important but not well-understood propositions: Risk-Neutral
Valuation Principle (in finance), Arbitrage (Gordan) Theorem (in mathematical programming), and Martingale
Property (in statistics). The outlines of the course are:
1. Optimization without constraints (one and multi-variables.)
2. Optimization with equality constraints: Lagrangian method.
3. Optimization with inequality constraints: Kuhn-Tucker conditions (mean-variance frontier, CAPM, state-
contingent models, mathematical programming and the Black-Scholes model.).
4. Stochastic calculus (chapter 2 of Baxter et al., and chapters 1, 2 and part of 3 of Shreve I.)
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
三、參考書籍 (References)
None.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lectures.
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
1. Optimization without constraints (one and multi-variables.)
2. Optimization with equality constraints: Lagrangian method.
3. Optimization with inequality constraints: Kuhn-Tucker conditions (mean-variance frontier, CAPM, state-
contingent models, mathematical programming and the Black-Scholes model.).
5. Stochastic calculus (chapter 2 of Baxter et al., and chapters 1, 2 and part of 3 of Shreve I.)
六、成績考核 (Evaluation)
Mid-term and final exams.

科號  Course Number ： 11010SOC 537200學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ： 15
中文名稱  Course Title ：⺠族誌選讀與實作
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Selective Readings and Practice in Ethnography
任課教師  Instructor ：洪意凌
上課時間  Time ： M7M8M9 上課教室  Room ：⼈社 C306 ／ 30
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⺠族誌選讀與實作
1920到 30 年代，芝加哥因為⼯業快速擴張⽽⽇益繁榮，吸引了許多⼈從美國南⽅移居於此。因為注意
到都市中的種種
變動，⼀些社會學者以芝加哥為⽥野，探討都市環境如何形塑社會關係，重要的案例包括計程⾞司
機、無家者、都市中
的⿊⼈社群、幫派、貧⺠區。這些早期芝加哥學派的研究與後來的符號互動論 (symbolic interactionism)
⼀起深刻地影
響了今天⺠族誌的樣貌。
這個學期我們選讀四個⺠族誌書寫的重要主題 -- 「街道⽣活」、「種族、階級與都市邊緣」、「勞
動」、「社會機構與
社會控制」，每個主題各選讀⼀些精彩的⺠族誌。我們以兩週⼀部⺠族誌的速度細讀，  藉以掌握作品
所提供的社會⽣活
細節，以及理解這些社會⽣活細節如何能夠⽤來分析⼈們獨特的意義⽣產過程。
⺠族誌並不只是⼀種描述。研究者在寫作⽥野筆記的時候，也是同時在主動地詮釋進⾏之中的社會  ⽣
活，並把這些經驗
和詮釋轉換成不曾去過那裡的⼈也可以取⽤的文本。在本課程中，除了深入閱讀當代⺠族誌的經典作
品並寫作閱讀筆記
以外，也要求同學選擇⼀個⾃⼰有興趣的⽥野，寫作⽥野觀察筆記。我們會在課堂上共同閱讀同學的
筆記，藉此⼀起演
練觀察、  詮釋、分析、理論建構等⺠族誌的重要技藝。
學期評分
課堂導讀  20%
閱讀筆記  20%
⽥野筆記  20%
期末報告  40%

科號  Course Number ： 11010SOC 578500學分  Credit ： 3 ⼈數限制  Size of Limit ：
中文名稱  Course Title ：科學與技術研究
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Science and Technology Studies
任課教師  Instructor ：林宗德

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
11010SOC 578500
科技與社會研究
Science and Technology Studies
上課時間 : Rn56
上課教室 : ⼈社院 C203
授課教師 : 林宗德
本課程介紹科學與技術研究的背景與主要取徑。科學研究 (Science Studies) ，與科學與技術研究 (Science
and Technology Studies) 、科技與社會 (Science, Technology, and Society) 等等研究領域的研究對象和取向
多所重疊，不同的說法或是強調科技研發與普及過程的複雜性、或者強調介入與實踐⾯向的重要性。
經過近半世紀的發展，該領域的理論語彙與個案研究已經多不勝數。本課程希望達成三個⽬的。⼀是
透過科學哲學和 STS 的觀點，瞭解科學如何進⾏ ; ⼆是瞭解主要的研究取徑和理論語彙 ; 三是透過個案
研究的探討，培養以科學技術活動為研究對象的操作能⼒。
成績考核 :
⼀、課堂參與討論 : 20% 。
⼆、課堂報告 : 每次上課由兩位同學負責報告指定閱讀書⽬。報告的重點在於分析作者的論據是否充
分、論證是否合理，並且提出⾃⼰的問題及觀點。每位同學報告時間最⻑⼆⼗分鐘。佔 10% 。
三、 memo: 每次上課針對閱讀文獻，撰寫兩⾴ (A4 ， 12 級字 ) 以內的評論，並提出兩個討論問題，於該
週上課當天下午⼀點以前上傳⾄ Moodle 。佔 30% 。
四、期末報告 : 可以是理論的回顧與評論、經驗研究的計畫，或是初步的⽥野觀察和分析。八千到⼀
萬字。佔 40% 。

本課程為社會學研究所碩⼠班⼄組⼀、⼆年級必修零學分的課程。我們邀請當代中國研究各領域知名
專家、學者前來分享思路視⾓、研究成果與實踐經驗，針對特定議題進⾏深入分析與問答討論，同時
補充滋養正式授課課程。修課同學需要每次出席，盡量參與討論，輪流撰寫演講摘要，並呈現為學
術通訊報導。課程數週進⾏⼀次，俟聯繫安排後以 email 通知。

⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
在指導教授之指導下，就各別選定之題⽬進⾏有系統研究，期獲得在該領域知識與技術上之成果。
⼆ 教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
學⽣在教授研究室學習各種研究技巧，解決研究上遭遇之問題。
三、教學進度 (Syllabus)
由教授指定
四、成績考核 (Evaluation)
由論文素質，研究態度決定。

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
課程說明 (Course Description)
1. 介紹⼀些常⽤的應⽤機率模型  ( 如離散型的  Markov Chains, Poisson Process, Renewal
Theory, 及連續型的 Markov processes 及  Brownian Motion 等模型 ) 之理論與應⽤。
2. 主要⽬標是培養學⽣在思考機率問題時之直覺與洞察⼒。
3.須具初等機率論基礎。
指定書籍 (Text Books)
Ross, S. M. (2014). Introduction to Probability Models, Academic
Press, 11th Edition, New York.
or
Ross, S. M. (2018). Introduction to Probability Models, Academic
Press, 12th Edition, New York.

Modeling, Third edition, Academic Press, New York.
教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
講授與討論
教學進度 (Syllabus)
CONTENTS:
1. Random Variables, Conditional Probability and Conditional Expectation
2. Discrete-time Markov Chains (DTMC)
3. Exponential Distribution and Poisson Process
4. Renewal Theory
5. Continuous-time Markov Chains (CTMC)
6. Reliability Theory
7. Brownian Motion and stationary process

中文名稱  Course Title ：品質管制
英文名稱  Course English Title ： Quality Control
任課教師  Instructor ：黃榮⾂  Longcheen Huwang
上課時間  Time ： T6T7T8 上課教室  Room ：綜三  834 ／ 45
課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程說明 (Course Description)
The course will introduce elementary statistical process control techniques
which include various control charts and related statistical theory. In particular, it will cover elementary
Shewhart-type, CUSUM, and EWMA control charts and some MCUSUM and MEWMA control charts.
⼆、指定⽤書 (Text Books)
Introduction to Statistical Process Control (2014) by Peihua Qiu
三、參考書籍 (References)
Statistical Quality Control, A Modern Introduction by D. C. Montgomery, 7th Ed.
四、教學⽅式 (Teaching Method)
Lecture
五、教學進度 (Syllabus)
Lecture will complete Chapters 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 of the textbook.

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
STAT 6110 “Statistical Inference”
Course Outlines:
Weeks 1 – 3 : Introduction
Review of some distributional results
Exponential family , location-scale family and other classes of
distributions, sufficiency, minimal sufficiency, Convex loss function
Week 4 –7 : Finite-sample properties
Unbiasedness
Information inequality
Equivariance
Minimax, admissibility
Bayes estimation
Weeks 8 – 11 : Large-sample properties
Asymptotic normality
Consistency
Efficiency
Weeks 12 – 17 : Testing hypotheses
Neyman-Pearson fundamental lemma
UMP and UMPU tests
Invariance
Likelihood ratio tests
General linear hypothesis
Grading:
Weekly assignment (30%), Midterm Exam (35%) Final Exam (35%)

Course title: 青少年⼼理學  Psychology of Adolescence
Institute: Center for Teacher Education

Instructor: Yii-Nii Lin, Ph.D.

Course Purpose:
Adolescent Psychology is a course designed to provide an overview of the basic
theoretical components of adolescent physical, mental, sociocultural
activities, as well as to foster increased of understanding of the
interactions between adolescent internal mental activities and external
environment.
Course objectives: This is an introductory course and so will cover a broad
range of material. With this in mind, the objectives are to provide students
with:
1. Understanding the definition of adolescence and the differentiation
between adolescent stage and other stages of human life cycle.
2. Understanding adolescent development within a life cycle, and the
changes of physical, mental and social status at life stages.
3. Understanding adolescent mechanism of mental health and the
interactions among biological, psychological, and sociocultural factors.
4. Understanding concepts and applications of adolescent psychological
assessment/evaluation/testing.
5. Understanding different ways of enhancing adolescent mental health
through biological, psychological, social, spiritual and cultural aspects.
6. Understanding guidance, counseling, education, and other
services/resources in order to assist adolescent development.
Indicators of Competency in Teacher Education:
Psychological and counseling competency (being aware of student
characteristics and providing timing guidance)
Educational concern, research and multicultural competency (multicultural
knowledge, attitude and skills)
Competency of Self-growth and development (passion in professional life and
growth in personal life)

Course Format:
The first half of the class will consist of didactic presentation and group
discussion. The second half of the class will be practice- and activity-
oriented. In brief, the course will combine the use of lectures, discussion,
and experiential activities.
Course Requirements:
1. Actively participate in class discussion, activities, and
demonstrations.
2. Read the selected assignments in their entirety, coming to class
prepared to discuss the readings as outlined on the schedule.
3. Read related news/messages of Adolescent Psychology and share them
with members in classes.
4. Complete two reaction papers, a project, a group presentation, and a
final exam. Turn in the paper and project on time.
5. The format of the reaction paper includes contents, analyses and
discussions of a case or an issue related to psychology for adolescence.
The format of the project will contain a topic, adolescent cases
(interviewees), analyses and discussions, and self-retrospections related to
the topic/case(s).
The format of the group presentation will contain a topic, contents, analyses
and discussions, and applications to psychology for adolescence.
The form of the final exam will be discussed in class.
6. No mobile phones or 3C electronics in classes.

20

Course Purpose:
Mental Health is a course designed to provide an overview of the basic
theoretical components of mental health, classifications of mental disorders,
and to foster increased of understanding of the interactions between human
mental functioning and external environment.
Course objectives:
This is an introductory course and so will cover a broad range of material.
With this in mind, the objectives are to provide students with:
1. Understanding the definition of and the differentiation between mental
health and mental illness.
2. Understanding the mental mechanism of interactions among biological,
psychosocial, cultural and spiritual factors.
3. Understanding the dynamics of psychological/behavioral responses to
external variations out of the environment.
4. Understanding development of mental disorders and their symptoms and
effects.
5. Understanding different ways of enhancing mental health through
biological, psychosocial, cultural and spiritual aspects.
6. Understanding that how counseling/psychotherapy and other mental
health services could be applied to enhance human mental health.
Indicators of Competency in Teacher Education:
Psychological and counseling competency (being aware of student
characteristics and providing timing guidance) 30%, Educational concern,
research and multicultural competency (multicultural knowledge, attitude and
skills) 30%, Competency of Self-growth and development (passion in
professional life and growth in personal life) 40%

It is the intent of the instructor to present material and activities that are
respectful of diversity: gender, sexuality, disability, age, socio-economic
status, ethnicity, race, and culture.

Course Format:
The first half of the class will consist of didactic presentation and group
discussion. The second half of the class will be practice- and activity-
oriented. The course will combine the use of lectures, discussion, and
experiential activities.
Course Requirements:
1. Actively participate in class discussion, activities, and
demonstrations.
2. Read the selected assignments in their entirety, coming to class
prepared to discuss the readings as outlined on the schedule.
3. Complete two reaction papers (no more than 2 pages), a group
presentation of a specific disorder/issue in mental health and its hard copy
(no more than 5 pages), an individual project (designing for interviewing a
case with a mental health problem/disorder and conducting this case analysis),
an exercise of caring about a person who has a mental health problem/disorder
during this semester, and a sharing of this exercise in the class.
4. *Your paper, report and project should be completed and submitted on
time. Your paper and report could be formatted in 12 font, double-space, and
one-inch margin.
5. * The topic of group presentation should focus on a specific
disorder/issue in mental health. Criteria of grading include that (1)
significance of the topic, (2) the application of theories, models and
concepts for designing, discussion and analyses, (3) creativity, (4) the
utility of this group project, (5) the style and fluency of presentation, and
(6) group cooperation.
Grading:
Attendance and participation 20
Reaction Paper (two) 20
Individual Project (Interview and Report) 20
Group Presentation 20
Exercise and Sharing 20
Total
100 points

課程⼤綱  Syllabus ：
⼀、課程⽬標
1.瞭解國⼩數學課程的變⾰及改⾰的趨勢。
2.⼗⼆年國教數學領綱學習重點的解讀與詮釋。
3.瞭解國⼩數學教材在各領域（數與量 ( 數與計算、量與實測 ) 、空間與形狀、關係、資料與不確
定性）教材之設計結構及教學重點。
4.提昇數學教學活動設計的能⼒。
5.增進有關數學知識、數學教學、學⽣學習數學的認知。
6.能適當地使⽤數學教具來輔助教學。
7.培養數學教學實務的能⼒。
⼆、教學進度
第⼀週  1. 合作學習演練、學習任務介紹與分組。
2.台灣數學教育課程之演變 ( 歷年課綱 )
3.⼗⼆年國⺠基本教育課綱簡介 ( 融入正六邊形摩斯比爾帶製作三⾯九項 ) 之素養導向教學模式介
紹。
4.網路相關資源簡介。
第⼆週  1. 教材分析三部曲演練討論
2.數概念認知發展理論介紹
3.「數與計算」領域－整數加減運算 ( 合成運思與部分整體運思 )
4.APOS學習理論介紹、數學臆測教學介紹。
第三週  1. 數與計算教材分析三部曲演練討論
2.數概念認知發展實例探討 - 部分整體運思與測量運思
3.「數與計算」領域 - 整數多位數加減運算。
4.整數計算之學⽣錯誤類型與評量診斷。
第四週  1. 數與計算教材分析三部曲演練討論
2.「數與計算」領域 - 整數乘除運算。
3.「數與計算」領域 - 分⼩數的數概念與整數關係的基本概念 - 初步體驗。
4.數學課綱之數與計算整數能⼒指標之發展
第五週  1. Lesh 溝通表徵的介紹。
2. 數與計算教材分析三部曲演練討論
3.數概念認知發展實例探討 - 測量運思。
4.「數與計算」領域－⼩數加減與整數倍運算。
5.「數與計算」領域－分數加減與整數倍運算。
第六週  1. 數與計算教材分析三部曲演練討論
2.數與計算」領域－整數相除得分數之情境類型。
3.分數與⼩數意義的種類與概念發展階段介紹
4.數與計算分數教材分析三部曲演練討論
5.數學課綱之數與計算⼩數能⼒指標之發展
第七週  1. 因倍數教材分析三部曲演練討論
2.數概念認知發展實例探討 - 比例運思
3.分⼩數倍概念與分數乘除運算發展研討。
4.上述概念之學⽣錯誤類型與評量診斷。
第八週  1. 比例教材分析三部曲演練討論。
2.比的意義種類介紹。

五、教學⽅式：
1.課前準備：針對數學主題進⾏歷年課程綱要分析。
2.課程進⾏：
2.1透過教材分析三步曲，進⾏教材比較、詮釋、省思、批判。
2.2探討相關概念之學⽣認知概念發展、學習理論與學⽣迷思概念。
2.3研讀相關數學概念之課程綱要發展脈絡。
2.4綜上，以 APOS 理論、與素養導向教學 ( 包含數學臆測教學 ) 重構數學教學活動設計討論。
課後省思：學習⽇誌
六、成績考核 ( 評量⽅式 )
1、上課表現及參與討論情形： 20% 。 ( 遲到⼀次總分扣  1 分、曠課⼀次扣  3 分 )
2、分組作業報告： 30% 。
2.1歷屆課程綱要分析
2.2教學活動設計 ( 融入上課所學之理論與實務概念 5% 、個⼈創意 5%)
2.3教學演⽰ ( 含教學簡案、學習單設計與教學表現 )
3.學習⽇誌： 30% 。 ( 個⼈在數學教材教法之上課⽇誌，包含：教學過程所發⽣的問題、得到的啟
發、⼼得與個⼈數學學習經驗的省思等。 )
4.教材教法測驗： 20% 。 ( 選擇題 )
